How do i convince my mom?

this is a dump account... needed to create this cus protection stuff if something happens... hopefully she changes her mind. you'll know what i mean. its in the **problem** part



so here is how it goes, there is a maharlikan bs going around in facebook ("Rkom main" is their page, try to search it) about like if you buy these stubs (yes, my mom fell for this if you have heard of this before. The green, yellow and whatnot) you have a guaranteed XXX,XXX,XXX amount of money right? so you buy a lot to multiply that amount is how i believe it works

so my mom believes this specific group and there are a lot groups out there. And runs with the same narrative where we have this secret/stolen? hundreds and thousands of gold then their "mahal na hari/ supremo / long bs names" will withdraw that but somehow she believes on this one and all is connected to marcos... somehow. I dont know if this is the full story there is something also about like marcos going to different countries for their banks to open their account to withdraw or something.... but the point is, the narrative is false

 idk how to change her mind on it and its been like a thorn in our relationship where she insists that they are real deal, and i kept saying "no ma, make it make sense if they're real, that amount of gold is..." and so on then i said at the end of our argument "make them come here then!"...

and you cannot believe my goddamn luck. They did. their group somehow sent like 6-7 people to our city to like conduct a meeting/or maybe invite more people?? and ma accomodates them and such wasting our money on those people. and happily, they left on the same day, but the fact that they came is scary to me because this would mean ma now grips tighter unto a belief that this is real. That the money is real since they came and the other fb groups aren't  

before all of this happened, she was just scrolling through facebook, learning about maharlikan narrative bs. And insults them behind the screen "sino naman magtitiwala sa mga ganyan2x, apaka pekeng peke talga" (somewhere along those lines). but then her mind changed when someone inside our church suddenly entices her to try and buy this color stubs in hopes of the XXX amount of money and to just try it out, she did. then she even listed my name (----mind you registering for this is kinda of a hassle----). yeah i know, the irony



so here's the actual **problem**,

the rkom main fb group says that by november 21-22, people should come to a place... (i forgot where but it is pretty far since it is in we need to fly and then travel in land when we got there. yes, a waste of money for a false hope. And a bad news since she is pretty persistent on her decision to go there together with me) to avail their stubs?

but the problem is not the stubs, the problem is they're offering a job, an IT one at that, and my ma pushes me to join since the salary is PHP 5mil, 1mil php each day. so from nov 21-22 while that availing of stubs is happening, she insists for me to train for the job. then after that i'll work for 5 days their to get the bag. she even plans to leave me alone cus she trusts me that much.

idk what to do, i just want to show her something, anything that that belief she is holding on to right now, to get rid of our financial instability,  is completely false. idk how to change her mind because we are utterly desperate in these times



These f-ing people irk me to my core. taking advantage of desperate people who needs desperate money, i hate them.

  


sorry for my bad english, I am making this at the heat of the moment

Looking for advice

31M I’ve had panic anxiety for a decade and I’ve been surviving. Had a few rough spurts but 10mg of lexapro and Xanax has always worked. This last event started a week ago and Xanax has not been working. I have one bottle of .5mg that’s from 2022 and one bottle from 2024. 

It starts with tingling/tickling sensation down both arms and the absolute worst panic attacks of my entire life. I went to the ER for two nights. No stroke. MRI of brain and spine mostly fine. Thyroid good. B12 fine (have pernicious anemia but shots are taken routinely). Blood sugar good. Literally everything fine. But I don’t feel right and feel like I’m dying. 

My primary doubled my lexapro to 20mg and I’m starting tonight. She also prescribed 1mg extended release Xanax that I can’t pick up until tomorrow. Tonight has been the absolute worst panic of my life. I took .5 and then .25 and then another .25mg of my 2024 Xanax and still nothing. Same tickling feels down my arms, adrenaline pumping. I don’t even feel tired. I have a stressful job but my life is pretty good, very supportive family and girlfriend and I just feel horrible I’m making them go through this and terrified I’m going to lose my job and life will fall apart. I’ve never experienced any panic like this and I feel like my body is screaming something is wrong and I keep wanting to go back to the hospital. My only hope now is that the Xanax wasn’t potent because it has always been my life saver and I don’t know how to survive without it. Please someone give me their experience. I just can’t see the light at the end of the tunnel and I can’t diagnose myself and I’m just so lost and scared

I am 24m, I have grown through my life in a very troubled environment which lead me to constantly keeping myself grounded, but also led to hyper vigilant tendencies. Lack of trust in my family and prior relationships. I will not go too into depth as I’m not really trying to play “woe-is-me”.

My current situation is that I was extra careful in following into my current relationship with someone who was my best friend, we’ve been together for about a year almost. I was certain I had found “the one”, so I visited her. She’s over 2000 miles away, Was a neet like me, was a loser in general, very pretty and very cute, doesn’t wear makeup, unfortunately doesn’t have friends and avoids her family, and you may be thinking, “no friends? jackpot”
No, I knew it would have it’s trouble, ofc i wouldn’t want her seeking male friends, we all understand the flawed concept of friendship with other genders, they lead to connections which lead to limerence. To find a group where your poor habits and thinking are validated by other sad people who were hurt or made to feel they weren’t good enough. She is avoidant herself and doesn’t really communicate well.

Looking for answers

Hi everyone! I want to preface this by saying I am under a psychiatrist’s care— I’m reaching out here for ideas to discuss with her.

I have severe panic attacks and social anxiety, 
exacerbated and caused by C-PTSD. I’ve tried a laundry list of medications— I had particularly bad reactions to antipsychotics and bipolar meds, which I think I never should have been prescribed. 

Right now I’m on Celexa, which is helping with my motivation and depression symptoms. But I keep having frequent and extreme panic attacks and anxiety episodes. Xanax is the only thing that can provide any relief for me. It feels like I have asthma and Xanax is my rescue inhaler. Propranolol had no effect at all, and Hydroxyzine made me very tired for several days without impacting my anxiety. 

I’m apprehensive about going off of Celexa because I’ve had such bad experiences with other medications, and it does help a little with the depression symptoms. It’s so embarrassing and difficult to ask for more Xanax— I don’t want to sound like an addict, I am just desperate for symptom relief. 

Are there any medications that act or feel similar to Xanax that you’re familiar with? Could I add anything to Celexa without running the risk of serotonin syndrome?

I’d really appreciate any (non-expert, I know) advice or commiseration.

I accidentally sat on my friend’s lap and I FELT his d*ck and now I’m hiding in my own bathroom

Oh my god I want to evaporate...
I (20F) accidentally sat on my friend’s (20M) lap and felt his d*ck and now I’ve been hiding in my bathroom for like 15 minutes because I’m too embarrassed to exist.

We’re working on a project together so he’s at my apartment right now. We were sitting on the floor because we have a million things like notes, laptops, books, tablets literally everywhere and there’s no space on my table.

We were sitting close because we needed to see each other’s screens. Whatever. At some point I was writing something on my laptop and he grabbed my notes and held them up super high so I couldn’t reach them. I’m 5'5 and he’s 6'1 so he was basically flexing his height on me.

I was so focused on getting them back that I didn’t even realize what I was doing. I moved toward him, tried to push his arm down, and then he moved them behind himself. So I leaned even more forward… and then HE lost his balance and fell backwards.

And I…
I fell right on top of him.
Like directly.
On his lap.

At first I wasn’t fully sitting but then he shifted, touched my leg, I panicked, lost my balance and—
I SAT ON HIM.
FULL WEIGHT.
On his lap.
And I FELT. EVERYTHING.

We both just froze for like two seconds in complete horror.
Then I basically launched myself into the air, said “NOPE,” and ran straight to the bathroom.

He’s still outside. In my apartment. Probably wondering if I died.

I genuinely don’t know how I’m supposed to walk back out there. I might move to another country.

Trigger Warning: Suicidal Thoughts, Extreme Self Loathing

I honestly don't know where to start with this. There are so much factors into how my life is going downhill, a lot that it will probably not even end with 2 or 3 posts....

{Also, I don't mean to degrade anyone's experiences or emotions so if it comes off like that, I am so sorry for the insensitive comments. I just want to vent, just spout nonsense to people who would have little to no effect on me. It just feels so, so much better than telling the people I care for.}

I just feel utterly miserable. Unsure of what I WANT and NEED to do with my life. I am second guessing my own desires, not accepting if they are actually mine or what I trick myself to think that I want. I put on masks to decieve others and myself. My words laced with lies and deceit, not to control but to ensure that they do not worry. My deepest and darkest worries eat me whole, a cancerous tumor rotting within me with no available cure.

I wish that I'd dissapear from my loved ones' lives, that I never existed in them to begin with. I want them to smile, to love, to experience it all without me. I want to die, yet I don't want to get hurt. My mind being so contradictory, letting myself get hurt but cower away from death. "Is this a sickness?" "Or is this just all inside my head?" I wonder why I had been born like this. "If I had been born more like 'that' or 'that', would I have become better?" Voices as loud as they coud be screech throughout the days. Yet they are silent, only heard by me. I want to puke and bleed out all of my flaws and imperfections. My mind as frail as the body it inhabits it. My heart burning, my stomach aching, and my mind bruised.

My hope, crushed underneath the mountaib of expectations placed on to myself. It was me who created it. I am so delusional. I wonder if I could survive in this world. My addiction and escape, isolating me further from the light. Yet if I let go of it, I would surely fall into the darker depths of no return. The tears fall endlessly within me but shallowly shown outside. I had broken. No glue nor tape to piece me back together.

Although you dear residents of the internet can send hopeful comments, criticisms, or advice, I can not take them to heart. I do not have the courage to push through my problems with my family so it would be even more difficult for strangers to lend a hand. Despite that, I am thankful for you to check my post. That someone out there can hear my screams. That they care enough to read my distress. That they see me with my problems, not with their biased judgements based on our relationship. Thank you.

I didn’t expect grief to hit me this hard and I’m struggling to talk about it

I’m having a harder time than I expected after the loss of my childhood dog two weeks ago. I thought I had prepared myself she was old and I knew it was coming but since it happened, something in me feels strangely hollow. What’s surprised me the most is how *unseen* this grief feels. My family has already moved on in their own ways, and when I mention her they get quiet like I’m making things heavier than they need to be. I don’t blame them everyone processes differently but it leaves me feeling isolated, like I’m grieving in a pocket of silence. I keep replaying small memories how she rested her head on my knee when she wanted reassurance the way she’d shuffle excitedly when she heard the treat jar the softness of her ears. These tiny things hit me at random moments and suddenly I’m overwhelmed again. I haven’t really talked about it with anyone because I don’t want to make them uncomfortable or seem dramatic over just a pet even though she was a huge part of my life for over a decade. I guess I’m posting because I don’t know how to sit with this alone anymore. I’m not looking for solutions just a place where I can say this out loud to people who won’t judge or minimize it. I miss her so much and it feels like it’s going to take longer to find my balance again than I thought.

TL;DR: Apart for the endophines part, can confirm. Meth's pretty good if you can keep the habbit under control and use it responsibly. Pretty much having a blast everytime I do it. Not for everyone, but surely a high-tier drug in my book with a ton of positive effects. I'd recommend trying Meth at least once to see what's the fuss is all about, and to see its difference from other Amphetamines in quality/potency of effects (i.e., in focus, rush, and euphoria), and it's uniqueness and superiority as a stimulant.

>The main problems of Meth are:
1)stimfapping
2)toxicity
3)addiction

>stimfapping
Can be avoided rether easily by keeping your hands off your dick, which may be hard for some, but possible reasonably without too much effort. Just don't condition yourself, or risk being an addict; at which point stopping without major self-control is reportedly very hard.

>toxicity
Dangerous, and needs constant health checkups to be ontop of your condition (I do a doctor checkup + bloodworks monthly. Sadly can't do an MRI at will so I can look for brain damage/red flags saying I need to quit).
Meth's toxicity can cause cell-death in both heart and brain, and certain medical conditions are more likely to develop with prolonged use.
So, playing around with Meth, like any other drug, requires you to do your own research, be aware of the risks, and accept them beforehand.

>addiction
Breaks without withdrawals or cravings (i.e., avoiding addiction) are easy with such rules as:
1)A proper use:break ratio (I do once every 7-14 days).
2)A max session length (I do ~36 hours).
3)A max dose per session (I do <500mg max).
4)Develop good habbits and cut bad ones by the stem.
I've been responsibly holding a Meth habbit, strictly sticking to the rules, for ~9 months now, and can quit whenever, and for as long as it takes, at a drop of a hat and without a second thought very easily.

I track and count everything in a relationship, so I don't end up becoming a burden.

I've been doing this since forever, I don't do it physically with like a notebook or anything, but I count it and keep track of it all the time.

Every moment of kindness and love somebody gives me, I keep track of it. Every moment of support and care. I count it. Every moment of pain and anger? I count that too. I have to, if I don't I might be a burden without realizing it.

I try my best to not cause problems, to not demand anything, to never ask for anything because that would be me being a burden to them.

I don't talk to my partners about anything bad in my head, because that would be an emotional burden. So I stay quiet. I stay the perfect image as long as I can. I read an article that a lot of women in relationships with men feel like they're carrying all the emotional burden in a relationship, so I won't. I won't open up, I won't say anything sad or painful or difficult for me, because if I do that I would be just like those guys. Despite the fact that the one thing I want the most is to be held and comforted for just a few minutes.

But here's the thing. I can't sustain it. I start getting resentful of the people I'm dating, because I'm not getting my wants and needs met, while I try my best to fulfill theirs. It starts eating at me that this person doesn't know my bad parts, it's all justt the good. Every gift, every act of kindness don't feel good anymore. They start feeling like silent demands for me to do more, and I start hating the gifts, the cakes, the hugs, the kisses. They feel like my debt to the person is increasing, I'm becoming more and more of a burden to them with every act of kindness to me. I start hating them, because they just keep asking for more and more from me.

I was bullied by my teacher

Back in high school, I got in trouble for copying a test. Not my proudest moment, but I accepted the consequences. What still sticks with me isn’t the punishment, it’s how my teacher treated me afterward.

The day it happened, I was extremely distressed, almost crying, and told her after school that it felt unfair some people had to study more than others. Not the smartest thing to say, but I was upset. She obviously reacted badly to that and then I left the room. Later, I found out she also made fun of me behind my back to the other students in the room. It wasn’t shocking though, she would be make fun of ppl or be rude during class, and everyone said that about her whether they liked her or not. But what she did to me felt more targeted and personal.

A few days later, before I even knew she had mocked me, she angrily confronted me for saying she made fun of students, because my mom had mentioned it during a phone call with her. I didn’t stand up for myself because I was trying to keep things civil after getting in trouble.

Then, during the next quiz, she tried to isolate me. She told me to sit “over there,” and she pointed to a single desk she had moved into a corner, far from everyone and facing the wall. It was humiliating. I said I felt like an outcast, and she angrily said, “Is this my fault?” 

Before I could sit there, someone in the front row offered to move seats for me, and she didn’t stop them, but the fact that she’d tried to publicly shame me still made me extremely angry. I admit I had extreme anger issues and should’ve just let it go knowing that her attempt failed, but sadly I didn’t. 

I also want to explain, it was public shaming because it was very isolated, and because she could’ve had me sit in a normal seat, like this one back table that wasn’t next to anyone. But she went out of her way to corner me anyway.

I confronted her in an email a couple years later, but that still didn’t fully heal me.

I feel stupid for dreaming so big, but I really want to study abroad.

I’m 19, doing my second year of a 4-year Psychology Honours with Research degree at a government college in India. It’s a good place, and I know the realistic path- do my master’s here, clear UGC-NET, and maybe become a lecturer someday.

But I can’t stop thinking about going abroad. I really want to study at the University of Glasgow, do my Master’s in Psychological Research Methods, and just… see what it’s like out there. Experience something different, you know?

It’s not even about money exactly — my parents would probably help if I asked (or not cuz my mother lowk hates me i think) but I don’t want to put that pressure on them. I just wish I could make it happen on my own.

Still, sometimes I feel dumb for even thinking about it. Like, who am I to dream this big? Does it even make sense to want this when the practical option is right in front of me?

I have been living my life as if I'd die each next month

Can anyone relate to this? I set my life up for giving up, not for actively living it. I am digging my own grave, I have little suicide preparations going on constantly, I put so very much energy into little goodbye-boxes for some people I love, figuring out which songs I would like my family to play at my funeral, always keeping my things and creative outlets obsessively organized in case I'll leave soon.

I know can change this. 

I want to live. 

I really really do. I am just scared. I am so scared of giving up my weird obsessive system and simply fully leaning into life - which is messy. What I try to do is create something static, but life is constant movement. I hold on to these boxes and my order and it's holding me back from actually living. 

I wish I had the trust in myself, my own energy and abilities to just dive into life and FINALLY create the life I crave to live. It's just so hard with depression because even if one week goes well, the next one could totally break me again. I feel like I can't trust myself. And how am I supposed to live if I am not even stable enough to work? 

I want to be independent, I want to make my own money, move out and do the things that matter to me. Live my colorful, crazy little life. But I make decisions in favor of my hopelessness over and over again. It's a cycle that's so hard to break. Because breaking out of it and simply but fully trusting my glimmer of hope feels so naive.

I really hope I never kill myself. And it's almost funny, because as soon as I think about living, I get even more terrified of dying young - like in an accident or due to illness. I get so cautious. I am scared that as soon as I give up my obsessive system and the goodbye-boxes I'll die and then I leave nothing behind. 

I have people in my life I look up to and adore. I want to live my life more like them. I really really really do. They seem so free and capable, they like what they do, they know what they want, they aren't perfect but they are deeply inspiring and absolutely lovely human beings.

And when it comes to letting go, giving in to uncertainty and movement, I thought maybe I'll just keep Adrian Pimento in mind…

I just need to make the decision in favor of life and STICK WITH IT.

I fell for a girl I cannot be with

I(26M) moved to a new town earlier this year and within a couple of months, I met someone(24F). From the beginning, she was honest about how she’d be moving at the end of the year to a state that’s at least 500 miles away. She’ll be moving to pursue a career that she’s always dreamt of having. She feels that this move will teach her how to be independent as she has always had the support of her amazing family. She set clear boundaries and said the move is a must and she has to do it by herself. We both knew it would be temporary. She made it clear from the get go how important these goals are to her.

So at first, we would spend time casually. It was nothing too serious because we knew it was short term, but we really hit it off. We ended up falling for each other. It all happened so quickly. I don’t know if we took it too far, knowing that there was an expiration date, or if it was inevitable that we grew so close. I needed some space to think things through, knowing that she’s made plans to move independently before we’d even met.

After several hard conversations, we agreed that continuing our relationship is irresponsible and we would only end up hurting each other more. I really fucking want to be with her, even long distance, but I think she was on the verge of sacrificing her goals so we could be together. I was terrified that one day, she might resent me for being the reason she never accomplished those goals. Idk, I want her in my life but I’m afraid that there’s no healthy way to do that. I feel happy and lucky to have met her. She told me she feels the same. But I feel guilty for causing her pain at the same time. 

TLDR: dated irresponsibly, broke up with GF for logistical/emotional timing issues, feel guilty for making her sad. Am sad lol.

For 4 years, I was in my house. I never left the house except once a month to get groceries. But during that time, I basically had no human interaction with anyone. I would spend days, weeks at a time, just in my house alone, and out in my backyard.

In that 4 years, I had spent more time alone than in my entire 40 year life combined.

It was kind of liberating not having to deal with people. It really loved the way I was free to just enjoy nature in my backyard and not have to go to work and deal with people.

Am I crazy for wanting to experience that again?

I have to work now and I'm surrounded by people almost 24/7 and it's driving me insane.

Is it healthy to want that life again?

I regret not struggling

I don't know if struggling or regret are the right words.

I went from high school to university where my tuition and all costs were covered by the state due to my parents income. Graduated with a bachelors in CS.

3 months after graduating I landed a remote software engineering role for $80k.

3 years later I'm making $140k at the same company.

I'm so far past comfortable compared to how I grew up. I really should not have any complaints but I don't know how to explain it. All the people I have grown to know over the years are still struggling as young adults. They feel so much more 'close-knit' and it feels like I'm alienated from the majority experience of people my age.

I know it's crazy to say that I feel like I'm missing out, when I'm missing out on something that causes so much stress. I don't want to struggle with my peers but I want to grow with them.

On top of the increasing loneliness issue among men it's compounded for me at least by the fact that I feel like I skipped over a core period of my youth.

I don't know if anyone feels the same way but I just wanted to try to type out how I've been feeling

Wondering how many others have this same isolation/social pariah feelings. 

I’m 32, disabled to a degree since about 24, which took me out of work pool and while I’m not housebound, it makes the world smaller as in my experience making and maintaining friendships was easier in school/work. I tried though, volunteering, being parts of clubs, so on so forth. 

Lack of strong friendships leads into the following, I have no interests or hobbies that really spark joy, except when it’s something I lean toward but is enjoyed by others. I don’t really care for film/television, but if my mate suggests something he is into that aligns with things I’ve enjoyed before, it can open up for me. 

This is great, when it doesn’t make people shirk away from me. I clocked that my diving into enjoying something made others uncomfortable, and backing off, but now that this is there it sucks the joy from the possible enjoyment of the thing because I’m constantly trying to temper myself to not scare someone off. Or I just simply can’t get into it anyways. 

I’ve been described as a bummer once you get to know me. I can fake it surface level, always considered funny, charismatic. Anything deeper than acquaintances and others seem to clock the sad sackness. 

All this to say, I’m alone. I can’t have (nor would I want) children. I’m not in a place for a relationship, if I even could nurture any connection to that point. All my friends are, well, surface. I’m the guy in a group chat that if I’m quiet I’m forgotten. When there’s an event it’s more often than not “oh we just forgot to invite you“. 

Something about me is just, off. And it feels like everyone knows it once they know me. And with the enjoyment button not being able to be pressed unless someone else trips it first, it’s as if there’s not much hope there for even trying to eke out something from life.

It’s been this way for years, probably around 20-22 life started turning gray like this for me, multiple friend group and out of the home connections all falling off, lack of joy unless it’s someone else’s. I guess I just am looking to see there’s others that can relate.

Boyfriend Broke Up with me

So tonight my boyfriend of 5 months broke up with me.

He’s been very cold and distant for the past 7 days - barely replying. He said he was stressed about his mum and I was aware there were family issues but he never told me exactly what even after asking.

I’ve felt so anxious all week long because I’ve had no communication. I finally convinced him to call me tonight after sending a few texts begging that he calls me. On the phone he promised it’s nothing to do with me he’s just so stressed about his mum - but still wouldn’t say exactly what was wrong with her. He said he feels like he can’t be in a relationship right now due to the stress. He said he hasn’t talked to his dad or friends about the issues and is bottling it all up. He sounds very depressed to be honest. I urged that he talk to someone about it even if it isn’t me. I begged him not to do anything stupid, he said he wouldn’t.

I tried to convince him that burning down his support network when he feels like this is a bad idea. I said that I respect that him needing space to deal with things is his way of handling it and I don’t mind going on a break, but he needs to tell me that first and check in every x amount of days/weeks. He said he would feel too bad for making me wait and wanted to fully break up. I said either way I will be hurt, and I’ll feel worse if he breaks up fully, because at least on a break I can make sure he is mentally well. He kept saying he just wants to be on his own. So I have to respect that, and there’s nothing else I can do. I told him to just think about it and call me/text me tomorrow if that’s definitely what he wants to do, and he said he will.

I know a lot of you will probably say ‘just leave’ and that it’s a waste of my time sticking around. But this relationship has been the best I’ve ever had and we were really building something amazing. I really do not think he is making up excuses or lying about this and he also promised that this isn’t an excuse to soften breaking bad news. I just feel really sad, let down, angry, disappointed, worried about him.

I have friends and family coming soon so I can speak to them about it.

Edit: One of my friends said it might be an idea to text his friend that I have on socials that I’m worried about him and his safety - but idk if it’s my place to do that really.

The worst part is : I don’t remember anything almost from my childhood, some stuff, but most of it, it’s gone from my brain, people tell me I did this and that, it feels like a different person, not me.

After the break up with my ex boyfriend, I though I could handle it, I could be trying to be normal, then, he broke up with me, and I understood, I will never be normal, ever ever. 

This is a goodbye message, I don’t really feel like talking to anyone I know, I don’t have that much friends anymore, I did a promise to someone to hold on an another year, but frankly, no, I don’t want, I am tired. Take care everyone. See you in an another life.

I miss it sometimes

I have struggled with depression since my teenage years.

Right now I'm on an adventure of a lifetime, working hard, being physically active, reading books and making friends. I've never felt better. Most of the time I love it. It's everything I ever wanted in that dark room, alone and lonely, hating everything around me but mostly myself. 

And yet there are times when I miss it. I miss not having responsibilities, places to be. I miss gaming all night, sleeping all day. My meals were junk food and cigarettes, and my hobbies were masturbating and writing. 

It's like I don't remember scraping that terrible feeling of emptiness for an inkling of self loathing. The envy I felt as I stalked people I used to know on social media, watching as they put behind them achievement after achievement. Finishing school, travelling, becoming moderately famous in their online niche.

Everyday I wake up to terrible news about the world and I feel like I'm losing faith in humanity. It pushes me into the deep, black sea of nihilism, where nothing matters anyway. There it waits for me, the sweet, soft demon-friend, whispering to come back. 

I'm not going to. Never again, even if it might crawl back into my head, I will never let it get that bad again. 

But sometimes I wish I could go back. 

I can't really talk to my friends about these things, they would just look at me like I'm broken. My wife, while she would understand, is on a high right now and I don't want to bum her out. So I came here.

Thank you for reading

My first "boy"friend was a 32 year old man. I was 15.

I want to tell the story of my first boyfriend. If you could call him that. We met when I was 15, I lost my virginity to this man when I was 16, and we stayed together till I was 18, when I pulled the threads and unraveled it all. He called himself MG. His parents named him Matthew. He was a 32 year old man posing as a 22 year old college student. He worked at a shitty retail job and lived in a shitty rented house, so it was kind of believable if you ignored the crow's feet. He fooled me, he fooled my mom by doing whatever manipulators do to get people to believe their lies. Charm and deflect.

Our first date was to the movies. I remember making out for the 3rd time ever in my life. The intensity of this man was scary but also exciting? I think I was 16 at this point. I'm sure he was aware that I was past some kind of threshold. 15 was too young, a child.

I lost my virginity to this man in February of 2002, at his house. He liked to have me over once a week or every other week to hang out. I thought this was a normal thing, the way relationships work. He would put on a movie or a show, we'd laugh, smoke weed, laugh some more, go upstairs.

Things went on this way for about two years. Casual statutory rape. Along with the Big Lie about his age, there were more lies than I can remember, but I'll try. One that I remember was a night that he didn't come over. No call, no show, missed our date. I cried myself to sleep. He called me the next day and said that there was an incident at the club he had been working at the night before. He claimed that everyone in the club had passed out and woke up in a daze, no idea what happened. He lied about having sisters. He called them Belinda and Betina, and showed me a cut out from City Paper, claiming the model was one of his sisters. I did not get the Muppets reference at the time, but I do now (they are the names of twin Muppets). He has no sisters. He is an only child. He claimed to study Astroradiology at Villanova University. He claimed to work in cybersecurity at a bank. I believed him despite looking for an “Astroradiology” program at Villanova and coming up blank. And why would anyone work in retail after a career in cybersecurity.

It started to unravel when I turned 18. The red flags I had been too young to see were starting to creep into view, until they were all I could see. My friends were increasingly concerned about me. He canceled dates. I noticed a red car parked in his driveway several nights a week. This was not a roommate’s car. I knew what was happening, and I knew that I had to address the creeping feeling that he had been a liar from day one.

Yes, I had suspicions the whole time. Our whole “relationship”. I had asked to see his driver’s license several times, mostly playfully, but I did want to see his birthday. Something deep inside me knew but didn’t want to know. Now I wanted to know. It was 2004, the internet was not what it is today but we did have the MySpace and The White Pages. I used the White Pages site to run his name and saw the results. He was 36 years old. I was 18. My reaction was immediate. I was disgusted, so angry, murderously angry at how he’d HAD me. PLAYED me so hard. I could not realize at the time the immense damage he did, but I knew that something very bad had happened to me. I called him, I screamed at him, and cut him off forever.

Just kidding! I did call him and scream at him. He requested that we meet. I agreed. That’s when things got really weird. He claimed various things. Clerical error. Decade long coma. Aliens. Yes, aliens.

It was too sad to listen to. Even at that point I still couldn’t believe that someone could lie, and lie, and lie, and lie… ad infinitum. But I cut it off and left for good.

Just kidding again. I did cut it off. But over the years (it has been over 20 years) I have found myself in his orbit at various times, and feeling pity, feelings of sentimentality when remembering the handful of good times. Most recently, I went on a forgiveness quest during the pandemic. I reached out when I saw a mutual friend who said that he “talked about \[me\] all the time”. I still didn’t know what to do with all of the feelings I had about him. How could someone who was undoubtedly a shitty boyfriend but was also funny and witty be a monster. Was he even a monster? Could I even trust myself? Maybe I could heal myself by replacing all the bad memories with good ones? Maybe it wasn’t that bad after all?

What finally, finally, finally pulled me out was, of all things, was Evan Rachel Wood’s accounting of her relationship with Marilyn Manson. I saw myself in her, this young, beautiful girl with a manipulative old creep. The Me Too stories started pouring out of people. Most recently, the emphasis on the Epstein files have triggered memories and helped me find my rage. With that white hot rage, I severed the trauma bond and banished him to hell. I hope he fucking burns.

Epilogue: I’m married to a beautiful, honest man, we have two beautiful kids, life is wonderful. I’m a hospice nurse. I haven’t lost my faith in humanity. Not even close. And my mom is my best friend. I forgave her for her mistake, and she finally forgave herself.

I wrote this for me, and for anyone who might relate to my story. I hope it helps someone :) I felt a lot of shame and embarrassment for a long time, which makes me sad for my younger self. Now at nearly 40, with friends and family members who have 15 year old children, I realize how very young and innocent I was. After some time in therapy, I realized how trauma works, and that trauma bonds are very real, powerful, and very confusing feelings to deal with. None of the shame or embarrassment was ever mine, I didn't do anything to earn it. He did. If you relate to this and you're still feeling those feelings, it's not yours either <3

Last November 11, nag text na ako sa kanila, nagpapaalam na baka pwedeng magamit muna yung kalahati ulit and isasabay ko na lang sa dec 11. Walang reply for 7 days. Wala rin pumunta para mangulit na bayaran na kasi hindi pwede.

Ngayon, nag ttext sila na i settle na daw ung kalahati. Wala na akong pera pambayad kasi akala ko okay naman sa kanila kasi if hindi, nangungulit naman sila araw araw. Ang inconsiderate lang na hindi nag reply nung nagsabi na ako na ma llate ng payment tapos ngayon nagmamadali na bayaran na yung kalahati kasi gagamitin na nila. 

P.S malaking apartment to and mayaman yung may ari. May hotel pa sila dito samin. Halagang 2.5k, hindi nila maabonohan? Nakakasama lang ng loob na bakit late naman nagsabi na hindi pala pwede magamit ung deposit namin kung kailan 7 days na ung nakalipas.

Over the weekend I made two of my friends really mad, one of them so bad that they’re refusing to talk to me. The other one told me I needed to apologise and so I did but it just made things worse because they felt like I wasn’t being genuine. I value our friendship a lot. They’re genuinely some of the best friends I’ve ever had but I don’t know how to apologise because I just don’t care. I understand that what I was doing was annoying, but I don’t think it’s worthy of never speaking to me again and I’m struggling to take it seriously because I don’t understand why they’re so mad. I’m torn between desperately wanting to fix this but struggling to figure out how because I can’t figure out how to take it seriously.

For context these two friends have been semi flirting for the past few weeks and on the weekend I made too many jokes about it and apparently made them both uncomfortable. I had no idea they felt this way until the next morning when one of them asked me to apologise. 

I think at first we all wanted to reconcile but since my lack lustre apology, I’ve been told that my lack of care for hurting others is really disturbing, which hurt me a lot to hear but I just don’t know how to take the situation seriously because it’s so dumb in my mind. 
I don’t understand how a few uncomfortable jokes warrant all of this anger and if it was that bad, why didn’t they tell me sooner? 

I feel guilty that I’ve hurt them and I really want us to all be friends again, but I don’t know how. The first apology was so bad that our mutual friends asked me if I’ve ever apologised to anyone before and honestly the answer is no. I’ve never been in a situation like this where I’ve had to apologise so earnestly and even though I feel bad I don’t know how to take myself seriously enough to do it. I’m a very jokey lighthearted person and I don’t think I’ve ever been in a situation where I’ve hurt someone this badly. 

I can feel the ship burning around me, but I can’t bring myself to leave or try and save anyone or really do anything. I recognise that I’ve hurt my friends really badly and that I fucked up but every time I try and type out an apology or I practice talking about it my face is blank and my voice is robotic and I can’t hide the fact that I don’t care. I just don’t understand it and I don’t know how to understand it. 

But on the flipside, I do really care and I can’t stop thinking about it. It’s made me so sad I can’t bring myself to smile or laugh and my family and other friends are starting to notice something is wrong because it’s put me in such a bad mood.

my dad was "online" in 1993, but not in the WWW sense. he had some 486 running Windows for Workgroups 3.11 with a modem in it, he'd dial into Solaris boxes at work and do unixy IT stuff. I just looked up video-game cheats and stuff for a year or two before middle-school me realized that there were a bunch of shitty geocities sites with 640x480 pictures of Sailor Moon pantyshots.

overall i rate the Pokemon Master Guide from 1999 a 7/10. a few mistakes here and there but also some surprisingly solid advice for the time. it presents information with better design and humour than wikis have today.

I feel like I’ve completely lost myself and I don’t know how to get through the days anymore

I’m 23 years old and I work remotely. I spend most of my days alone at home, just me and my laptop. I’m usually the quiet, introverted type — I don’t go out much, and I’ve always valued a few deep connections over a big circle of friends. For the past few years, I had that one person — my best friend. We used to talk every day about everything, from random things to our deepest thoughts. She knew me better than anyone.

But about three weeks ago, I did something really stupid. Out of panic and overthinking, I ended up breaking her trust. I told someone close to her something she had once shared with me privately. I didn’t mean any harm, but it hurt her badly — and honestly, I get why. Since that day, she’s cut me off completely. She blocked me everywhere, and even though I’ve apologized so many times, she doesn’t want to hear from me again. I know I was wrong, but I also feel like it’s not something so unforgivable that I can’t even get the chance to make it right. Still, I can’t change what’s done.

It’s been 22 days now, and I’ve never felt this low. My phone barely lights up anymore — no notifications, no messages, no one to talk to. I deleted Instagram and Snapchat because seeing them just reminds me of her. I still check her name sometimes, even though I know I’m blocked everywhere. I barely eat, sometimes order food even when something’s already cooked, and I just lie down for hours doing nothing. Even when I sleep, I dream about her — about things being okay again — and when I wake up, it all hits me again.

I’m not suicidal, but there are moments when I wish something would just happen — like a crash or an accident — not because I want to die, but because I don’t want to keep feeling like this. The silence in my room is deafening. From 6 p.m. till late at night, I just sit staring at walls or random YouTube videos, trying to kill time. My only friend who stays with me gets home around 11, but I can’t keep telling him how I feel — I’m tired of hearing myself say the same things too.

I don’t even know why I’m writing this — maybe because I just want to feel heard. I’m not looking for pity, I just want to talk. Maybe with someone who’s been through something similar, or someone who knows what it’s like to lose a connection that meant everything. I just need a reminder that things will
go well in the end. The crux is I don’t want to lose her.

Been homeless for 4 months due to narcissistic parents and struggling to carry on

I don't even know where to start. This story is so complicated.

In April i lost my job. I couldn't find another one fast enough and I ended up losing my apartment

During this time, my mother and father came to talk to me about what I could do. But the conversation devolved, as it always does, into an argument about the past. 

You see, i was sexually abused as a minor by my mum's brother. When it all came out when I was 18 (now 34) my mother essentially made the whole thing about herself. About how she was betrayed by her brother and all the pain she was going through. To be blunt it's highly likely she is a narcissist. She has always been emotionally and physically abusive. Not just to me but my sisters too. 

If this wasn't bad enough, my mum ended up blaming me for my sexual abuse, stating "it takes two to tango" which essentially destroyed our relationship. And instead of realising the horrific thing she had done and make amends, has instead opted to turn herself into the victim whenever held to account on this issue.

Fast forward to being 34 and losing my apartment. Me and my mother are still arguing. She's always wondering why i still hold resentment towards her or why i don't call etc. Which forces me to bring up past incidents that have never been healed. 

We're having this same argument again but with the backdrop that I'm on the verge of homelessness. 

She turns to me during this and says "You're not a victim. When i was 14 and started having sex, i knew exactly what I was doing" which is just one of the nastiest things to say to anyone that's been molested.

So the next day after trying to ask for support from my sister (she refused) i tried to kill myself. 

I took a lot of painkillers and alcohol in a very short space of time. Luckily my family arrived and I was rushed to hospital where I was luckily saved. 

Upon coming out of hospital, the family rallied around, seemingly like a wake up call had been issued, and we devised a plan. I would move in with my parents and go back to college to train up in a trade and get back on my feet. 

Unfortunately, this didn't work out. 

Over the weeks of moving my stuff in, my mum started her old tricks with me and began starting arguments. She was particularly concerned that I still felt animosity towards her (i did), but wouldn't acknowledge why that was or give it time to heal. She expected everything to be fine with her within a week of me coming out of the hospital. 

We had some pretty big arguments. But eventually i managed to move in there after some efforts from my sister to be diplomatic. 

But within days of being there my mum just seemed to lose her shit. 

I watched the exorcist with my 19 year old sister. She's getting older and i felt she needed to learn more adult themes. But also the movie is close to my heart because the implication of the daughters possession in that movie is that she's being sexually abused. So, i was attempting to use the movie so that she could perhaps understand me better as a person. 

Halfway through my mother barges in and see's what we're watching and starts yelling about it. Says that my sister will have nightmares etc. I don't rise to the bait and stay pretty calm but my mum doesn't like that and says "you're trying to corrupt your sister the same way your uncle corrupted you" which is just so insanely hurtful and disgusting to imply.

A few days go by and I need to pick up a TV. I have to ask her to help me pick it up. She agrees.

While in the car she begins an argument with me again. But this time i recorded it. My mum was being way more unhinged than normal so i knew something was going to go down. 

Basically the argument devolved. I stayed pretty calm, but it was difficult. By the end my mum was screaming and threatening me. She threatened to get my dad to attack me. 

And that's exactly what happened. My dad came out to the garden, i took a video of the entire incident. He took a big caravan plug and began hitting me across the head and body with the plug-end of it. Probably about 5 times. 

We then broke apart and he approaches me again. I warned him if he touched me again I'd have to defend myself (i said it less politely than that). But he took this as an invitation and started punching me. 

I fell and he got ontop of me and started punching me in the head. I got up off the floor, and got some distance, and then I started hitting back. And they really didn't like that.

I hit my dad pretty hard and he fell to the floor crying and then ran into the house saying he was getting the police. 

I also phoned the police and they arrived around 10 minutes after. 

I showed the officer my video but despite the evidence, i was still arrested and i became the suspect in the crime. 

This arrest and the bail conditions are what caused my homelessness. 

I stayed with my sister for a month or so but it wasn't sustainable. So I had to go to the government and they gave me temporary accommodation at a homeless shelter. And I've been here ever since. 

But i stuck to my plan. I'm in college, I'm one of the top of the class of joinery and tiling. And I'm doing well in that respect.

But everything around me is just making it harder. I can't find work. Welfare is very low here so money is very tight. I can't have visitors so barely see friends. 

I've tried to date but every time it feels like it's going good, the rug gets pulled from me suddenly. 

The atmosphere in the shelter is so off, because i think it's primarily used for criminals just out of prison and you never really know what they did. So you can't trust anyone. People have mental episodes here and someone tried to kill themselves by jumping out of a window about a month ago.

Despite money, i took a break and visited a friend for a couple days. Honestly it felt so good to just be able to relax and be with familiar people I can trust. But when I came back on the train it hit me so hard. I just didn't want to go back. The thought of going from friends, trust and love. Back to hopelessness, pain and anxiety was making me sick. I burst into tears on the train. 

I have my court hearing on the 17th. I'm anxious about it but i believe I can win. Not only do I have the video recording of the attack against me, i filed a data request of my arrest with all bodycam footage. In the bodycam footage, the officer that arrested me goes to speak to my parents. During this, my father actually admits to attacking me in both instances. However the police officer tries to talk over him. But it's clear as day. 

So I'm fairly certain i can win this. My entire future rests on it. If i lose here, getting work and getting out of being homeless will basically be impossible. My life will be ruined forever 

I just wish I could catch a break. I need something good in my life to give me hope

Jack of all trades…master of none…

Throughout my entire life I’ve always been good at whatever new endeavors I began. Mostly physical and artistic activities. I was an amazing gymnast, cheerleader, runner, and CrossFit-er in my youth. Eventually I became a certified yoga teacher and taught for a year. Then I became a contortionist, aerialist, painter, hula hooper, skater, swimmer, sculptor, dancer, the list goes on. I’ve done a tremendous amount of things in my life so far, but I’ve never stuck with any of it. As the seasons of my life changed and my schedules got interrupted, Id fall off my routine and eventually stop doing whatever hobby/passion I was engulfed in at the time. For a while it didn’t bother me because I was young and always on the precipice of something new to dedicate myself to. As I’ve gotten older though, I find myself feeling lost and unsatisfied with all of things I’ve left behind. I look at people in specific fields who have never wavered from their path and have built wonderful and fulfilling careers/lives for themselves from their passions. And all I have to show for myself are a bunch of participation trophies. I’ve enjoyed everything I’ve done but nothing has stuck with my soul enough to inspire me to stick with it as the seasons change. I truly feel like a jack of all trades, master of none. I try to see the silver lining, that I’ve gotten to experience such a diverse range of paths, but I am so upset that I don’t have even one mastered passion/hobby in my book. It’s hard to get back into certain things after taking such a long hiatus and having to essentially start over zaps my excitement about trying it again. So I’ve kept myself in a loop of starting something new and abandoning it after sometime. I don’t even know why I do it. I wouldn’t consider myself a quitter or weak but perhaps an all or nothing mindset has corroded my ability to stay consistent. I feel like a loser. I am currently in school for a career that will give me freedom financially and won’t swallow up all of my time, but it’s not a passion. I dont want to wake up 10 years from now and only have my job be the one thing I’ve truly devoted myself to. I want a vibrant life where i work my job as everyone needs to, but I also have a successful and flourishing passion that I dedicate myself to outside of work. I wish I had just one thing that spoke to my soul enough that I continue to get better and better despite things disrupting my consistency.

What's worse, reading a shitty VN or spending that time watching random YouTube? I'm constantly flipping back and forth between ANIME BAD and INTERNET BAD and I don't intend to become some trad LARPer type. I think the excesses of the modern internet and the endlessly consuming information it provides are probably a lot more harmful than a mediocre eroge. Ironically you'd probably see less porn too.

Anxiety about random door knocking for painting work

My large apartment complex has a manager who's awful at communication. In early October they left notices on every door saying starting that weekend and going forward, on a Saturday or Sunday someone would come to paint the inside of our front door.  Except there was no time frame given or indication which section they're starting with.  And it said if you weren't home, they'd come back another time.  

So for the last month, I've been strangely on edge about this. When I hear someone come up the stairs, I get nervous. There's been crews doing outside maintenance around the complex, but so far I don't think anyone has shown up and it's been a month.  I asked the manager about times and they didn't reply. 

I've had 2 dreams now where I woke up early in the morning, today it was around 7 AM, because I swore I heard someone knocking, and it was Saturday.  But no one was there.  

And I'm venting because it's ridiculous to expect someone to just be available randomly on a weekend!  I also should mention that after the door painting, you're supposed to keep your door open for 45 minutes, too, so I'd have to hang out near the front door.

I haven't stayed home waiting though all the time, I take walks and I'm not giving up prime autumn leaf viewing time to wait on random painters.

It's possible. Don't let the doomers trick you. Just calculate it, don't aim for these multimillion dollar properties, plan it, save, get a mortgage. You will need to be patient, compromise, and sacrifice, but you will get there.

I’m realizing it wasn’t the action that hurt me..it was the broken principle. How do I heal from that?

So last weekend my girlfriend was in a beauty pageant. Before the event, she and I talked about boundaries  specifically about keeping a bit of distance from one of the male contestants. She was the one who said, “Don’t worry, there won’t be any touching or closeness.”

Cool. I trusted that. Not because I thought she’d do something wild, but because she made the boundary herself and we agreed on it.

But during the event, she ended up touching him anyway .. nothing intimate, nothing scandalous. Just… something she clearly said wouldn’t happen.

And the weird part is, I’m not actually upset about the physical thing. The action itself was small and honestly meaningless. What’s been eating at me is the principle behind it ,,, the fact that she confidently set a line and then crossed it like it didn’t matter.( She said the judges forced her into doing it in her defense, that was before she apologized)

It made me feel like our agreements don’t hold the same weight for her as they do for me.

I’m not accusing her of cheating. I’m not trying to control her. I just feel this heavy crack in trust, and it’s messing with my head more than I expected. I keep thinking, “If something so small can be dismissed due to pressure from people, what about bigger things later?”

So what I'm asking is how do you heal from a situation where the hurt isn’t about what happened, but what it meant?
How do you rebuild trust when the principle matters more than the moment?
And how do you work through that without becoming bitter or overly sensitive?

I did something weird as a kid out of curiosity and just remembered it. Is this normal?

So, about a week ago I had a dream about something that I did when I was around 9 or 10 years old, and it sort of awoke a repressed memory, and now I’m honestly kind of in disbelief and almost a little disturbed...

When I was younger, I learned that astronauts wear diapers when they go into space (because of spacewalks, etc.), and for some reason, I thought this was such a convenient idea. I was really curious about it and I decided to wear a diaper and pee in it (yes, I understand this is crazy). I had thought the urine would evaporate or something, and obviously, it didn’t. I was totally disgusted afterward, and I just kind of forgot about it. I only remembered this story recently after having a dream about it.

Now that I’m an adult (22), I’m kind of processing it and trying to make sense of it. I have no weird interests or anything like that, and today, as a rationale adult, I'm just baffled that my curiosity led me to do something so odd.

Is it normal for kids to do crazy stuff like this just because they’re curious?

Looking back, I knew it wasn’t exactly *normal*, but I wasn’t really concerned about it either. It was just my brain trying to understand something in the only way it knew how. Is this something that other people did as kids, or was I just *that* weird?

I still have my friend Cha — we met back in SHS, grade 12. She’s kind, down to earth, always late but still shows up, and she’s incredibly generous. Medyo sad lang because she’s in QC now for nursing school, while I stayed here. We have two other friends: one joined me in the OT program, and the other went to another school for architecture.

I’ve never felt this lonely before. What’s ironic is I used to be the most sociable person you’d meet back in my early teens. But now, as I’m getting closer to “adulting,” working and studying at the same time, most of my hobbies — gaming, watching movies or series, discovering new songs — have been pushed aside. I don’t enjoy the things I used to enjoy. And even though I love my job, it doesn’t really relieve the loneliness. I tried coping by keeping myself busy, but in the end, I just made myself more stressed and drained.

When a friendship hits deeper than you expected — how do you move forward?

I’ve got this coworker I’ve known for about a year and a half. We connected really naturally — same music, same sense of humor — and ended up talking a lot, even outside of work. We’d text for hours, share playlists, and it just felt easy and genuine.

The thing is, that friendship started to mean a lot to me. Maybe more than it should have. It wasn’t romantic, but it made me feel seen and appreciated in a way I hadn’t in a long time.

Lately, though, things have cooled off. She’s got her own life, and I get that — but I find myself missing what we had. I’m not trying to chase her or make things weird, just struggling a bit with how to step back emotionally and accept that the connection might never be the same.

Has anyone else been through something like this — where a friendship left a mark and you weren’t sure how to handle the shift? How do you move forward without feeling foolish or sentimental about it?

I dated my rapist for 3 years

I (f24) recently left the now ex (m39) after a 3 year relationship. Im AuDD and he has ADHD. Facts stated, onto the story. 

I met him for the first time on a night out with just a couple of friends, where he was sober giving one of my friends a lift home. I found him attractive but thought the age gap was too much so i shrugged it off. The night it happened was on a celebratory day in my country where a lot of people go drinking, all bars are full and a lot of people get shitfaced. Including me. I was on antidepressants and we all know thats a bad combination with alcohol. Well, I dont remember half the night, what I know about the part i cant remember, i have had to puzzle together with stories from friends and the ex. I obviously knew something had happened, i could feel it when i woke up. I didnt tell anyone about it. Never have and never will, not to people that know me, at least. 

Forward to him charming his way into my life. Inviting me out on dates and home to meet his family. I was lonely, looking for affection and this is what i settled with. Today, I think to myself, that i wore a pink blindfold and did not see all the red flags and all the narcissistic signs before i had wasted 3 years of my life on that boy. Yes, boy.

This boy even has a 6 year old daughter. Who I met and got a relationship with. Not as a step mom, just dads girlfriend. She lives in an institution, for reasons i realise today. 

The first year was fun, had a lot of trips and good times but then things started to go downhill. He would be annoyed if food wasnt ready when he got home. He would reject me when I asked him for sex, but would convince me every time he wanted to do it. He would make me feel bad for sitting at my pc, having fun with my friends when he wasnt home. I convinced myself he was right.

The worst parts, and what finally made me realise i was stuck in a hole and he was throwing dirt on me, was how he behaved in the following situations. 

This summer, his father slapped me on the ass. I have previous history with men doing so, all the way back to when i was 14 years old. His father has always been uncomfortable to be around. Always breaking the personal space bubble and talking very loudly. So this shook me heavily. I have been dealing with depression and no job for a long while (because the ex dragged me down, i now realise) so this slap on the ass ruined my day completely. The ex wasnt near us when his dad did this so i told him when we got home. He shrugged, and said he will talk to his dad about it. His dad completely changed the story and he came home to me, saying he didnt know who to believe so I had to sort this myself. First. Red. Flag. I. Saw.
Second situation: a friend of his dads daughter, a 15 year old girl had started hanging out with the ex, when he was in the garage at his dads place. I knew her, brought her along when we went places and talked with her many times. Then comes her bday. Where the ex is invited but not me. Previously, i had asked him to stop texting goodmorning and goodnight with her, to not let her steal his shirts and not have alone evenings with her. He also came home one day, saying that I was the only one of his girls still awake. As in, his daughter was asleep, our female cat was asleep and the 15 year old had texted him goodnight. I frowned. 

The day before her bday, he told me he was excited to go but also to remember that I wasnt welcome. I texted my best friend at this point, asking if this was normal. No, it was not. 

On the day of the bday, i also texted my mom and sister asking what to do. They suggested giving him two options. Either we both go or we dont go.
He got pissed when i said this to him. How dare I want to go to a place im not welcome and ruin her bday. So he chose not to go, but i could join him at his fathers place, cause then he had to do some things there instead. So against my will but stubborn as I am, i joined him. His father did not speak to me at first. Later he yelled. Yelling at me, that I should not control who his son speaks to and that I should not walk around town spreading rumours of sexual assault. It made him sad and he feels like he cant go anywhere anymore. I didnt give him a single reaction, other than, telling him its never been ok for a minor to have a relationship like that to a grown man, its never been okay for men to slap womens asses. I told him he would never see me again, so he should have nothing to worry about. The ex had left the room when this happened btw, he did not care. 

So, next day arrives. My parents had plans to visit to help with some renovations but my mom called me asking what was happening. Apparently, the ex had texted them not to come, he wasnt home. He had moved out to his dads place for a week. When i asked him what that was about, he said he doesnt understand why I dont trust him, and left. 

So, I was done. When my parents arrived I told them it was over. 3 days passed by and I was out. All my stuff was out of the house, my cat was picked up and my address was moved. 

What did he say when i told him im leaving? 
"Im sorry to hear that, hope we can still talk" then he proceeded to tell my mom to take care of me, and started talking about random work he needed to get done during the week. 

I dont believe this boy to be intentionally evil. But his parents and legacy from how they have treated him, has made him like this. He should know better. He promised me so many things and as a young insecure girl I didnt know better.

Just after 2 months, im so much better, more social, more energy and more motivation. Theres order in my things, my head. Of course i still deal with my insecurities but I catch myself thinking negatively and tell myself no, thats an old habit, make a better one.
Thank you for reading this far.

I resent my mother for not trying

I sound like an ass I know but I just want to vent.

I (27F) didn’t grow up with my parents. My mother had me when she was young and couldn’t afford to raise me so I grew up with a relative and lived a pretty privileged life.

When I was 15 I was kicked out of the house (hilarious story for another time) and that’s when I started ‘reconnecting’ with my parents. It was the first time meeting my father and seeing how they live etc.

Now I want to make it clear that where I’m from, there’s a lot of poverty and life is not easy, but I guess you can say that about any place really. I was lucky to get a good education so even when I stopped living with my aunt, I’ve managed to get a job take care of myself. I’m by no means rich but you know, I have a roof over my head and I eat everyday and I’m healthy.

My father works for a church and my mother works for the local council and they love their kids and respective spouses (I’m their fist born).

Recently (maybe it’s because I’m going through a career crisis and I’m looking for how to better my life), I’ve started resenting my parents (mostly my mother). I’m surrounded by people who are from strong family units (no family is perfect of course) and even at my age, I can see the difference between myself and my peers whose parents are accomplished and are able to guide them through their careers, marriages, school etc.

Of course I understand that people come from different backgrounds and and I don’t want money or anything from my parents, but I always joke with my mother and say when your friends were buying land and gaining assets for themselves and their kids, where were you? My thing is that she doesn’t try to do better for herself. She doesn’t want to go back to school, she doesn’t what to start a business, she’s comfortable living in her poverty but I have 2 younger siblings and I don’t think that’s fair to them.

I help out when I can but, I wonder why she doesn’t want to push herself, even just for the sake of her kids. She’s married to a very hard working man and he tries his best but I imagine how different her life would have be for her if she applied herself. Hell all our lives, maybe I wouldn’t have gone through what I went though as a kid (but dwelling on the past doesn’t matter now I know).

I know I sound judgemental but from the time I was 15 to now when I’m 27, her life and living conditions have not improved. Her sisters are constantly building their lives and trying to be better but she doesn’t want to change. I sometimes feel like if I had parents who planned and were intentional, maybe things would be (not be easier) but maybe better. I’m so scared of failing because that means living a life like hers but I know that’s unkind and unfair. Because of this resentment I find myself pulling away from my parents and to an extent the rest of my family.

Even the conversations we have are not inspiring, nothing on how to achieve certain goals, just mundane things that don’t even matter. I would say maybe she grew up in a different time and has a different mentality but the people around her are evolving. It’s not really my business since she’s happy (I guess) but I feel so… disappointed.

I’m probably coming off as high and mighty but that’s just how I feel.

I don’t talk to my parents much (I don’t talk to anyone much in general) and I want to be more connected but visiting my mother is depressing.

If you’re wondering why the heat is only on my mum, my dad himself is a humble man but he put himself through graduate school so that he can earn more for his kids. I have my issues with him (another hilarious story) but he’s trying. Even her husband is putting himself through school so that he can better himself. Everyone is trying except her.

i just want to give up.

I’m a 24 year old mom in school. my son is 4, I’m married to a great man, and I love my little family so much. I would do anything for them. But recently i feel like even doing everything I can do is not enough.

I’m unemployed at the moment because I injured my hip at my last job. I live in NYC so you would think thered be endless jobs i could get but ive applied to over 200 since then and there’s nothing. no responses. no letters informing me i wasn’t selected. just silence.

we are in debt at the moment. our car is about to be towed or get a boot on it for like the 3rd time in 2 months because everytime it seems we’ve paid off our tolls or tickets, we get mail saying we owe thousands of dollars more that we didn’t even know about and that is the god honest truth. we did not know. currently they’re asking for almost $2k and they won’t give us a payment plan. we have about $5k more debt in bills that we have to pay off immediately as well.

it feels like my husband is giving up on me. it feels like he doesn’t see how hard i’m trying. to him i guess it seems like i’m at home all day doing nothing, when really i’m busy raising our son, trying to find a job, trying to do everything i have to do for school, and losing my fucking mind. i am not okay with our situation. at all. but to be fair to him i do act pretty nonchalant about it, because i know crying and screaming and getting angry won’t help. and i think that combined with me not seeing any result from my effort is maybe why he feels this way. 

but i am really, really stressed, and depressed, and i’m starting to believe that i am just wasting space here. i feel like my effort is all for nothing. it’s not producing any kind of result. it’s not making things any better. i can’t contribute financially. i don’t even have $2 to my name. any kind of money i get goes directly to our family’s needs. and it’s not a lot. 

i know my son needs me and i would never want to leave him. but the idea of just offing myself is pretty tempting i’m not gonna lie. it’s selfish and horrible, but i think about it a lot. genuinely i feel that life is not worth living for me, and i feel bad that i brought another person into the world to deal with it. although i know my son will do great things when he gets older and be better off than i am, i just hope he never has to feel the way i feel now. 

not really looking for advice, just ranting to the only place i can without being institutionalized lol. thanks for reading.

My step dad had a massive heart attack

On Halloween, 7am, my mom asked my step dad to start her car. I don't remember the context of that morning or why he was starting the car. All I remember is the haze of him clutching his chest and saying he may need to go to the hospital. I called 911 because my mom started panicking. I rushed to get my jeans on because I fully intended on going but my mother had me stay behind to take care of their animals. I am staying with them through a divorce and it's been hard to find a place to rent.

He had one stent put in, previous to this. I waited hours to hear back. My mom eventually called to tell me it was a massive heart attack. That they went through his wrist to give give five other stents. That he was shocked back to life five times (later found out it was four). We've been up to visit him twice since then but have been letting him rest.

I obsessively think about my parents dying, and what might happen once they do. We are all very close. My family lives on one big farm compound in Northern Michigan and we are all very supportive of each other. This was life's rude wakeup call for me. I've been thinking about the very disturbing reality of losing him now. He's more of a father to me than my bio dad. 

I wish I could reassure myself that things will go back to normal. His heart is functioning at 35 percent. I don't want to see my mom go through losing the love of her life after her struggle finding love through my teenage years. We have lost so many people in our family. Please. I need good energy. I need luck on my side, just this one fucking time. Please.
