Idk what I need, a reality check? advice? I want to talk about this but most the people I talk to have a biased opinion

My ex (24f) and I (24m) had been on and off since December 2020. We were 19, and we had dated over the summer of freshman to sophomore year when we were 14. She had left me for another woman then. 

When we were 19 we both lived with our parents, she practically moved in with me in the first 2 weeks of dating, my home was chaotic, and her home was the same. We started  living at her place when my sister kept creating fights and making my house unbearable to live in. Her dad died January 2021 and I went with her to the funeral in another state, watching her ball her eyes out I promised to his casket that I didn't want to see her sad like that again. We got our first apartment midway through 2021. I had a full-time blue collar job and she was working as a server. Our schedules were so conflicting we started putting Monday aside to have a day to spend together. Few months into this lease, she was spending time with friends at clubs constantly and I was playing video games, and smoking weed constantly. Our relationship started falling apart. Before our next lease, she broke up with me. I had been planning on going into the military and she said the only way we would stay together was if I married her. We broke up because she felt like I wasn't putting in enough effort with dates and such. We got back together cause I was putting in effort again trying to pick up the pieces. Not long until our next lease, we broke up again because of a fight we had in our new apartment. In that next month I had asked if she was seeing anyone else and she wouldn't tell me because single and that wasn't my info to know about. But we also were having a lot of breakup sex for a week. Month or two later she finds out she's pregnant and flips a switch trying to act like a perfect partner. We had previously agreed not to have a kid if I got her pregnant and we had used plan B but she wasn't gonna abort this one. Near the end of the pregnancy I felt conflicted about being a dad, she wouldn't admit to sleeping with other people at the time I got her pregnant, we had previously agreed to not have a child and I didn't trust that switch up she did. She suggested having my sister move in with me and take over her spot on the lease and she was gonna stay at her sisters. I thought this sounded like a good idea and would provide less stress for the pregnancy as to not stunt the baby being born whether I was gonna be there or not. After our daughter was born I came around and was there to help whenever I could. We started seeing each other again and eventually got back together but I had signed up to do commercial fishing in Alaska and had landed the job. She started living with her mom and while I was on the boat I hated it at first wishing I never left and seeing that our relationship was turning around I wished I was home. Second trip (you have to do 2 to get travel expenses paid off) I started coming around in the job and saw it as an opportunity. We discussed a plan of me going back after coming home and saving to pay for technical college out of pocket and get her a car. When I was home though, our relationship fell apart again. We weren't doing couples counseling anymore and I was more focused on saving money for our goals than spending it while I was home. I bought an suv that better suited our family needs and was a better family car than my coupe. She broke up with me again so I stayed instead of going back and picked up my old job. I was helping her family clean out a relatives house and she "fell back in love with me again" so we started seeing each other again. I moved back in with her again and she pushed for me to go into that technical college. I told her it was gonna cause more stress and disconnection in our relationship, she assured me that we were doing this for our family and we've got this. A few months in I told her I felt insecure about our relationship, that I could feel the disconnection growing and I wanted reassurance. She said, we've got this. About a month later we had a bad argument. Previously I would shut up and shut down, but in the last year I started started responding in these arguments. I was tired of being berated, devalued and yelled at and wanted to figure out how to communicate and stand up for myself. I could never get 10 seconds into a response without her rolling her eyes, dismissing what I was saying that "we didn't speak the same language" and I "didn't listen" then she'd walk away. She eventually spent the night at a house she was pet sitting for and we argued on the phone after I told her I wished the cars coming into our lot were her. She said she didn't want to be together romantically, we would coexist till I got out of school, I better get good grades and I better f'ing graduate. After this fight I carved time out of my schedule for us to go do something every week with our little family and then she broke up with me at the end of the month. We still had a trip planned for my bday about a week and a half out. It was good trip, good reconnection but she stood by not wanting to be together and at one point she gave me her phone to take a pic on Snapchat. I swiped over to see who she was texting and saw someone's name as "my hotel" with a bunch of hearts. She had been spending nights at her pet sitting houses often after we had that argument when she left for the night. She had written me something before that night we had the final straw argument but didn't give it to me or mention she wrote it till after the argument. So when we got back home I asked to hear what she wrote. Gist of it was that she felt "majority unhappy throughout our relationship" and she "didn't receive the love, care, and attention needed to stay" she also said she saw someone a year ago when we were broken up who made her feel all these honeymoon phase feelings but she cut them off cause she didn't feel like she deserved that relationship and I had been helping her family but she kept reminiscing on how that person made her feel when she was unhappy in our relationship. We set boundaries that night then like 2 nights later we set a plan. It was that we were gonna coexist and coparent until I was out of school and focus on our daughter. She then admitted that she was seeing someone else and I asked when it started, she said it started the day we had broken up. I said I figured then asked if I knew the person. She said I hadn't met them but they had met our daughter cause they used to get lunch together and she's bring our daughter. She tried saying this was a new man and I came to find out it was the same person she left me for when we were 14 but they've had a sex change and have changed so she didn't see them as her ex. Anyway, after revealing she was seeing someone else and tried playing it off like this was a new person, not from her past she went into our bedroom, came back out to share some funny stuff her sister sent her then came back out again and told me she was gonna go spend the night. I asked "at his place?" She said yes. So I out in my shoes and left to my sister's for 2 days. She was trying to get me to stay by saying she wasn't gonna leave and she'd stay but I needed my space. When I came back home she said she was changing our lease and now the two of us have separate 1 bedroom apts in the same complex. I took a pay cut because I leave work early for night classes and have 0 free time after being in school. I'm struggling, meanwhile she's being showered with attention by this new boyfriend and going out doing stuff with them constantly. We had agreed not to incorporate this person into our daughters life for at least 2 months (Nov 1) but my daughter started saying their name a week after my ex got her new apartment when our daughter used to never say their name. I eventually said just incorporate them, you already have and she was uncomfortable with me meeting them one in one, at a point sending me a page with articles about blended families and on that page were a bunch of articles about step parenting. Now Halloween rolls around and she brings this new boyfriend to a trunk or treat event at our daughter's cousin's elementary school. We re meet at her sisters house as the plan was to trunk or treat then truck or treat with our daughter and her cousins cause that would make her more comfortable. She didn't stay for the truck or treating stating that her and her new bf were gonna go pick up his friends for them to hang out with. I wasn't a bad partner, I'm a good man and a good father but I'm constantly being attacked even now while I'm trying to be as civil as possible. Anything that can upset my ex in a situation between the two of us becomes extremely disrespectful from her end. I spent years chasing being tolerated by someone rather than loved and respected. We both grew apart and we're both responsible for things not working. But it's so hard to move on from someone you envisioned a life with and invested a fifth of your life into. Plus I feel that I recognize that my life partner (whether we're romantically together or not) has a mental illness so I don't want to give up on them and ironically I don't want them to feel not worthy of all I have to give cause I've been told I'm unworthy of them for years. I'm trying to focus on school and my daughter but I stay up thinking of what went wrong. She's a hard, deep lover when she's in love but becomes bitter and mean when she's not. I know I did what I could and never stopped trying so I won't be losing sleep on that but I wish there was a way to make me stop thinking about them all the time. I know they're not thinking about me, their main priority now seems to be her and her boyfriend and our daughter. Im used to the usual advice of focus on your school and your daughter but that doesn't stop the thoughts. Anyone do anything that helped them move on? Thank you for reading.

If I had to be as good faith as possible I'd say both genders are having significant conflict with the other's general attitude about dating. People have little patience, little time, and little social capital to sink into an endless slog through dating apps. People are tired and depressed and therefore our interactions with each other suffer.

I got back in bed because I’ve given up on today already. I suspect I have a hormone imbalance that’s affecting everything about my health. Lately I feel like it’s giving me so much rage and I just feel irritable and angry. I’m also having physical symptoms, and I have for a while. I know if I wanted to fix it, I’d need to see a doctor, but I haven’t been to a doctor in years. I can’t afford the dr visit and blood tests right now. And if it is a hormone imbalance they’ll just put me on pills and I can’t afford that long term either. I also know that a hormone imbalance like what I think I’m experiencing increases the risk of blood clots or heart disease. I’ve already decided that if I have a heart attack or stroke and die then that’s perfectly fine. I’ve been looking for a way out for years and if I’m going to die from a stroke because my hormones have been messed up, that’s fine. I just don’t want to deal with it. In the meantime, day to day, it makes me feel so gross and I hate the side effects I deal with. But I just deal with them. The irritability and mood swings are making me feel bad though. 
I don’t think my partner that I live with and have been with for many years actually loves me and I don’t blame him. I think he’s still stuck in the trauma from his last relationship and hasn’t healed from his marriage ending with his ex. I think he’s still has unresolved feelings about their marriage that he will probably never deal with. I think he’s in a relationship with me because it’s convenient and secure. I think if he was any healthier himself he’d leave me. But this is something else I just accept. It just sucks. Day to day, we’re happy with each other though. I don’t know if he’s just settled for me. 

Today I just feel apathetic. I tried going about my morning routine and doing the daily things that get me through the day and I couldn’t even try. Nothing brought me any pleasure and it felt like dragging myself around the house and my brain wasn’t present either. I just got tired of existing outside my bed, so I got back in it. If I feel nothing when I’m asleep I won’t know that I feel nothing. 
My best, oldest, and only friend got arrested for a DWI recently and hearing this completely came out of nowhere and shocked me. We live in different states now and I haven’t seen them in a couple years. This isn’t the same person I knew. I was totally blindsided and it’s unfortunately changed the way I see our friendship. I haven’t wanted to talk to my one friend and I wonder if our friendship will end soon. As lonely as I might be, I can’t see myself being friends with the type of person to drive drunk. But it hurts and is confusing because they are my oldest friend and I thought I loved them. It’s scary to think about and I worry about the loneliness might feel soon. I don’t have any family. I just have my boyfriend, and our relationship for the most part is great and comfortable. We get along well and live together and things outwardly look fine. But I just don’t think he really loves me like I love him. 
I have no money, education, or skills and what’s worse, no desire to pursue any of that. Every day I just wait to die.

I can’t hold it anymore

I do not know if I have depression or some other stuff, but I know I want to die since forever. Life started when I was 5, at least there I started to remember. And since then I had these thoughts.
When I was little my reason where the sexual abuse I had to endure and the divorce my parents had. On top of that it wasn’t just a divorce. They make me try to pick and said the worst about the other part, while they didn’t care to check on their daughter.
I ran with closed eyes one a street corner where cars wouldn’t see me. Sadly the car that run me over didn’t hurt me that bad.
Now that I’m older I can see, this was my first attempt.
Back then I often prayed to god that he should take me away as a sacrifice and take the pain away from kids that felt the same.
Needless to say, I don’t believe in god now.

I endured this all till I was 12 years old. Got badmouth a lot by my mother because I didn’t want to see my abuser (she didn’t know and he was part of the new family my mother made). Calling me a bad child all the time.
I felt like i don’t belong in any family. My dad had another girlfriend and my mother another husband with kids that came over the years.
Both trying to badmouth the other but just making me feel not belonging to someone.
One day the abuser stayed by our apartment and i needed to greet him because he was staying overnight. I couldn’t just don’t do it like I always did. My mother insisted.
I then I told her. She obviously was crying and confronted him. And obviously he was defending himself with „she seduced me“ and other stuff. She even found out, that my stepfather new about one incident because I told him. He told me he will take care and didn’t do none. He didn’t even asked me if there where other occasions.
I think she was in a deep hole after gering this info. Her world crumbled and her marriage too. She tried to deal with it by constantly talking to me about it.
Me on the other hand, was usually coping it with forgetting about it. This was Not possible for me anymore.
I started to self harm myself at this point because I couldn’t run away anymore like I used to.
And my stepfather just ignored it and tried to keep connecting with my abuser. Trying to show him my siblings, because he is still his grandfather and he was just a good dad for him back then.
My mother involved me in every detail. Each detail destroyed me. But i can’t tell how i feel, because she said I should not talk to him. So I was bottling up everything.
There where so much more happening what led me to go to the police. I filed a report, even though my mother urgently advised against it.
Because of unfortunate events and the testify of my mother the abuser didn’t got locked up. Didn’t even get a sentence. And I didn’t had the energy for second round.

After that my mother told me she was such a bad mother, because when I was 4 I told her he touched me. He brushed it off as he was lecturing me and slapped my hand back because I behaved bad. My mother knew I was a well behaved child. Really always.
She said in this moment she had a black out. 
I didn’t even know it started when I was 4. but it makes sense now that I didn’t reach out to someone. Because I tried to and was denied.

My first relationships where violent. I still have a scar in my face from the second on.
He even pushed me to online prostitution. I didn’t want to and numerous time I tried to quit, but he talked me in again or meet me with violence. It was hard to get out, because I had nobody. I came home with bruises or a blue eye, but my mother didn’t beat an eye because he was telling her I do it to myself. She believed it.
Often even said to me I can’t be with my siblings alone because she is scared I will do something to them. I Never did, said it or even thought about to be clear. I love my little siblings dearly and just want to protect them.
My second attempt where I cut my wrist was in this second relationship. I felt deep depression and hoped to get some strength from him. But he didn’t want me when i wasn’t happy and ready to party. So I say I can go home. I think to this day, he still thinks I was jealous because he was talking with a friend in his bathroom- meanwhile me being in his bedroom crying.
I just needed a simple hug.

I must say my last relationship felt like home. I think this was the first time I felt loved, understood and cared but also I felt guilty because I was not healed to feel everything. 
I needed to end it because the relationship drained me and I was 24/7 on my phone to escape reality. Sadly it went downhill because of some things. I don’t really want to go into detail, because i still love him dearly (his absence pains me deeply) and I think in this case both could have done better.
I just couldn’t go with him anymore in his journey, because I lost myself on the way.
But I do regret now that I found myself again a little bit (at least energy wise). Now I’m just 3-4 hours at my phone at least.

I never had a peaceful mind.
And it happened so much more. Now I’m in a point where i don’t really feel positive emotions. I only feel pain.
When I’m laughing, it does not feel genuine. It feels like I’m acting. Playing where I know back then i would have laughed for real.
I feel a deep void in me that just got bigger and bigger over the years. Each little or big sad event hurts me deeply more and more.
I usually got out somehow but I do not have hope anymore. I talked with friends, I did Walks, I tried to get a therapist (impossible in my town I really tried for half a year. My energy is leaving me i can’t anymore), I tried to be more active, really everything - but this feels different. I know i can’t bounce back.

I just want to die so bad. I just have this stupid instinct. I can’t cut deep enough.
I think I just wanna know, how can I die pain free and release myself? 
And please don’t come with I’m selfish, there are good things or so on. My life is shit thru and thru. It took one friend 5 hours to tell her everything and she even could admit that my life is like a drama and everybody hated me so far.
I do not have happiness anymore and I just want peace one time in life.
So if there is a method where i don’t need to hurt myself like that and do it with one go, please tell me.
It’s hard to find something when there are only these damn hotlines popping up, where the person on the other side sees you as a burden too.

It sounds ridiculous, but by the age of 13 I totally lost my motivation to care about my life or what happens to me.

I lost my social life. It never recovered. I used to be friends with a lot of people, had a few really close friends. But then I lost all my friends. I lost all my social status and instead of being normal I suddenly became an outcast.

I lost my trust in family. They made me feel horrible when I started failing in life, they only made me feel worse about it. So I stopped trusting them too and thought they all hated me and looked down on me.

At 16 I started high school and I made a few new friends, I also fell in love with a girl who I thought I felt like I truly clicked with, who I truly felt I would be happy with, who I thought could motivate me to care about my life again. On some level, I thought that if I got a girlfriend I really liked, like her, then I could be happy and my family and friends could see that I was happy and congratulate me for no longer being a failure.

It never happened because I was too much of a coward to take the chances I got to get closer to her. Every time I felt hopeless about being with her, I retreated into pornography and video games and the internet, I gave up on everything else and as I lost more and more hope, I eventually failed my last courses in high school.

  
I'm 22 now and I still haven't gotten over it. I have no motivation to do anything aside from eating, sleeping and further depressing myself with porn and various masochistic fantasies. I don't even care about getting my family to like me or feel like I'm successful anymore. At this point it wouldn't even matter.

"Wow, he got his first girlfriend at 22? Wow, he got his first job at 22? Wow, he wrote a book at 22? Wow, he got into university at 22? Wow, he went to his first party at 22? He went out drinking with friends at 22?"

When I was 16 it would've been normal, it would've been healthy. It would've been proof of social success and healthy development. Now, at 22? It's not remotely impressive, it's more like a: "better late than never" and that's not enough for me.

I don't feel motivated to do anything because it's too late to be impressive. I'm unhealthy, I have unhealthy development, my life is fucked up and no amount of partying or friends or anything in my 20s will ever change peoples perception of me because they all know I'm a social failure.

  
I know I'm a selfish, horrible person. I know there's so many people who I've hurt because I refuse to care about myself unless I have some motivation to do so. Friends I've abandoned, family I've made to worry, people and duties I've neglected. I can't enjoy anything because I know it will never be as good as it could've been if I didn't fail to save my life by getting that girl.

I'm not suicidal but I'm at a point where I 've realized I don't care what happens to me, and I haven't truly cared since I was 13. I lost everything and I thought I could get it back and be happy again, but I lost the one chance I truly had to do so.

I'm at a point where it's too late to be normal, too late to be healthy, too late to be impressive. My options are to be nothing or to be exceptional. And I don't even have the motivation to be anything, much less normal, much less exceptional. Because I have nothing to do it for, nobody to do it for.

The Fuck It Point.

Hi. (34/m/enby). Been around a bit, trying to keep other people going.

  
I think I am rapidly approaching my "fuck it" point. If you don't know, which you might not, it's a hypothesis I and possibly others have come up with where once someone reaches that point, there's not a single goddamn thing anyone can do to save them.

  
I think I am rapidly getting there. No, this isn't a, 'poor me, pity me' post. It's more of a, 'if this is how it's gonna be...' type of post. So buckle up. It's gonna be a bit of explanation.

  
I was diagnosed with schizoaffective disorder, ADHD, C-PTSD, generalized anxiety disorder, and I am self-diagnosed based on clinical presentation with ASD. Those, combined with a few other things, make me difficult to work with, get along with, etc.

  
And now we've got the looming uncertainties. Food insecurity knocking at the door of my home. The potential for *home* insecurity. Because of me. Because I can't keep a fucking job. Because I can't *get* a decent paying job. Because of this fucking heartless administration withholding funds. Shit like that.

  
But wait, there's more.

  
I'm a failing author wannabe. One book published, two almost published. Barely any sales. Barely anything to show for it. Just... failing all around. And now?

  
Well, I am to the point where *every waking moment,* my intrusive thoughts tell me about twenty different ways to off myself. It's like before I was medicated, but now about 600x worse. And at this point, I feel like an anchor around the necks of my fiancee, my daughter, our roommates, and everyone ***I have ever fucking known.*** I don't know what to do anymore.

  
I've worked as an AEMT, I've worked as a janitor, as a plasma center phlebotomist, all sorts of shit. None of it has given me an idea on what to do in this situation. None of it. I was training to be a 68W in the US Army. Went through the Battlemind bullshit, that did nothing.  I don't. Fucking. Know. Anymore.

  
My editor/boss/best friend says to just exist out of spite, but I am so low in the goddamn tank at this point that "E" may as well be a million gallons away. My car is barely holding together, I have to bleed for basic necessities, and even that goes mostly to bills.

  
I don't know how much longer I can hang on at this point.

>See group of people having fun
>They notice me looking
>Look down, stare at my table, don't look at them
>They make coughing noises, use swear words, are clearly angry I noticed them

Why should I have to leave in this scenario? How is it my fault i noticed somebody who is out in public? Why do people force their insecurities onto me?

My brother tried to off himself yesterday and I’m thousands of miles away. I don’t know what to do.

I don’t even know how to put this into words. My little brother is in the US, and I’m far away from him. Yesterday he tried to take his own life. I only found out because one of his friends reached out to me, and everything I’ve heard since has completely overwhelmed me.

I hadn’t talked to him properly for a month, and suddenly I’m being told that he’s been dealing with something incredibly heavy. His friends cut him off, rumors started spreading, and he isolated himself for days. I also learned about painful things from his past things he never told me before and it all hit me at once.

When I finally spoke to him, he broke down crying. He told me he hadn’t eaten in a week. He said he felt alone, ashamed, terrified, and overwhelmed. Hearing him say those things and knowing he seriously tried to end his life… it broke me. I’m still shaking.

He’s my little brother. Yes, he made mistakes, but I can’t hate him. All I feel is fear and anxiety. I have a fear of losing him, fear of what happens next, and fear because I can’t be there physically to support him.

I don’t know how to tell our parents. He begged me not to, and I don’t want to betray his trust. But I’m also drowning in worry and guilt, and I don’t know how much longer I can carry this on my own. I feel completely lost.

I wish I could talk to someone in real life, but I’m terrified of accidentally starting rumors. So I’m posting here because I just need someone , anyone to hear me. I feel like I’m falling apart.

Anyone with similar anxiety/panic attacks, what helped you?[might be triggering for some]

Hey all!

Probably a couple of questions like this already here, partially wanted to vent a bit and looking for advice. In high school I was a kid with big social anxiety, went to see a few therapists, turned out I had GAD. I did not want to take any medication, so mostly we just did therapy, but it was really helpful. Still I had anxiety, but it got much better.

Now I’m in my 30s, and recently started to get pretty bad panic attacks. Felt like I had lots of things figured out, life is not that stressful. 

But oh no. First I noticed them on hights, like taking a cable car to top of a mountain, turned out was super scary , had a mild panic attack. Then more with these situations. Usually it seems to come out when I feel I can’t escape the situation fast. Elevator stuck, even car sometimes, like for example in a traffic jam, underground tram stops, etc. And some of these, I’m also afraid that I go into panic mode and accidentally jump out or something, because I feel I need to escape the situation and run away from the situation.  Never happened yet and I’d never do something like that  normally, I reallly like my life, so its very scary. Get very nauseous, heart rate very elevated etc. I’m afraid I’ll have a heart attack as well etc. 

It’s just really annoying, I’ll defnitely see a therapist again, but also wanted to ask if maybe something was helpful for these for someone, and to just write it out a bit. 

Thanks :)

>>83238198
AI nanobots that prevent any conflict

1. Saying dating is a meritocracy makes people feel morally safe. If dating is based on "merit," then everyone who is successful can believe they earned it. They do not have to face the fact that a huge chunk of attraction is luck, timing, genetics, childhood environment, and personality traits they never worked for. The myth of "meritocracy" protects egos.

2. It is easier to blame the struggling person than admit randomness. If dating is not a meritocracy, then some people suffer through no fault of their own. Most people hate admitting that. So they say, "If you just did X, you would get dates," because blaming effort feels safer than accepting unfairness.

3. A meritocracy narrative makes people feel in control. "Anyone can succeed if they try!" This sounds inspiring and comforting. Admitting that attraction is partially chaotic and irrational feels uncomfortable. So people choose the story that feels good, not the story that is accurate.

4. People confuse correlation with causation. Attractive or socially gifted people often just happen to do good habits. Normies look at them and say, "See? They work out and socialize, so that must be why they succeed." But those habits often come after success, not before it. Confidence produces good habits, not the other way around.

5. Pretending it is a meritocracy absolves people from empathy. If dating works because of "merit," they do not have to empathize with anxious, awkward, or unlucky men. They can say "just try harder" instead of acknowledging that the playing field is uneven.

6. Western culture is obsessed with the self-made individual. The idea that "anyone can improve themselves into success" is practically a cultural religion. Admitting that attraction is not fair threatens that worldview.

7. If dating is not a meritocracy, then: some people get lucky, some people get screwed, effort is not always rewarded, doing everything "right" might still fail, and some people succeed without even trying. Life is fake.

The quote is used to show the diversity of opinions regarding Plato. Marx had one very strange interpretation that was not universal; this interpretation (although he doesn't say Plato is revolutionary in the way you assume) is JUST a narrative account, and one that is less accurate than Popper's assessment of Platonic political philosophy.
>so you're suggesting that, according to the marxist definition of a reactionary, karl popper called plato a reactionary. so you're suggesting that karl popper had a marxist definition of what a reactionary was?
Case in point while I was writing this. This is a refutation solely of your attempt to argue that there is an objective "revolutionary tradition." There is none. The "tradition" that you perceive is a narrative explanation of events that unify radically different and opposing ideologies simply under the idea that they 'change things', but in the same, very limited way, this means there is a reactionary tradition. "Socdems" are some of those reactionaries, as in reactionary socialism (as detailed by Marx). Marxist definition or not, this is irrelevant, as I was opting to give you definitions from the tradition of Marxism as you yourself mentioned first: >>83150736
>the revolutionary tradition, on the other hand, and marxism have a history that goes back centuries if not millennia
Here is the wikipedia:
>In politics, a reactionary is a person who favors a return to a previous state of society which they believe possessed positive characteristics absent from contemporary society.
>my assumption is that successive thinkers clearly were inspired
And this does not imply that there is an objective "Marxist tradition that goes baxk millennia" any more than the ideas of Fuentes et al. are inspired by the thinkers of Catholicism, who themselves were inspired by philosophy tracing their roots to Plato. It is a meaningless statement.

Am pakistani. I can't speak for india but in pakistan we have a very strong culture of hospitality. Also, if they are sikh then you should have no fears. Sikh people are some of the kindest people you will ever meet. There was even a diwali festival near here a while ago, and after the parades all the Sikhs picked up their trash and left the street spotless. And I say this as a muslim.

But you should know, smells are very strong. Indian cooking is very fragrant (lots of onions, garlic, and ginger), so if you have a sensitive nose or if they have poor ventilation (smell can seep in to your clothes if so) that's something to keep in mind. A good amount of (but not all) families use incense as well. Also, they can be loud too (but what's the point of a quiet home).

Go into it with an open mind, they are people just like you. They have dreams, aspirations, loved ones, relationships, jokes, laughs, sadness, and more. Be open to making a connection with them; show them understanding and kindness and they'll reflect it back. Don't judge people off of the brain rot you see online

Thursday Entry

Silent Thursday's Unexpected Gift


Silent Thursday, over—the labor done, the long shift finally through. The side-line work achieved, but only just; the effort left me blue. 

Yet, there's the meager prize: enough reward to tide me over for three, While the domestic pile looms large, demanding more and more of me.

 I'm running ragged, spent completely, exhausted down to the bone, When my phone lights up, a vibrant buzz, a message from the Great Unknown.

And then I read the words, an absolute, stunning, vibrant breach of sense: "I found your personality... it's so addictive," stripped of all pretense. 

What the hell?! The utter shock! I stare; me, scattered, weary, and frayed? The person who sees this side of me, this messy, working-class parade? 

It's a bizarre, bright compliment thrown at the brink of utter collapse, A bewildering mirror held up, catching light in all the cracks and gaps!

Anyone else dealing with nervous system overdrive before a big life change?

Hi everyone,
lately I’ve been dealing again with a kind of anxiety that I can only describe as “nervous system overdrive.”
It’s not a specific fear — it’s more like my whole system is running too fast:
constant fatigue, waking up early, racing thoughts, loss of appetite, dry mouth, frequent urge to pee, irritability, poor concentration.
My body feels like it’s on constant alert, as if something bad is about to happen, even though there’s no real reason for it.

I know there’s been a lot of stress recently: pressure at work and a baby on the way (our first child is due at the end of January ❤️).
It feels like everything has piled up in my head and my nervous system just got exhausted.

Has anyone else experienced something similar?

I’m genuinely curious if others have gone through these periodic “overdrive” phases — when all the anxiety symptoms hit at once even though, logically, you know there’s no real danger.

As a man / soon-to-be dad, do you have any good advice on handling the stress before the baby arrives?

Thanks so much in advance for any help or experiences you can share. 🙏

She shows you love when you have nothing, and he show her love when you have everything.

Looking for honest perspective on a situation that still haunts me (TW: sexual privacy violation)

I’ve been struggling emotionally this year, and something from my past keeps coming back up. I’m trying to understand my part in it and whether I should still feel as guilty as I do.

A while ago, I was talking to a guy for a couple of months. When we first started getting to know each other, he introduced me to one of his friends. His friend started showing interest in me, and at that time I was in a really bad emotional place. I felt lonely and the attention made me feel wanted. Even though I was already seeing the first guy, I ended up getting involved with his friend too.

It didn’t take long before the guy I was originally seeing found out. He blew up on me. He called me names, cussed me out, and told me I didn’t respect myself. I felt like absolute trash afterward.

Later on, I found out that both of them actually had girlfriends the entire time. So while they were acting mad at me and judging me, they were literally cheating on their own partners. The hypocrisy still blows my mind.

What’s been weighing on me even more is something I only learned about afterward. The guy I was originally seeing recorded us during sex without telling me. He kept the video and showed it to people in my close circle once he found out about me and his friend. I had no idea he recorded anything until after it was already shared.

I know I made mistakes. I’m not pretending I didn’t. But I can’t tell how much blame I should carry for the messy relationship stuff versus how much of the guilt I’m holding that doesn’t actually belong to me. I keep going back and forth between feeling ashamed and feeling angry about how everything happened.

I’m just trying to understand my own responsibility in all of this and whether I’m being too hard on myself. I’d appreciate honest thoughts from anyone who’s been through something similar or has some perspective.

My childhood best friend's fiancé hates me for being with my boyfriend?

This is a large, long and tangled story, but I still can't let it go and I have no one irl that is not directly involved to talk about it with. I'll be glossing over A LOT cause this is so incredibly extensive and because almost everyone involved uses reddit.

To begin, I (20 afab) had a close friend at school from the ages of 11-16. He (I'll call him K here) and I were in the same friend groups throughout school and played a lot of video games together. I knew he had a crush on me when we were younger, but as we got closer at around 14 I realized those feelings were still there. 
I've always had low self esteem and got really wrapped up in the attention he have me, but after it went too far once I did tell him I didn't reciprocate his feelings. This did become a cycle though where I welcomed his attention in-between my short relationships, but shut him down again when I entered a new one. Yes this was so fucking mean of me, I know that now, at that time I was 15 and trying to navigate my own unstable mind, I also had to manage his. Because K was very obsessive and clingy to me, if I did  anything that he read as me being upset at him he could go so far as threatening to harm himself. (This happened more than once). So, when we changed schools for our equivalent of high-school, I made sure to take some distance to him to force him to make his own friends. Which actually went well. He pretty quickly found his now fiancé and her friend group, which he clicked with. I was so happy for him. 
I joined them quite often that first year, I got to know K's fiancé very well (I'll call her H from now on) and really liked her. But one thing led to another and in year two I got to know she still accociated with some people who were really shitty people, like tried to ruin another of my friend's lives (literally planned murder) and that she had made said friend pretty upset and uncomfortable. So I took some distance because I didn't know how to feel. 
A few months later I was dumped by a long term partner and was single ober the summer, right when we were about to start school again I realized that I had feelings for H's friend who were in their friend group. I took my time and talked to H, first to apologize for my behavior the past months and for not coming to her and actually talking about it before, and then about my feeling for our mutual friend. She made it clear that she didn't think it was a good idea to pursue him for multiple personal reasons, and I agreed with her. I wasn't going to pursue him, I just wanted to talk about my feelings. When school did start I couldn't hold it back though. So I told my now boyfriend about my feelings. A flip in H instantly switched. I texted her right after to say I fucked up, but also to make it clear to both her and my now bf that he didn't have to answer or reciprocate, I just needed to get it off my chest. But that didn't matter. H started ignoring us both, K did too, but only because whatever H says is law to him. I tend to ask H what was wrong, I tried to apologize again, but nothing got any other answer than "it's fine" or silence. My bf did slowly rebuild his friendship with her, but without me being mentioned. 
I have given up on rebuilding my relationship with her, but it still hurts to not know why even this all turned out this way. I want the connection we had back, but I try to console myself knowing she maybe isn't a great person. My bf and K are still great friends and it makes me kinda happy to know that K is okay and doing well, that's all I could've hoped for him and my bf is doing fine. 
Still feels really shitty knowing I'm the one who's lost the most...

is that counting or not counting gang violence?

OP, your problem is routine. You've built a destructive routine, and brains love routine. The only way out is to break your current routine and build a better one. Easier said than done, right?

I don't have much advice other than this: find the most low-effort areas where you can crack your routine, and thus slowly retrain your brain. It doesn't have to be anything that improves your life right now. It could be taking a different route to work every day. It could be playing a different game, eating a different meal, spending 15 minutes in the evening doing a different activity that you normally don't do, etc. The purpose is to start building the foundation for getting your brain off autopilot. I'm not guaranteeing it'll work, but you may just find it easier to make bigger, more meaningful changes after you do this.

Speech involves timing in a way that writing doesn't. With speech, you have to relay your thoughts and sentences as you form them, leading to stumbling, hesitation and reconsideration. This can also be extended somewhat to text; the format (time sensitivity, typing indicators, etc) place increased urgency on speed causing you to have less time to spend on choosing your words and sentence structure carefully.
But when it comes to emails and internet posts like this one, those limitations are removed and you essentially have all the time in the world to get your point across the right way. I deleted about two thirds of this block of text during its construction but you wouldn't know that unless I told you. With speech, you aren't afforded such a luxury, so you stumble.

I Lost So Much to Mental Health and Agoraphobia and am Struggling to Get Back Up

Hey everyone, I just need to vent a bit. Some kind words, shared experiences, or advice would really mean a lot to me right now 💗

Growing up, I had a lot of blessings. I woke up to warm clothes, porridge for breakfast, and was driven to school. I got to do all the activities I wanted and had fun birthday parties. But even back then, I struggled with anxiety. I remember being no older than 7 and crying and screaming about going to school. The principal would have to come get me.

Around age 11 or 12, things started to get worse. I would have full-blown panic attacks in shopping malls, feeling like everyone was judging me, whether it was about my clothes or my hair. Looking back, it's hard to pinpoint why it started, since my childhood seemed so good overall.

By 15 or 16, things really started to unravel. I couldn’t keep a consistent sleep schedule, and getting up for school was a daily battle with my mom. Eventually, she couldn’t handle it anymore and sent me to live at my dad’s house. It wasn’t much, just a tiny room with a bunk bed and no internet. She was also juggling my sister, who was struggling too, and I think it all became too much for her.

I was constantly exhausted, overwhelmed by anxiety about school, and started coping with comfort eating. As a result, I gained a lot of weight. I found some escape and comfort online, mostly through Discord groups, where I met people who seemed like they understood me. But not all of them were good influences. Some were toxic, and they only made things worse by taking advantage of my vulnerability. I had some friends at school, but they didn’t understand what I was going through. My poor attendance and struggles made them turn on me at times, and I wasn’t always treated kindly. Eventually, I couldn’t handle it anymore, so I left school and finished that year online.

The next five years were a blur. I stayed in my room because I was too ashamed to leave. I remember trying to go out for Christmas dinner once and having to leave because I panicked. My anxiety was so bad that I had to count numbers in my head just to stay calm, but even that wasn’t enough. I felt horrible about my appearance, especially since I’d gained 10, 20, 30 kg. I missed so many important moments in my life because I couldn’t bring myself to leave my room.

During this time, I was also diagnosed with ADHD, OCD, and possibly Autism.

Fast forward to now, I'm 20, almost 21. I’ve lost the weight, but I still feel the aftermath of those lost years. I didn’t look after myself during that time. My teeth have erosion, I’m anemic, and my body shows signs of weight loss, especially around my chest. I feel inadequate when I look in the mirror. It feels like everyone else got to enjoy their youth while I was stuck in my own mind. And even now I still feel like I am struggling to pick up the pieces, I hate the scars that this battle has left me.

I haven’t seen a friend in years. I’m trying to re-enter education, but I feel like I’m so far behind and don't know what to pursue. It feels like I woke up from a five-year nap, and suddenly, I’m expected to be an adult with responsibilities. The world didn’t stop when I needed it to, and now it feels like I missed all the milestones, graduation, friendships, parties, learning to drive, the normal stuff that helps you transition into adulthood.

Thanks for taking the time to read this. I know it’s a lot, but I appreciate any advice or shared experiences. ❤️

My grandmother's deathbed confession and now I'm just left with nothing.

My grandmother died a few weeks ago and right before she passed she dropped this bomb on us - the man I grew up calling grandpa isn't actually my biological grandfather.

She told us who the real one was but like, none of us had ever even heard this guy's name before. He wasn't some old flame or family friend or anything. Just some random guy she hooked up with back in the day. We were all kind of stunned but figured okay, maybe we can at least find out something about him or reach out to his family.

Turns out he died years ago. And his family? Yeah they want absolutely nothing to do with us. We tried reaching out and got basically shut down immediately. 

I don't really know what I expected honestly. They probably had no clue we even existed until we contacted them out of nowhere. Or maybe they did know and just never wanted anything to do with it. Either way it sucks.

The thing is, the man who raised my dad is still my grandpa. That doesn't change. But there's something weird about knowing there's this whole other side of my family out there and it's just a dead end. Like I have this biological connection to people who are complete strangers and fully intend to stay that way.

I guess I'm just venting because it's a mindfuck. My grandmother took this secret to her deathbed (literally) and now I know about it but there's nowhere to go with the information. It's just this weird empty space where family history should be.

How to Stop My Suicidal Thoughts?

Not a day goes by where I don’t think about it. I have thought deeply into the logistics of how, where and when. Carefully crafting a way that would shield those I love from the moment it happens. People generally consider me to be the most positive and bubbly person in the room, but to my core I feel broken in a way that I fear can never be repaired. While I actively work to not let my childhood define my present, I come from a long lineage of deep addition, deaths and mental illnesses. The thought constantly lingers on my mind as if it’s a craving for a sweet. It’s always increasingly difficult around the holidays, but due to current life and critical financial issues, I feel like I’m barely hanging on. I’m scared to leave my friends and those who love me, but I’m exhausted by this life. I’m not sure I’ve ever felt true happiness or peace. Life has always felt like an uphill battle to death to me.

I used to work in property management. A group of early 20 year olds were frantic to find their missing roommate after he left a note. Eventually we found out he drove 1 hour north and jumped in front of a moving train. Less than 24 hours prior, he went grocery shopping and stocked his fridge full, accepted a new job and planned to exit his lease and move in with his new girlfriend. Outside of the obvious devastation for his family and roommates, my first thought was wishing him peace from the demons that carried him. My second, questioning the sudden nature of his decision, how long did it loom? My third thought, wishing I could do the same. The final, will I have a similar fate. Will these thoughts that have consumed me finally take over on a random Tuesday evening, even when my life was seemingly full?

As a young girl I didn’t “believe” in suicide. Even with the passing of my mother, active addition of my father and caring for my brother with a chromosome disorder, I robustly and vocally claimed it selfish. I couldn’t understand and deemed those individuals weak. Perhaps I’m too weak. I’m now freshly 29 and since my early 20s suicide has felt to be a part of my DNA. So much that I couldn’t conceptualize turning 30. As if the trauma of my ancestors finally caught up to me. Perhaps I manifested my own demise with this thinking.

Of note, I am not religious and have been to therapy. I pose this question in honest sincerity and not to receive pity. How do I stop this feeling that almost seems like fate? I feel peace with death. I don’t feel scared. If anything, it feels liberating to know I would indefinitely exit this world. I do feel scared to leave behind my friends and those who love me. Having experienced the reproductions of death, I know the pain that’s inflicted and I can’t bare the thought of harming them indefinitely.

Anxiety stomach ache moves to chest

I have been a long time sufferer of chronic anxiety and I have spent the last two years learning to cope and live with it. I’ve done therapy, a lot of habit building, and started medication about a year ago and it’s helped me immensely. 

Recently, my anxiety has hyper fixated on the idea of my boyfriend and I’s relationship failing/ending. Even though we have a totally healthy relationship and make each other extremely happy, my brain has all the sudden ran the constant thought through my head: “what if you guys aren’t ’meant to be’”

I’ve been redirecting it to more positive thoughts like “he loves you so much” “you guys have great communication” “you both enjoy similar things” and etc.

Normally, when I have anxiety like this I feel it in my stomach. I get an ache and the knot in my stomach, but recently my anxiety’s physical manifestation has moved to my chest. I feel like a have a weight on it and I have never had my anxiety feel like this.

Has anyone else experienced this? Having anxiety symptoms change randomly?

I don't know how to go back to normal with my best friend/ex after he hurt me

I (f22), have a best friend (m26), who I am having a bit of trouble currently navigating a normal relationship with. I apologise in advance for the long post.

We first met online in a Discord server in January of 2025, and we hit it off pretty quick, until he confessed his feelings to me romantically. I returned his feelings at the time, and we began a relationship, but unfortunately things deteriorated since then.

I have C-PTSD and a lot of difficulty forming deeper emotional connections, with a lot of triggers about certain things. I told him specifically that I like to have things be planned, and that I like to be prepared for situations, and how I absolutely hate it when people spend large amounts of money on me in general. I specified that I *need* to take things slow in relationships to feel comfortable, and I don't like it when things escalate too fast. And receiving any gift makes me feel indebted and inadequate of their investment in me, which I told him. I specifically mentioned for him to not spend large amounts of money on me and confided in him how hard it was for me to accept gifts, because my birthday was coming up when the first incident in our relationship happened and he wanted to get me a gift, but I specifically and in-detail told him I wasn't comfortable with large surprises.

He then called me one day in March to tell me he was currently in the airport, showing up in my town (we live on separate continents, so this wasn't a cheap expense) and was going to show up tomorrow. I panicked because I felt very unprepared for this, and he then told me he spend over $1000 to secure us tickets to a show I liked.

I know it seems like a non-issue to complain about someone buying you a nice expensive gift you would like, but suddenly showing up without even checking with me if I'd be okay with it and then doing something I explicitly said I wasn't comfortable with made me feel uneasy. I communicated to him that I wasn't comfortable with it and we moved on from it and things were okay again after that, and he said he'd refrain from spending too much on me until I was more comfortable, in the meantime me telling him I would just prefer he hugs me and spends time with me.

Then, a few months later, he visited again, which was planned, so I was more okay with it. Due to my trauma, I am usually wildly uncomfortable with anything of a sexual nature, and tend to experience dissociative blackouts (I'm diagnosed with a dissociative disorder), so I told him we would have to take it slow in that regard, which he said he was fine with. I told him that I needed him to always ask me before touching me in any way that could be construed as sexual, because otherwise, I'd just let him do whatever he wanted and not remember it afterwards because I'd dissociate through it. It was really important to me for him to remember that and always ask, because I genuinely just completely blank out during situations like that. He was fine asking for the first time and let me set the pace, but then stopped asking, and I blacked out during several encounters.

I felt really gross afterwards because I couldn't remember what happened, and I spoke to him about it, and he was apologetic.

He has BPD, so I've been there for a lot of his emotional breakdowns and talking him down from doing something harmful. It's been hard to voice things that upset me, because even in the above examples he'd start to talk about how he deserves to die and is unlovable even whilst I try to reassure him. It's hard to find the space to tell him when something he does upsets me, because then it turns into me having to talk him down from a spiral that I caused by expressing something he did that hurt me.

It's already pretty hard for me to confide in people, because I've had abusive parents and CSA trauma, as well as being autistic and experiencing a lot of bullying in adolescence. I withdrew from venting about my emotions, too, because if I spoke about feeling really depressed one day he'd start talking about how worthless he is for being unable to help me and then instead of having a safe place to talk about my feelings, I'd have to reassure *him* that he wasn't worthy of death for the way that I feel.

We met again for a convention in August, which was the most recent time we met. We had decided to cool it on the relationship aspect and try to return to being friends, because we have mutual friends we hang out with during these conventions and we *started* as best friends, and didn't want to lose each other. He had another few episodes whenever I'd talk to our mutual friend, which made things uncomfortable, but he acknowledged that it would be toxic to expect me to not talk to our friend.

We're planning on all hanging out again in December, but things are becoming kind of awkward. I don't know how to return to a regular friendship with him.

I hate myself for how I don't feel safe around him anymore after the stupid dissociative episodes, because I feel disgusted in myself that I did things I don't remember and I'm still upset with him that he deliberately went against things I asked for to feel comfortable, when he said he understood my triggers and was okay with how sensitive I was around these things.

He keeps telling me about the nightmares he has because he feels so guilty about hurting me, but I don't want to think about it anymore and just want to go back to being best friends. I don't know how I'm supposed to react when he goes off about his guilt, because I shouldn't have to apologise for getting upset when I gave him instructions on what to do to not trigger me. He said he did all he did because he cares so much about me, but that rings hollow when he didn't listen to what I told him was important to me.

How am I supposed to reassure him that he's worthy of love and that I still want to be his friend when I'm the focus of what he feels he did wrong? Am I even valid for being upset at these things? I know its not normal or the average dating experience to go into traumatic flashbacks and dissociative blanks whenever things get too stressful, and that it makes things way more difficult. He reassured me he was okay with all of that though and would be okay to handle it, because he does work as a psychotherapist specifically in trauma.

There are just moments when I really don't know what to do. I don't know how to stop feeling hurt and gross for the things that happened, and I don't know what to say when he starts to talk about how worthless he is and for how much guilt he feels. It feels like a trapped circle, and we have mutual friends so I can't cut him off, nor do I want to. I really do love him and don't want him to suffer, but I don't know how to go forward.

Mixed feelings about my breakup (happened 3months ago)

This my first post on reddit ever and after doomscrolling for a bit and not breaking no contact I decided to just, let it out here.

I (21M) got broken up with my ex (20F) roughly 3 months ago, ever since then I've decided to try and heal from her, I don't hate her or anything, I'm just sad and disappointed on how she broke up with me, granted I caused the argument and I take full responsibility for that, I tried to apologize to her and offer her an Uber to take her back to her friends hangout but she kept declining and continued the argument, but that's not what this post is about. I'm just confused, on one hand I'm angry, sad and disappointed on how she broke up with me (TLDR yelling yelling, she was trying to take her promise ring that i got her off, i tried stopping her, i got kicked in the chest) and I guess I have every right to since I did get kicked in the chest, on the other hand I still care about her, I still yearn for the version of her that was so kind, understanding and a good person.

I'm not claiming to the victim here, far from it, if I didn't start that argument over something stupid as her accidentally leaving her phone at home then this wouldn't have happened, but I'm just confused on how I feel, she doesn't occupy my mind as much anymore, but sometimes it feels like I'm back at that night, crying my eyes out in my room, on other days I feel great and not giving a damn.

Healing sucks and I kinda know im on the right path by doing my own thing and improving the quality of my life, I guess I just wanted somewhere to vent without being known.

Point is, I have mixed feelings on one hand I'd take her back if she does come back, on the other I don't want her back, we've broken up twice before this, it sucks, I hate it so much that she was my first gf and I had to get heartbroken to be better, that's on me. I do miss her and at the same time I don't want to hear anything she's been doing while I've been gone from her life.

She also took the pet cat I bought with her too so that sucks even more.

Finally doing better and here to help if you need someone to listen

Struggled with severe anxiety and depression through middle and high school. Always felt unworthy and inadequate. I don’t really know why it was so but I know I just felt alone all the time. The kindness of a few strangers and a couple of friends really helped me find my confidence again and I’m now finally in university and starting to build my life and feel a little better about myself and the world.

If you’re lost and lonely and just need someone to talk to, if you don’t like the girl you see in your mirror and are constantly feeling like she isn’t enough, and you want someone who will understand you but not judge, I’m all ears. Lmk and I’ll be there for you. I’m finally in a place where I can pay it forward and do some good in this world and I don’t want to lose that chance.

Turkish Genocide Denial Deeply Bothers Me

Sorry for the protracted history lesson, but it's generational trauma that's bothered me for much of my life now. My family traces their roots to Bulgaria and Armenia, both countries overrun by the majority-muslim ottoman empire. My ancestors were robbed, tortured, and genocided, and you still hear how many people today (especially in Turkey) continue to deny the atrocities that happened to my ancestors.

My Bulgarian ancestors spent 5 centuries under ottoman slavery, while ancestors to my Armenian side of the family... well read about what the Ottoman empire did to them in 1915, and what many modern Turkish people ignore and deny when they talk about how great the Ottoman empire was or how peaceful their religion is.

Two days ago, I broke down crying after hearing about a documentary film out of Turkey that essentially romanticized and glorified the Ottoman empire as some inclusive multicultural state. It was not. It was murderous and genocidal, and please don't pretend otherwise. Even more horrifying was that in Turkey there's also a museum literally dedicated to blaming Armenians for being exterminated under the bloodthirsty ottomans.

Socially awkward.

I am a 43 year old man. Full time job. Good looking to some ugly af to others. I have overshared which makes people come back years later and use what i shared with them against me.

I just ran a marathon and though a friend flew up to cheer me on and my girlfriend was there it seemed like no one gave a fuck. I say no one as in social media but overall i always say i have no friends or that i am a solo act. I learned through my 20’s and 30’s that most people i grew up with did not like me. They just hung out with me because thats what you did with the people you grew up with. I began something in my life called “the great extraction” meaning all the former friends that took advantage of me or that acted weird around me were removed from my life. I did alot of extracting. But as i maneuver through life after these extractions i experience awkwardness all around me. People feeling uncomfortable around me. Its alot sometimes and it constantly goes through my head like damn, am i the most hated person i know? I read if people are awkward around you that means they are jealous but its the wildest ways they are awkward. Like for example, this couple at church. We all knew each other as kids. On palm sunday a few years ago i asked the husband to make me a cross out of palm. Dude panicked. Like i’m busy, i can’t, i wont be able to. I’m like thats cool man. Chill out. Next thing i know everytime i saw him after that he avoided me like the plague. Because i asked him to make me a cross. Lol. When i tell these stories to myself i always ask myself ‘what am i missing?’ Because why are these people treating me like a criminal. Another story i have recently is some dude i have overshared with but never really spoke to. I knew him from church and we grew up moved different places and found each other on facebook. We spoke on the phone and when we spoke i was so depressed and i was throwing up from the mouth. Told him no one hangs out with me, i have no friends etc. this guy lives in florida and about 6 months after this phone call i planned with him that i’ll be visiting florida and i’ll contact him when i’m out there. When i got out there i contacted him and he made up an excuse that he was busy and could not meet up. I immediately knew he was lying because he was stuttering during his delivery and i know he works from home so he dud not have to do much but open his door and greet me. So i stopped contacting him. Fast forward to a few weeks ago, i texted him (along with a few others) on how to track me during the marathon. He never replied. When i completed the marathon he texted me “hope you finished” so anyone that knows me knows language is important to me so ‘hope’ seemed like you might not finish but i hope you do. So i responded with ‘i finished, dick.’ Its a playful response that could have been replied to in an equally similar way. His response 7am the next day? That i am narcissistic and never to contact him again. No wonder i have no friends and no one likes me and i have no relationships. That made me laugh initially because thats how i speak. He took my exact words from 2 years ago and used them against me. I brushed it off went on vacation and returned. I dont know why and i regret doing so but i texted him that he can’t even spell narcissistic. He replied to go fuck myself, to stop harassing him, and never to contact him again. I do feel everything he said was a direct response to what i confided in him 2 years ago. But theres more some people i work with avoid me at all costs, both my brothers have not spoken to me in years. Its a mind fuck. As far as myself i am funny, intelligent, can be an asshole at times but its all in fun. I am not mean in any way. I mean no harm. But life is tough. I have a girlfriend but she seems tired of me. I live at home with parents though i do own property. But what these interactions do is simply make me quiet. I dont engage and i just stay quiet. It sucks and everytime i feel i am beating this depression thing it comes back in these awkward interactions.

My dad recently left my family. My mom has been trying to get him to come back, likely due to a mixture of financial reasons, my sister being very young, and the fact that they’ve been together for almost 30 years. My parents have always had a tumultuous relationship, and growing up my mom was emotionally and sometimes physically abusive towards me. About a month ago he finally got fed up with my mom’s behavior and left. Yesterday I heard them arguing on the phone, and my mom said, “Do you remember cheating on me?” This was never something I had ever expected. I always thought of my parents as loyal to each other, despite their toxicity. They have four children together. I don’t know anything else, like the details, the timeline, anything. I’m assuming it happened a really long time ago, but it’s still flipped my world upside down. I don’t know what to do. I’m ashamed I didn’t leave sooner

I need to put this somewhere because I’ve been carrying it around for too long. I’m ashamed of how many chances I gave my ex — I’ll call him Sebastian — despite everything that happened.

We met in a mental hospital. After we were discharged, things went downhill quickly. He got kicked out by his adoptive mom. I got kicked out shortly after and lost my job. We both ended up staying with a mutual friend, and from there our situation kept getting more unstable. We went through periods of homelessness, constant moving, and nonstop stress.

Sebastian had severe mood swings. He would go from calm to yelling within seconds. He screamed at me in public, interrupted any attempt I made to talk, and blamed me for things I had no control over. Eventually, the verbal and emotional abuse turned physical — moments that left me genuinely scared of him and scared of what would happen next.

He manipulated me, played hot and cold, and made me question every decision I made. I spent most of the relationship walking on eggshells because I never knew when he would get angry again. When he got new friends, he ignored me completely, and I felt invisible in the same spaces we were supposed to share.

Through all of this — the instability, the yelling, the physical, verbal, and emotional abuse, the neglect, the manipulation — I stayed. I kept hoping he’d change, or that things would calm down. I kept giving him chances he didn’t earn.

I’m ashamed of how long it took me to leave, and of how much of myself I lost in the process. After 2 years, im finally being honest about what our relationship was…

Por que sinto que a vida não vale ser vivida.

Não sei de qual maneira poderia começar o post então vou introduzir um pouco de minha pessoa, me chamo Breno, tenho 20 anos, nascido e criado no RJ, sempre tive uma vida tranquila, nunca me faltou nada porém nunca tive nada em excesso, nunca dei muita importância pros meus estudos mas também nunca fui tão burro, quando cheguei no 1° ano do ensino médio notei que eu era um pouco diferente das pessoas que estudavam comigo entretanto nunca me parei pra pensar o motivo disso e nem como se sentiam em relação a isso.

Sempre fui uma pessoa boa, tive muitos amigos e falava com todos, só que em diversos momentos do dia eu sentia uma melancolia tão forte, um sentimento de não pertencer a nada e só queria deixar de existir, e esses pensamentos foram corroendo minha mente, diversas vezes estava conversando feliz com meus amigos e do nada eu fechava a cara e ficava no meu canto infeliz com tudo.

O tempo passou e fui aprendendo a "controlar" mais esses episódios, mas não é porque eu aprendi a controlar que eles deixaram de existir, quando completei 18 anos me alistei no exército e servi no ano de 2024, foi o maior tapa da realidade que eu tomei na minha vida até então, era um sonho, servir e proteger, sempre tive esse sentimento de querer ajudar, ser útil, pertencer alguma coisa, porém como sabemos o nosso exército não é flor que se cheire, e passei por um dos piores momentos da minha vida, onde eu vivia exclusivamente pro exército, não tinha um dia de serviço que eu não pensava em pegar a minha arma e acabar com isso ali mesmo, mesmo pensando nisso sem parar eu nunca criei coragem e sinto que até hoje não teria pra fazer tal coisa.

O tempo foi passando um pouco mais e consegui marcar um psicólogo pelo quartel de forma gratuita, infelizmente acabou não dando em nada pois eu acabei saindo do exército e eles não iriam cobrir mais as minhas consultas.

Fiquei um tempo só existindo em casa, afinal ainda iria continuar recebendo um salário então dava pra ficar tranquilo por um tempo, tava com um shape bacana, dinheiro e mesmo assim esse sentimento nunca me abandonou por 1 dia sequer.

Alguns meses depois de sair do exército tive o primeiro baque da minha vida, descobri que tinha tuberculose, sempre fui muito saudável, fazia bastante exercício físico, gostava de estar sempre em movimento, logo no mesmo dia que descobri a doença tive que ficar em isolamento e foram os piores dias da minha vida, tossia sangue sem parar e achei que a minha vida iria acabar ali mesmo.

Nesse instante eu fiquei com medo de saber que poderia acabar ali e eu não teria o controle disso, saber que poderia morrer sem realizar nada, afinal a gente nunca está pronto pra morte, me sentia em uma batalha constante do meu corpo contra a doença, foi uma semana infernal tossindo sangue sem parar e achando que poderia morrer a qualquer momento, sou uma pessoa de altura mediana, possuo 1,80m e a minha média de peso é algo entre 73kg - 76kg, cheguei a perder 16kg em algumas semanas, batendo 60kg e ficando extremamente magro, após esse episodio eu passei a dar um pouco mais valor a vida.

O tempo passou e cá estamos, 2 meses de tratamento e sinto que o sentimento de não querer existir me persegue, mesmo passando por tal situação a vontade de querer estar vivo durou no máximo 1 semana e agora eu me pego pensando por que eu me sinto assim, por que eu simplesmente não posso ser feliz por estar vivo ? eu não vejo um futuro pra mim, não me imagino velho e todo dia me vejo pegando uma faca e simplesmente enfiando na minha barriga, sei que não me mataria, apenas penso nisso.

Além disso tudo acabei enfrentando a dura realidade que eu tenho EP, não das piores mas que com certeza afeta muito minha auto estima, afinal o homem que não confia nas suas próprias capacidades não tem muito o que oferecer para outras mulheres, sempre fui um cara muito desenrolado e nunca gostei de pegar muitas mulheres, justamente por isso demorei pra descobrir que enfrentava esse problema, atualmente estou gostando muito de uma garota e isso me afeta bastante.

Apenas um simples desabafo, queria saber se alguma pessoa compartilha de alguma experiência parecida e o que fazem pra evitar esse tipo de coisa.

I also can't remember my duties, forgetting where I put things, placing the ice in the drawer and the fork to the freezer etc. I do these by instinct and the moment I do it, I snap out of it and can't believe myself for being this stupid. Same thing with intelligence.

I feel like I don't belong in this form of mine, it's a "residue" of me. I don't know if I'll ever be "myself" again, or even close to it, or how.

If you've gone through similar things and actually got better, I would really appreciate some advice.

  
TL;DR: My mind is slow and blank and I don't know what to do because it was a big part of me and I'm afraid it's gone forever.

Anxiety/Panic Is Back

TL/DR: I’m tired. And anxiety is a real bitch. 

I am a woman in my 50s with a great job, great family and a great group of friends. I have so many people who love me and think I’m amazing. And yet—I feel like I’m faking it. Nobody knows how much I am struggling and I don’t feel like I can tell anyone because I don’t want people in my world to worry. So many people depend on me and I can’t be falling apart. 

I have lived with anxiety my whole life and have had major bouts of depression too. I’ve never actually attempted suicide but I’ve come close. For about the past 12 or so years I’ve been doing really well. Found meds that work and I’ve been living authentically and have let go of past fears.  But recently, it’s just all come rushing back and I feel like I’m drowning. I had a major panic attack last week (first one in years) and it was so bad I took myself to the hospital. I couldn’t function. I was crippled by it. And for the first time in years I felt like I just didn’t want to be here. I got through it as one does but that feeling of…I don’t know…blech? It’s just been simmering below the surface. And once again I’m currently panicking and just wanting this to be over. I’m fighting it and I won’t harm myself but damn it’s so exhausting. 

There’s no real point to this post other than to get it off my chest to some internet strangers.

Better question is to ask what do women bring?

What anxiety(s) do you have?

What anxiety(s) do you have? 

What are the worst parts of each? 

Which is the worst for you if you have more than one?

TRIGGER WARNING: Mentions of family death, and car crashes.

For me, I have generalized anxiety, social anxiety, and adult separation anxiety. 

I excessively worry about things in day to day life, examples being a car crash, someone im close to passing, etc. Honestly though my generalized anxiety is not that bad and really doesnt hinder my day to day life unless it is triggered by my other anxietys.

Social anxiety is my first anxiety I noticed. I hate talking on the phone with a passion, I have almost never answered the phone to anyone that isnt immediately family, i also rarely even make calls unless I have no choice. I am also scared about using a card at a store, because im bad at it and its humiliating. (Ive been given small things for free because of this, and I cried after) I barely had friends in school, and family gatherings are very hard for me. I also skipped school a lot because of it and skipped classes I would have to present something. BUT, ive learned to pretend it doesnt exist, if I dont think and just do immediately when my fear kicks in it gets worse. 

My adult separation anxiety is the worst. It triggers the worst of my generalized anxiety. I have an irrational fear of my sisters, but especially my twin sister dying when I am not around. I have never been able to hold a job for more than a day that wasnt from home. While at work I start thinking about the precious time im wasting being away from her, and thinking what will I do if she passes away and im not there. These thoughts spiral into “if I dont stay at work im failing my siblings, my family who knows about this jobs, etc.” I degrade myself thinking im a failure and capable of nothing but taking up space and my siblings money. I always have mental breakdowns after I attempt a job, my longest lasted 8 hours straight of sobbing and going back in forth “be strong, you can do this -> no you cant, you cant get a job,” and repeat. 

Anyways, what about you? (:

I made a printable zine for when everything feels too loud

Hey everyone,

I've struggled with anxiety for years, and one thing I noticed is that most "coping strategies" feel like they require too much energy when I'm actually anxious. Like, I can't do a 20-minute meditation when I'm spiraling.

So I created something gentler-a printable zine with tiny practices that take less than 2 minutes. Things like:

* Notice one grounding sound around you
* Name one thing you started today (to acknowledge effort)
* Drink water as a small act of self-kindness

No pressure, no "fixing yourself," just soft pauses.

It's called Find Sanctuary, and I'm sharing it as a $5 download because I know how expensive mental health resources can be.

Happy to share the link if anyone wants it - don't want to break self-promotion rules!

I hope this helps someone the way these practices helped me. 💜
