The necessary delayed

Before I start, I wanted to say that this was my first time posting on Reddit and I don't really know how to rightfully do it.
Also this was translated to english bc I posted it on my first language. So if there's any errors, try to ignore them, thank you.



Why do I feel compelled to write today? It's not uncommon for me to feel these feelings sometimes, but it never reaches the point of writing.

Why was today different? But mainly, because each word is coming out with a tone more and more distant from the others.

I don't know how to feel anymore. Calling myself a "psychologist" didn't do me any good... I thought about it and realized that my feeling of being a psychologist wasn't just about helping others, but about distancing myself from what I myself thought about myself.

The "me" that was always there for others, but the same "me" that always felt, felt that its problems were inferior to those of others.

"He suffers so much, my problems are just routine things"—this thought affects me today, not because I can't talk about my problems, but because I can't understand what I feel. My feelings are a path where I can't identify the path or who is walking it.

Where is this path leading me? What is it turning me into?  I no longer have the desire to leave the house, to meet new people. With those I know, I lose, day by day, the feeling of wanting them around.

I look around and feel that my efforts to stay with others have been meaningless. Why do I want these people by my side if I no longer identify with them?

Some people always come and go from my life without paying the due toll or finishing the journey and finally leaving. But they don't do that, and they continue this race without a finish line to see who can mold me best the way they want. "He'll do this, and if he doesn't, I'll brush and sculpt little by little until I do," that's what they must think, that I'm a handful of clay they can do whatever they want with.

But even the strongest clay needs care, needs water to facilitate molding, and they don't even bother with that. They form all their thoughts with my mind with the delicacy with which one tends to something broken.

 I can't even remember the last time I cried. Did I 'force it?', I don't know if that's the right term, but that's what I felt at my great-mother's funeral. I teared up, but it wasn't my own feelings, it was the feelings of others that made me that way.

"How could one of her favorite great-grandchildren not shed a single tear at her funeral?", something like that is what I thought.

Today I can no longer put into words what I feel, maybe some other time I'll talk more about it.
Until another day.

I’ve been depressed since I was 15… and it’s getting harder to handle

I don’t even know how to put this into words anymore, but I need to let it out somewhere. I’ve felt depressed since I was around 15, like this heavy shadow that never really left me. For years I’ve been trying to manage it, ignore it, outrun it… but lately it feels like it finally caught up with me. These days everything feels heavier, darker, and harder to carry. I wake up already exhausted. I go through the motions of my life, but it doesn’t feel like I’m actually *living* anything. I'm tired of living

I don't have a reason to live. I keep doing whatever I want, but I can't enjoy anything. I've touched grass, tried to get help, gone to therapy, been working, hit the gym, and engaged in a couple of hobbies, but everything feels like a chore. I don't enjoy any of these things, and none of them have helped me enjoy life in the slightest. It's like I'm required to do all of these things to survive. I believe we all have been conditioned to let our survival instincts consume us. It's honestly pathetic.

I'm tired of having to wake up for work. Tired of having to work for a paycheck. Tired of doing the work that other people are responsible for. Tired of seeing people walking in my workplace trying to buy things. Tired of working out in the gym because it's a modern trend these days. Tired of engaging in hobbies out of escapism and indulgence. Tired of buying food for myself like a wild animal. Tired of seeing people in real life and online talking about recent events and the same political bullshit every day. Tired of posting stuff online. Tired of having to take care of my personal hygiene. Tired of people pretending to be nice. Tired of having to act kindly in front of others for the sake of it. Tired of people acting rudely and inconsiderately. Tired of having to be rude to others because they're stupid/being disrespectful.

My whole life has been spent living for the sake of it. Living for survival. Living without will. I believe I was destined to live like a parasite who can't stand up for themselves. Emotional support isn't enough for me. Tough love isn't enough for me. Being yelled at/scolded isn't enough for me. Grabbing my hand isn't enough for me. Professional advice isn't enough for me. Modern advice like "touch grass" or "get a life" isn't enough for me. Being pitied isn't enough for me. Getting out of bed and going for a walk isn't enough for me. Pretending to enjoy things isn't enough for me. Nothing is enough for me.

I'm just an average NPC nobody will remember once they're dead. I wished my family had never had me to begin with. They should've reconsidered before having me, but it's too late now. I'm here, and I'm stuck in a rut. I'd rather be dead than alive, but I don't have the willpower to end my life.

I accidentally stole someone's cat

Recently a young kitten (we estimated her to be about 6-8mo at the time) followed my boyfriend home while he was doing chores outside. She looked malnourished and was covered in flea dirt, but was very trusting. We had seen her outside in our community before, and my boyfriend had a conversation with a neighbor about them taking the cat in before she ultimately chose to follow bf. She had protruding nipples, but no noticeable belly, and at the time I remember saying "she's probably not pregnant, but if she is, the vet can do a spay/abort." The next morning, we had an additional kitten locked in the bathroom. 

Before her vet appointment, she gave birth again, but only the first had any shot at viability. She got x-rays to ensure everything had passed successfully, and had her physical injuries looked at. She'll likely have to have surgery on one of her legs when she goes back for her spay, and she was treated for the fleas and tapeworms. 

The newborn was very likely premature, and weighed 40g at birth, gaining only about 20g in the entire first week. We were in contact with multiple vets throughout, but unfortunately they can only do so much for a kitten that small. We had to monitor around the clock, and hope for the best.

One of the first things the vet did was check for a chip. She was so trusting that it was obvious she was very comfortable around people, but we had grown attached and were hopeful beyond logic that she didn't have an owner. Naturally, she did in fact have a registered chip, and the vets contacted the owner immediately. They went over the costs of care over the phone in another room while my boyfriend and I frantically attempted to discuss what claim to the cat we could argue. Our worries were unnecessary, as the owner could not afford the cost of care and willingly surrendered her to us. The vet exchanged our contact info to transfer the cat's records and registration. 

The owner called us within a couple days, and readily gave us everything. This person was someone who I had shaped in my mind to be some sort of villain, deserving of all my harsh judgments about the condition of the cat, but in reality, they were an older person on a fixed income who truly could not afford the bill. They told us about how the cat had been bottle fed as a kitten, and how they had been looking for her since she got lost. She used to live so close to us. 

I'm a huge cat lover, and have been passionate about advocating for them for most of my adult life. I've used the debate over outdoor cats in interview questions. I used to think in absolutes when it came to standards of care. That isn't to say my standards have changed, but it's far easier to tell someone in a social media comment that they deserve to lose their pet than it is to actually take someone's pet in real life. I do feel that it was wrong for the cat to have gone unspayed and able to go outdoors, but it wasn't as if the cat were abandoned. The owner didn't have any idea about the pregnancy, and I don't know how long she was missing. She was anemic from the fleas, but we saw evidence of an attempt to treat the fleas on her when we took her in. I had picked out a name before her first vet trip, and she already had one. While we put off reaching out to the owner, afraid of having a stressful conversation, the owner called us first. The people who took a beloved pet didn't even have the decency to call. 

I keep thinking about how I would feel if the roles were reversed. My heartbreak would be immeasurable if I lost a pet under those circumstances. I got so caught up in my selfish excitement that I forgot the reality of the situation, and who else could be affected. While the previous owner did things for the cat that contributed to her needing our help, those choices were still from a place of love. Logically, I know that the newborn probably wouldn't have made it if we hadn't taken them in, and the previous owner had an enormous ask thrust on them when the missing cat became two cats and a four digit vet bill overnight. I think I'll always feel a pang of guilt whenever I look at the cat now. There's no undoing the past choices, and her and the baby are part of my family now. I guess all I can do is continue to ensure I provide them with the best I can

Time to see doctor after years of anxiety? My experience

Hey ya'll. I've been dealing with anxiety for years. Feel like I should go see a pcp about it and get meds. But I've been thinking, what if it's just life, nerves, stress? I'm an introvert. It has costed me a lot of opportunities. It comes in social and performative situations.

These experiences are within the past 7 years. During my driving test, racing heartbeat, shaky hands and heavy chest. I was panicking? Still past it. Happens during school presentations, but I push/sped through. Approached my crush, and I was a stuttering mess, couldn't even look her in the eyes. Stammering during job interviews, I got the job once but didn't show up. Skipping interviews. My recent job I pushed through and worked fine, but every interaction with a customer about stuff I don't know, I get anxious and want to go to the break room. Avoid talking with managers. I get nervous and overthink about what I say after a convo, either with family or people. Not all the time. Leads me to just keep to myself, not talk much. Don't have any friends. Saw a specialist once for something, he said my heartbeat was like a lion was present. I called the next day and didn't show up. Was shaken. 

Fast forward to now, I've gotten better but still... It's been 2-3 years since I was in college (stopped) or did the driving test. I drive fine now. Last week I was too slow to merge, saw cop beeped at me, shook her head. Afterward, pretty shaken, I did breathing and grounding techniques. Quit my job last week, because of early mornings leading me to feeling drained, stress and micromanagement. I was anxious about making the decision leading up to and even the last day. Didn't tell my manager in person. I'd send an email rather than call. Id rather do stocking than cashier. A small part of me wants to give customer facing jobs a try, but I can't bring myself to. Even after doing public speaking before.

Since quitting, I've had the best days I've had this year. Using the time now to work on my social skills and anxiety. Just been winging it through the years. I always looked for advice on reddit and on youtube. But now it's clicking. Learned about negative thought patterns and epigenetics. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r6yg6ywplfc&t=955s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r6yg6ywplfc&t=955s) Saw a Jesse Eisenberg anxiety video on Big Think. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h-MHHlZqVaI&t=5s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h-MHHlZqVaI&t=5s) I recently went to get flu shot, went well. Sister needed otc meds, so I spoke up at the cvs. Went out for Halloween, hesitant at first. Got compliments. So many other scenarios that show ive grown over the years. I feel like im more capable now than ever before, but still some situations I'd still want to avoid and am hesitant about. I take omega 3 and magnesium glycinate. L-Theanine worth trying? 

Outside of situations, I think it's the pressure of life, from parents, not knowing what I want to do. Don't know what to major. Was raised in strict household, physical discipline. Always feared growing up and having responsibilities. Comparing myself to others. It feels rewarding overcoming hard situations, but I just forget the positive experiences and the good days when I'm feeling down. I hope this isn't too long or hard to follow. Thanks for reading.

Tldr; Dealt with anxiety for years. Better now, but still think I need help. Worth it to see doctor to get medicated? Hesitant about it.

I've been questioning myself lately

This story starts years ago back in about 2022. March 13th 2022 was the night the girl of my dreams messaged me on Xbox (I know not the best communication area).  Anyways, this was the night where she confessed she had feelings for me and I remember exactly how I reacted because I near fell off of my fouton in excitement. We talked for a while until her wifi downtime kicked her offline. The following morning I got a final text from her saying "sorry my parents said I'm too young to talk to boys" at this point we were 13-14. I was kind of upset as one would be. We stayed loyal to each other for about a year and a half because complications happened and we were both informed the other had moved on and there were some terrible rumors started about me. Later on down the line we started talking again and we both could tell we both still had very strong feelings for each other but we never adressed that. We started a MC world and we had so much fun together, we had an amazing house that we both worked on and lived together in and communicated through signs because we couldn't call unless her siblings and/or friends were in the party. Through the sign communication we told each other we loved each other for the first time. This amazing time period lasted about three to four months until she had to block me again. I was heart broken absolutely shattered but time kind of healed the wound but I still continued to look at her and dream of the life that could have been. I got close with her parents so we were aloud to talk at church with someone else present (I'm not religious but I went because me trying to believe in what she did meant a lot to her). This was really good minus me killing my relationship with people around me like my mom who didn't agree with what I was doing. Now I will admit this next part her and I are definately in the wrong but after she got pulled out of the gym we both train at we secretly met at a public park for mini dates to continue to see each other because we love each other so much.  This went through most of the summer and fall of this year and I loved it. That was until October 12th at around 9:30pm where I got a text from her father asking if I was around because she wanted to call me. I was already scared and then I answered the call. She was sitting in a chair in the center of my phone screen. She was in tears, she told me her parents were in the room and this would be the final time I would be able to talk to her for a very long time ( a year and a half if we get lucky). I had my camera off because I have never cried in front of her and I didn't want to start cause she would know that something really got to me. That was until her mom said from the back "I let you call him so you could see him one last time but his camera is off so there is no point." I said I would turn on my light and turn on my camera and I did and my girl started talking struggling to hold back tears and I couldn't get a single thought out. I kept trying but all that I could get out was "I'm sorry" over and over. It kept going on like this for a good bit until her mom said something that has been sticking with me since that night. She says and I quote word for word, " She is here in tears right now and you aren't doing anything to comfort her or attempt to help the situation and that isn't okay." To which I reply "I'm sorry I cant get anything else out without crying and I'm trying not to cry in front of you guys but especially your daughter." Her mom then proceeds to say to me A 17 YEAR OLD KID "That's too bad, you're a man. When things get tough you pull up your big boy pants and tough it out." That isn't what bothered me because my dad used to say stuff like that which is why I don't typically cry so I reply with "ma'am I mean this with all the respect possible. What do you think I am trying to do? I'm sitting here struggling not to cry and break down in front of all of you." Her mom says this in reply "You are a very selfish and shallow person who never cared about or loved my daughter, you aren't good enough for her and you don't deserve her." She then walked out before I could say anything. The call kept going till about 11pm where her dad finally hung up the call, her and I got one final "I love you" out before the call ended. I texted her mom after the call saying " I understand that you're angry and you have every right to be; you can believe what you want and call me selfish and shallow all you want but your daughter and I both know that isn't the case., and it's also a bit of a reach. I quite literally killed the relationships with people around me and my own mother looked at me like I was an idiot for going to church. I did that just for it to get turned around and be thrown in my face while calling me selfish? That's actually insane. From the bottom of my heart I do love and care for your daughter. You say that if I truly cared about her I would've cut contact with her but that is so far from the truth. You either did not see it or chose not to see it but there were multiple times where we were going to but it made her so sad and I couldn't stand to see her like that. At the end of the day it doesn't matter what I say because you and your husband have a bitter taste in your mouth when it comes to even hearing my name. Despite that I still love your daughter and all that matters to me is that she is okay and happy, that's why I wasn't speaking a lot last night because I didn't want her to worry." That is a shortened version of the text but she didn't reply until the next morning WHILE I WAS IN SCHOOL she couldn't give me the courtesy of replying to me and getting a reply back. She replied calling me a bunch of things like selfish, shallow, and undeserving of her daughters love. That is what has stuck with me and made me think if maybe she is right. Am I all those things? She said I never cared about her daughter but I know that isn't true I love her daughter so much and can't imagine a life without her. Her and I no longer have ANY contact and there is a chance her parents are making her move to another country. sorry for the long vent, thank you for listening. 

\- A very troubled and sad person. <3

Dear You

Dear You,

What do you think that does to someone?
Monsters aren’t born they’re created.

I wasn’t hateful when we met. But you were already like this. I thought I was helping you. I thought I was saving the dark parts of you that had already given up. But instead, you turned me into something unrecognizable. I could destroy all of humanity with the darkness I’ve harbored from your presence in my life.

And that is why I isolate.

You reinstalled everything I worked so hard to get rid of in therapy. It took years for me to finally look in the mirror and smile. It took you months to take it away to play with everything beautiful in me like it was something disposable and then you spat in my face. And you just did it again.

I remember when you said, “If it’s so bad, why do you keep coming back?”
And I told you because I didn’t want to give up on you.
Me coming back wasn’t proof that you were good for me; it was proof that I still believed you could be better. That maybe you’d show up the way I knew you were capable of. I thought you really wanted to change.
And how could I get mad if I never gave you the chance?
But you just looked at me and said, “You’re starting to really piss me off now.”

That was the moment I realized love had turned into punishment.

You watched me hurting emotionally, mentally, physically and you’d just sit down, block me, turn off your phone, and continue your day.
While pieces of the woman you claimed to love were dying inside, you blamed me for it.

So damn right I started changing.
A dog can only get kicked so many times before it realizes the owner doesn’t care before it learns that “love” can come with pain.
And on your bad days, which became every day, you’d beat me down again.
You watched me shed tears and you laughed in my face.

Oh, want to know something else?
I would rather you punched me in the face like you did her than have you trample all over my character and heart with the emotional abuse you inflicted on me. You destroyed me.
I could never in a million years kill someone the way you managed to kill me in that first year.
I hate myself because of you. I second guess myself because of you. I change my mind because of you. I cut my hair off because of you. I scrub my dirty house because you made me feel disgusting. I hate everything about me because of you.
I am suicidal because of you.
Because of you, every day is a battle of whether or not I’m worthy of breathing.
Because of you, the person I was growing into will never be gifted to the world.
Because of you, my kids will never have the mother God made me to flourish into you destroyed her.
Because of you, I’m another nobody.
Because of you, I will never trust another man the way I blindly trusted you.
Because of you, I will never have a half-decent life.
Once you came into my life and burned me to the ground, then left me for dead, I will never be able to go back to the same happy, loving woman I was becoming.
You not only did the world a great injustice by hurting someone who could have made a difference, but you added me to the list of people you carelessly, violently destroyed.

And yet… despite it all, I don’t think you’re truly evil, because evil people don’t exist. I still believe, until your last dying breath, that there’s hope for change. I believe you can still change. I believe in you. I always have. I always will.

But until you put in real effort to love better than I’ve seen, I have to love myself enough to say: enough is enough. I’ve suffered trying to save people who ultimately never wanted to be saved, and I squandered enough of my life playing Superman when I needed to be my own hero. And that’s what I’m doing.
I’m not giving up on you; however, I am putting you down so I can pick me up.

Because you’re not reading this, are you?
Because you don’t want to know my true feelings.
You never did.

And that’s where the problem began ironically, it’s also where it ends.

— Me

Struggling with Vastu superstitions about study direction / seeking advice and mental clarity

Hi everyone,

I’m writing here because I’ve been really struggling with a superstition related to Vastu and studying. I work from home, and for the past year, I’ve been unable to study properly because I keep worrying about which direction I’m facing.

Whenever I try to sit and study, my mind starts telling me things like “this is the right direction” or “this is the wrong direction.” I’ve read that facing certain directions (like south) is inauspicious, and that thought got stuck in my mind. Now, even when I try to focus, my subconscious keeps associating directions with good or bad luck.

The strange part is that I actually feel most comfortable and pleasant facing south — that’s where my window is, and I get good light and air. But because of what I read and what my family and surroundings believe, I feel anxious and guilty sitting that way.

I know this might sound irrational, but it’s affecting my ability to study and concentrate. I can’t change my living space for at least another year, so I want to find a way to deal with this mentally and emotionally.

Are these Vastu directions really something to worry about, or is this more of a psychological thing I need to work through? Has anyone else dealt with similar beliefs affecting their focus or peace of mind?

Any advice or guidance would mean a lot. Thank you for reading. 🙏

not excited for my birthday for the first time in years

this might not make too much sense because i'm sad and rambling and english isn't my first language. sorry in advance.

in a week and a month (aka december 27th), i will be turning 17. every year, i have always been super annoying about my birthday: i would randomly say how many days were left, i would start planning a special date to celebrate with my friends (where i live, december is the start of summer so most of the people i love aren't on the city around the end of the month) and i would make gift lists for everyone who asked for one, always making sure to not put anything that was expensive, especially according to each person's background. i know this sounds annoying, but i always made sure the people around me didn't find it annoying, i never asked for gifts (again, the gift lists were only because no one ever knows what to give me for my birthday and were only for people who wanted to gift me something), and in "exchange", i have always cared for my friends' special dates: i always plan their birthday parties, i have their gifts ready months before the date itself, and if i can get a special cute message from a youtuber or influencer or local artist they like, i definitely do that too! hell, the anchors from the news channel wished my best friend a happy birthday thanks to me. 
now, i had a very shitty year. like, "it got so bad i got diagnosed with two different disorders in just a year" shitty, and it has never been a secret to my friends. and, while they would ask how was i doing every once in a while... i don't know, they never did anything to distract me from my constant sadness. never asked to hang out, never would even send me some silly youtube video that would make me laugh, meanwhile i did all of that for them through hard times. and that just reminds me of my birthday, and how little effort anyone ever puts on me when i do so much on everyone else's special days... i never asked for anything back, but after such a sad year, the last thing i need is the solid proof of no one caring about my birthday as much as i do. so, not only i won't do anything at all (probably will be forced to have dinner with my family which sucks because my father sucks and lately my mom is always mad at me), but also i'm dreading that i will have to pretend to be grateful when my family gives me birthday presents that i don't like and that they would've known i don't like if they've made some effort... but my ex best friends were the same, tho, so if i still hanged out with them the sqme would've happened (as a kid i hated being gifted clothes, and on the same year i gifted them the entire harry potter saga, they gave me a shirt that didn't fit me because i was fat and they were skinny #lol. also they were twins that's why i'm talking about *them*). 
so yeah, can't wait to hide my crying all day long. fun fact: all my life i have always wanted a surprise party. last year, my mom, dad and best friend, who all hate surprise parties, got surprise parties (not planned by me because, again, THEY HATE SURPRISE PARTIES), and i kept making jokes about how silly it was that they got surprise parties when they hated them and how i have always wanted one... and of course, i didn't get even a standard party.
sorry, this is so cringe and makes me sound so childish and entitled and ungrateful. i might delete, i was just feeling sad.

A big factor is generation size.

It went:

>Boomers: big generation
>Generation X: smaller generation
>Millennials: big generation (not as big as Boomers but still big)
>Zoomers: small generation

Guys face competition from guys older than they are for the limited supply of cute girls. That means that if the generation just before yours is larger than your generation, you're screwed.

Millennials had less competition from Gen X guys just because there were relatively fewer of them to worry about, because of the disparity in generation size.

Zoomers are screwed for multiple reasons, and the generation size math is ALSO working against them.

I (M, 18) think I'm falling in love for the first time and I'm totally overwhelmed (warning: long)

**Throwaway account because I want to keep personal stuff like this separate from my main account.**

I know this post is WAY too long, but I really want to give you a full picture of everything — and honestly, I just need to get it off my chest.

I’m 18 years old and in my final years of high school in Germany. I was the class outsider throughout all of middle school and got bullied quite a lot — sometimes even had trash thrown at me. Because of that, I shut myself off from everyone and now have huge issues trusting others, and especially trusting myself.

But now in upper school, after losing a lot of weight last year (from 120 down to 90 kg at 1.80 m), I’ve opened up a little more toward my classmates. Still, I feel unattractive — my skin hangs loosely on my arms, thighs, and especially my stomach; I have thick eyebrows, a big head with a large forehead, wear glasses, and usually keep a short beard. I actually like my beard and am proud of my facial hair growth, but I’m also insecure about it since it’s unusual to have a full beard that young.

At school, I sit in a row with a group of four girls who are friends. They’re kind of “middle tier” socially. Over time, I’ve sort of joined their conversations during class and breaks, but I mostly just listen — I rarely talk much or do small talk. I wouldn’t say I’m part of their group or their friend.

There’s one girl (also 18) I get along with a bit better than the others. Until recently, I thought it was purely platonic — or at least, I thought so. She’s of average build, has long slightly wavy brown hair, beautiful bright green eyes, and a very wide, natural, contagious smile. She’s almost always cheerful, full of energy, and a little bit crazy in a fun way (like randomly meowing in the middle of a conversation or during class work, hugging her friends out of nowhere, or blurting out wild theories just for fun). She’s basically the complete opposite of me — but somehow I find that incredibly endearing and lovable. There’s something about her that just fascinates me. Let’s call her *V*.

We’ve done a few group projects together — one of them was acting out a scene from a book in English between a couple. I had prepared really well for it, both because I wanted a good grade and because I didn’t want to drag *V* down with me if I messed up. But when we had to perform, I totally blanked out and ruined the scene. I was so embarrassed and apologized to *V* several times. She was a bit disappointed about the average grade we got but said she didn’t blame me.

The main story I want to talk about happened a few days ago during a school trip. We went by train to the nearest big city, and I was in a group with *V* and her three friends. The trip’s main goal was to visit the zoo, but our teacher also let us walk around the city afterwards. It was raining that day, and I was the only one who’d brought an umbrella. When we were walking through the city, it started raining harder, so I opened it up. After a bit, *V* came under my umbrella and linked her arm with mine. She asked if that was okay — I was so caught off guard that I stammered a bit but said it was fine.

We kept walking together as a group of five. *V* talked with her friends but also quite a bit with me, staying linked to my arm the whole time. I mostly listened, occasionally commenting or asking questions.

At one point, we passed a jewelry store, and she showed me some earrings, asking which ones I thought suited her best. I was flustered again, not really knowing what to say, but I told her the ones with the green stones fit her best because they matched her eyes. I surprised myself saying something like that — I *never* say things that “charming.” She smiled at me and ended up buying those earrings.

Later, in a clothing store, she asked if I wanted to come in and look at clothes with her, but I declined — fashion isn’t really my thing, and I didn’t want the others to think I was weird. We kept walking around town with her still holding my arm. One of the other girls, who’s always super interested in any potential relationships, eventually noticed and grinned at us mischievously. I’m not sure if *V* saw it, but I think she did because she briefly unlinked arms to talk with that friend.

I immediately panicked, afraid the other girl would start gossiping like, “Eww, *V* is flirting with that gross guy.” But *V* soon came back and linked arms with me again. The friend didn’t say anything else, though she kept giving us little looks.

When we stopped for food at a snack stand, *V* didn’t want to order anything because she said she was “on a diet.” What I did next completely surprised me — I told her, “I like you the way you are.” The moment the words left my mouth, all four girls looked at me — *V* and her friends — clearly surprised. I instantly realized what I’d just said, turned bright red, and looked away in embarrassment. The flirty friend gave us that same cheeky grin again, and the other two just seemed surprised but didn’t say anything.

*V* looked at me like a deer in headlights for a few seconds, then smiled. But not her usual big smile — it was… different. Hard to describe, but it somehow made all my nervousness disappear. She kept talking to me after that, twirling her hair while chatting.

When I was eating fries, she asked if she could steal one. I said sure — and she ended up eating half of them. I didn’t mind; I was just happy she seemed relaxed and not so self-conscious about her body (which she absolutely shouldn’t be — she looks amazing as she is, and I meant that completely). I couldn’t help but smile at her, even though I rarely ever smile. I didn’t say anything about her “stealing” my fries because I honestly didn’t know what to say that wouldn’t sound awkward, creepy, or overly flirty. I’m just not used to these kinds of interactions, and it all felt so new and overwhelming.

Later we went into a music store, and she asked about my music taste, showing me some of her favorites. I don’t really have a specific genre I stick to — I just like songs that *make me feel something*, whether it’s metal, rock, jazz, classical, EDM, or even folk. Just not rap. I rambled nonsense trying not to seem like the weird guy with no taste, but she didn’t seem to mind and just smiled again.

On the train ride back home, *V* and I sat next to each other, still talking (well, mostly she talked and I listened). I’ve never been so open, positive, or happy around a girl before. Our shoulders and legs brushed against each other a few times — not on purpose, it just happened — and our hands were really close. I even thought about touching her hand but didn’t dare. Her pinky brushed mine a few times, and every touch made my heart race and my chest tighten. That’s when I realized something inside me had changed.

I’ve never been in love before, so I don’t really know what these feelings are — affection, love, infatuation, friendship? I honestly can’t tell because I don’t know what love is supposed to feel like. But if I go with my gut… I think I might be falling for her.

When we arrived back at our hometown, our group slowly split up. *V* and I said goodbye, both mentioning how fun the day had been and that it turned out way better than expected. Then we just stood there for a few seconds, silently looking at each other. I didn’t know what to do — I didn’t want the day to end like that, but I also didn’t want her to think I was some creepy guy trying to hit on her. I thought about offering to walk her home, but I chickened out. I just said a normal goodbye, and we both went our separate ways. I turned around once and saw she had done the same — she waved at me, I awkwardly waved back, and then quickly looked away and went home.

Since then, we’ve talked a little more at school, but I’m torn. Part of me wants to spend more time with her and get to know her better. The other part of me is terrified she’ll become a target for others because she’s hanging out with the “weird freak” of the class. I’m also scared she might secretly find me gross or creepy. I honestly feel like I don’t deserve to get close to someone as sweet, funny, and beautiful as her. She deserves someone more interesting, confident, and attractive — not me. I’m just the quiet creep who should stay in the background and not bother normal people. And people say quiet guys have “depth,” but I’m not even sure I do… I don’t even know what “depth” really means.

This was the very first time in my life that I’ve had a genuinely positive interaction with a girl — one where I didn’t immediately assume she was mocking me behind my back. I still can’t fully shake that fear, especially since something like that actually happened years ago: on a school trip in middle school, one of the most popular girls suddenly asked if I wanted to be her boyfriend. I said yes, but she and her friends then laughed at me and said, “Eww, as if anyone would ever date a disgusting fat loser like you!” She was also one of the people who later threw trash at me. That whole thing hurt me deeply and made me withdraw even more — I even moved my desk to the farthest corner of the classroom to sit alone.

But with *V*, I actually had fun. I felt close to someone — to a girl — in a way I never have before. I’ve never had a relationship, never held hands, never kissed anyone, never experienced real affection.

So… what do you think? What are these feelings I have for her? Am I just convincing myself that I’m in love because someone finally treated me kindly? Was she just being friendly or acting like anyone would toward an acquaintance? Does she maybe just want to be friends and I’m reading too much into it? Or could she actually like me too, beyond friendship?

I’m so confused — it feels exciting but also overwhelming — and I really don’t want to mess up if this might actually be something real.

Sorry again for this wall of text, but I don’t really have anyone in real life I can talk to about this and need to get this off my chest.

Be Selfish, Occasionally

Be selfish occasionally.

I’ve talked to a couple of people I know in the past few weeks who have had someone close to them commit su\*c\*de.

They’re in pain, everybody they know is in pain, and the person isn’t around to ask.

So here it is.

My mom said, and apparently her entire generation of people who wanted to sound educated or empathetic or whatever, that anybody who took themselves out was committing the most selfish act they ever could.

And when I talked to the second person recently and they said “someone I know committed su\*c\*de”

I got to thinking.

Doing that to yourself is generally regarded as the situation where your life has gotten so overwhelming that that’s the only way out you see.

And then I thought “why haven’t I?”

I’ve been passively that way since about the age of 10.  The unemployment rate for autistics in the US is about 86%, and I have led a fairly crappy life because of it.

And the su\*c\*de rate for autistics is like 4 to 10x the national average.

So why haven’t I?

It’s not because I’m objectively more worthy than the ones who have.  It’s not that I’m more stable.  I’m not.  I’d have traded places with Bert or Rich (2 friends of mine that died from cancer) in a nanosecond.

So why not?

Look, I don’t know for sure.  

But one thing I do know is this.

I’m more selfish than they are.

I do a lot of things for a lot of people, no question about it, but I also do whatever I want the rest of the time.  

I don’t interact with a lot of people.  I don’t sit around and mope in public.  I don’t… well, whatever your average person is doing on a daily basis.  I don’t even know that list, because I don’t do them.

And that’s why the lead sentence here is “be selfish occasionally.”

Volunteer at an animal shelter.  Read.  Play computer games.  Hike.  Whatever it is.

Find something YOU LIKE TO DO AND DO IT.

If the last thing you ever do is the most selfish thing you can do, maybe, just maybe, if you do something just for you often enough, be SELFISH enough, you won’t ever do the most selfish thing you can do.

As a well known religion puts it, and it harm none, do what thou wilt.

Be selfish.

Occasionally.

A letter to my ex

Hey M,

I don’t know where you are now, and I’m not supposed to reach out — I’m respecting that. But there’s a lot I never got to say, and I need to let it live somewhere instead of inside me.

I still think about you sometimes. Not in a way that tries to pull you back into my life, but in the way you think about someone who mattered, someone who left a mark. Despite how things ended, I care about you. I hope you’re safe, I hope life is gentler with you than it used to be, and I hope you’ve found people who see the good in you.

The truth is: your sudden turn hurt. It confused me and left me carrying a lot of loose ends. I wish we could have talked instead of crashing into that disconnect. I never wanted to make you feel replaced or insecure. I never wanted to be a source of fear or pain for you.

If my closeness with D made you feel threatened or unwanted, I’m sorry. That was never my intention. I wasn’t choosing someone over you — I was following my feelings and trying to be honest, and I didn’t realize how sharp that shift felt from your side. I wish I had understood sooner. I wish we could have had a real conversation about it instead of everything breaking so suddenly.

At the same time, I know I didn’t do anything wrong by caring about someone else, and I know it wasn’t my job to carry all of your fears. But I can still be sorry that it hurt you. I can still wish the ending had been kinder to both of us.

You meant something to me. You were a real chapter in my life, not a footnote. And even if we’ll never talk again, I still hope you’re okay. You’ve been through a lot, and I genuinely wish your future is softer than your past.

I’m letting go of the guilt. I’m letting go of the “what ifs.” I’m letting go of trying to fix something that can’t be rewound.

But I’m keeping the truth that I cared — because that part was real, and it doesn’t need to be erased to heal.

Goodbye. Be well. Be safe.

— K

I’ve read about other people experiencing the feeling of their chest aching when they’re extremely sad/depressed but for me it’s different
I get so sad that my chest feels like it tightens and it’s uncomfortable but doesn’t hurt like I’ve read other people say it does. I get very upset very quickly when I think the people I love don’t want me around or hate me or if they say they’re mad at me, and, even if I didn’t intend on insulting them or making them sad, I still get  so sad that I hurt them or might have hurt them.
In the moments I feel so sad, my chest feels tight and like my heart is squeezed for a few seconds. Again, it’s not pain, more like uncomfortable pressure. It comes and goes in a few seconds and it’s only ever when I feel extremely sad or while I’m crying.
I also get so mad at myself that I feel so uncomfortable that I can’t sit still and when when I do move, I can’t do enough to express the rage  and resentment I feel about myself. I'm not sure what to put here.

Loss still hurts me sometimes. people cut me off out of the blue, I'm certain i did something wrong. I'm not a nice person, I'm a liar. i look down on others, It's not that i hate people, it's that they matter so little to me, like an object you don't pay attention to, an inconvenience. But i want to feel close to someone, i want to know what it's like to look someone in the eyes and see another human being, no matter how many moments pass i feel nothing. i laugh sometimes when i get caught of guard, maybe even have fun. and for that brief moment i have a shred of peace. It always ends.  
  
I've spent my life trying to figure out all these feelings people talk about, I don't feel guilt, i don't feel regret. they are foreign to me in so many ways, i could blame a diagnosis, it would be easy. But it doesn't fix me. I spiral down this blank space in my mind. Everything feels as rushed as it is agonizingly slow, no matter where i try to find balance i land back in this dark corner of my mind where the only things that feel reel are late nights in solitude rotting in this chair playing games. I can feel years slip from my fingers. I remember a time when i told myself i would change. I remember so many times.   
  
 It's been so long, when i was little, i can still remember the feeling of real joy. a feint little flicker of what it was like to feel human, before i was hurt, before i suffered like this. I remember my birthdays, All the times i watched the sun set at dawn, the golden orange glow. it brought me to a place where i felt at home in my own body, Now. i hate the sun, it's brightness. i hate the heat it brings, the warmth. Now i look up at the moon, wishing the night would never end so i could be in silence and solitude, in the dark. where the only thing that exists in my world is me.   
  
The world used to be so beautiful, so warm. All i see now is dread, waiting for the moment when the sun stops cursing me with it's presence so i can enjoy the dark again where nothing can harm me except my own thoughts, my own loneliness.   
  
I have no one to talk to. i don't know that i want to anymore. my wife stays by my side, she knows why i suffer like this, she knows why i will always be like this. I wish i could fix it like she hopes i can. In the end i know that i am here to look after her, that is all i have left in me. It's all i have the strength for now. She says she feels selfish asking me to keep going, to keep fighting. she can't help her nature, i don't hold that against her. If it wasn't for her... you understand.  
  
I have no inspiration to give you, no motivation to keep going. no message of love and how someone cares for you. All i have is this.   
  
Enough pain to drive a  person insane, I wish i could be humble and say that someone out there must share it, someone has to be able to relate. due to it's nature i know this isn't true. with some kinds of hurt you can always hold on to the hope that someone out there understands you, and some day if you fight hard enough you'll find them and heal yourself. I know that i am alone, I know i can never have this. And i don't believe there is a single thing that will ever hurt a living being more than knowing no matter how much they hope and search, in that suffering i will be forever alone.   
  
I am jealous of so many of you.   
Part of me wants to tell people what i fight every day, part of me wants to reach out and try to find someone that can help me, I want someone to know.   
But it's too late for that. Too late to heal, And i will die like this. My only comfort now is knowing that some day this will all end.  
   
  
In that moment, only then will i know peace.   
  
A saying that always stuck with me since the day i heard it.  
"Memories are bones of the past, death made sacred"   
  
Never will i know a deeper truth.

Positive symptoms are additive to ones character, hallucinations and delusions. Negative are subtractive, anhedonia or apathy for example.
Despite what you think people with schizophrenia are not walking around day to day hearing voices, they are temporary positive symptoms that are short live, treatable and dissipate, possibly to return in a future acute episode, sure but not the part of the illness that is destructive (or the main destructive nature of the illness) it is the negative symptoms that ruin people with this illnesses life.

You have clearly some trivial understanding of the affliction and are taking things like internet memes or general understanding and equating shit like multiple personality disorder with schizophrenia.

Look at terry davies for example. Did he seem like he was hearing voices or having delusions...he was schizophrenic.
No, his issues were part of the negative symptoms. Not the positive symptoms as again, they are easily treatable and dissipate.

I've noticed a recurring pattern where people confidently claim that AI is useless, overhyped, or will never come close to replacing their profession. It's not just skepticism-it's often framed with absolute certainty. For example:

>"AI will never do my job."
>"LLMs are just prediction engines, they can't reason."
>"This is another crypto-style hype cycle-it'll fizzle out."

Now, to be clear, I'm not saying AI will 100% take over all jobs. I also recognize I have my own bias-I work in a field related to AI, and from what I've seen, the progress is both impressive and worrying. But I also admit there's uncertainty, and nobody really knows how it will all play out.

What I'm curious about is the psychology behind people who are so dismissive. Is it:

>A defense mechanism to manage anxiety about the unknown?

>A kind of rational ignorance ("AI's not good yet, so I'll deal with it when I have to")?

>Intellectual overconfidence or identity preservation ("I'm too creative/strategic/technical to be replaced")?

i miss my little sister.

She hasn’t passed, we still live together with our parents since we’re still young. I’m 21F and she’s 18F.

We were best friends when we were growing up. I helped raise her, being her big sister. Our parents are kind of emotionally distant, so whenever she was scared or sad I’d be the one hugging her better, cheering her up, taking her out. I helped try to teach her to be a kind and accepting human, to be respectful to everyone. I felt very maternal to her at some times.

We weren’t really raised in a church, but were baptized and went to a christian church occasionally for holidays and things like that as children. Religion wasn’t really a super big part of our lives. But then she met a boy, and they’ve been together for a little over a year, and now she’s a very devout catholic.

I don’t have issues with religion- if it makes people happy and makes them better people, I’m here for it. I really don’t understand, as I’m atheist and in university working to become a biologist. I’ve always loved science. My issue is I feel like religion is not making her, in specific, a better person.

Suddenly we’ve gone from supporting the LGBT to “I don’t support that lifestyle”. This kills me. I’m bisexual and she went from accepting me to suggesting conversion therapy and saying I will go to hell. Suddenly her interest in animals and dinosaurs is gone, because she believes they never existed and the huge collection of fossils me and our dad share just… aren’t real. Just rocks.

This really hurts me as a scientist, especially as we believe evolution and dinosaurs are real. Just because they weren’t written in the bible doesn’t mean they don’t exist, but her worldview has narrowed down to the bible alone and nothing outside of it. I’ve tried to help explain some things because she said she doesn’t understand how they work (her main reason for believing everything the bible says is “I don’t like science”), but she refuses to listen. I’M NOT TRYING TO CONVERT HER OUT OF BEING CHRISTIAN. I simply wanted to teach her about something I’m passionate about and help her understand something she said she didn’t. I believe you can be religious and understand science. She just doesn’t want to, it seems.

I also worry being as religious as she is, is getting bad for her mental health. I remember she told me one time the “devil was tempting her” because she found her boyfriend attractive and wanted to kiss him. She sat on my floor and cried to me that her eternity was on the line because she sinned. It scared me. A lot. And it made me really sad when she suggested if I were to simply believe in Jesus, all my severe mental illnesses that I am medicated for and in therapy for, would disappear because it helped her self-esteem. I’m glad it’s helped her self-esteem, of course, I think that’s great. But I worry more harm than good is being done to her.

We had a huge argument two months ago about her believing gays aren’t natural and that I should go to conversion therapy as she believes it works, and that I’m a sinner going to hell that needs to be forgiven. Our parents got involved because neither of us had screamed at one another since we were children. We haven’t talked since.

I miss my little sister, I miss talking to her and laughing with her, I miss how we used to play with all my pets together and went on adventures together. She’s just not the same person anymore and I miss her.

Friend started dating someone I had a past emotional connection with – am I wrong for feeling hurt even though I’ve moved on?


Hi everyone,
I’d really appreciate an outside perspective on a situation that’s been emotionally challenging.

I’ve had a very close friendship with someone for many years — the kind of friendship built on trust and openness. Theme "dating your friends ex" was on the table a few times, my point of view on that was clear (for me is za no go).  Some time ago, I had a emotional and physical involvement with someone from our wider social circle. We were never officially a couple, but the connection was strong and impactful for me. My friend was fully aware of this and supported me during that time. Knew all the details possible. 

Recently, she told me she’s now in a relationship with that same person. They’ve known each other for a long time, and there’s also additional history within the group — she previously had a long-term relationship with someone close to him. Because of that existing dynamic, I found her decision even more sensitive and unexpected. She only told me once things were already moving forward between them.

To be clear: I’m currently in a happy and committed relationship, and I have no interest in reconnecting with him. My reaction is not about wanting him back — it’s about feeling like someone who knew how emotionally difficult that past was for me still chose to move forward without addressing it earlier.

It feels like:

my past feelings and vulnerability were disregarded,

her new relationship outweighed the depth of our friendship,

and I was informed only when there was no room left for genuine discussion.


Some people around me say things like “you can’t choose who you love” or “it happened long ago”, but to me, this is more about boundaries, emotional awareness, and respect — not time or jealousy.

I feel like crying whenever I think back about the time where I was pressured into dancing alone in front of hundreds of people.

Just want to get that out of my chest because I am deeply embarrassed about this.

It happened last year in June. In my university, we each year have a big meeting of the different campus in which we have some contests (sports and arts). This year, I tried to be brave (I am autistic, very shy and was in a dark place at this point) and participate in the fashion contest because my sewing/crafting skills are my one source of pride.

When I volunteered, someone in charge put me in a group chat with 2 guys (which was good as you needed to be at least 3). I did not know these persons.
 However, they had no sewing experience at all and wanted me to make their outfit. I could not do that (not enough time, they were not on campus, I had no experience sewing men clothing) and told them as much. Tho, I gave them a lot of ressources, easy sew ideas and told them that I was there to help at any point.
Because I am stupid, I did not check in with them in the 3 weeks between us meeting and the contest. I assumed these grown men were doing their job. 

The VERY day we were supposed to leave for the big meeting (we had to take the bus for hours), I asked about them and was told they dropped out of the contest. Without telling me, without anyone informing me. Nothing, I was suddenly all on my own for that. It got even worse when I arrived on the site of the meeting. Only there I was informed that we (fashion contestant) were supposed to have prepared some kind performance. Again, I was never given this information. 
Basically, I was in a place I did not know with people I did not know and expected to put on a performance alone in front of hundreds of people. 
Honestly, at this point I did not want to do any of that anymore. But people from my campus pressured me when I was backstage. I wasn't forced, but it felt like it. I ended up caving under the pressure, gave a music name and had to dance alone on a stage in front of hundreds of students. I felt extremely embarrassed and  ashamed. I hated every second of it and felt like crying. When it was done, I was red and hyperventilating. Today, I can't even listen to the music that was playing at this moment without feeling awful.

No one ever apologized to me or acknowledge my distress. The only ones that were nice to me were the other fashion contestant from other campus. But from my campus ? No empathy.

Today, just thinking about it makes me want to cry.
I know I am not blameless. I should have checked in with 2 guys that let me down. But still, everything felt very uncalled for. 


Thanks for reading, I just needed to get that out of my chest.

I may have saved my fiancée’s life but I can never tell her the truth

My (23F) fiancée (22F) has a history of suicide attempts and trauma related to her time in the psych ward when she was younger. Neither of us are strangers to mental health issues or suicidal thoughts, and it had become dangerously normalized to joke about it among our friend group. We work seasonally where it is isolated and extremely difficult to get substantial medical attention without taking a six hour ferry or being airlifted to the nearest city. Getting any sort of prescription medication delivered is a nightmare and my fiancée gradually stopped taking her meds, struggling even more with feelings of isolation and cabin fever. 

About six months into our contract and almost a year into our relationship, she expressed that she was really struggling with thoughts of suicide and self harm. Even just being around her, I could tell it was more intense than it had been for some time. What really set off alam bells in my head was her insistence that I would be okay without her and her numerous hypothetical questions about what I would do if she died. 

This went on for days and my concern for her was spiraling into sleepless nights with alarms set every hour to make sure she was still there in our bed. I don’t remember how long it went on, but eventually I brought the subject up to my fiancée’s close friends (basically family), as well as my therapist. Everyone I talked to said it was in my fiancée’s best interest that we stage an intervention of sorts to get her back on the right track, but I didn’t want to go to the extreme and traumatize her again by sending her to the psych ward. By then I was exhausted and afraid for my fiancée’s life, so that felt like my only option at the time. The plan backfired, my fiancée refused help and told me that I had broken her trust by telling her friends things she had told me in confidence. I only slept a few hours that night, my therapist’s recommendation to call the police as a last resort looking like my only chance to help the love of my life. I was torn and mentally unable to make a call like that, leaving the decision up to my fiancée’s closest friends. 

It was early in the afternoon and we were watching a movie in tense silence when we heard a knock at our bedroom door. Our bosses (also my fiancée’s very close friends, practically family) entered our room and told her to get dressed so they could take her to the town clinic for help. She tried to leave the house when they threatened to call the police. She told me to leave the room and I cried in the hallway, afraid I had ruined our relationship and fearful for what my fiancée might do to herself the moment anyone took their eyes off her. 

Our bosses took her outside and her best friend drove her to the clinic. They came back to check on me and reassure me that they told her I had nothing to do with the whole ordeal, that it was all their idea. A couple hours went by and I was a wreck, following her friend’s advice and trying to pack her a bag for the psych ward when I finally got a text from my fiancée saying they weren’t sending her anywhere. 

I ended up at the clinic with multiple screenshots from conversations with my fiancée where she alluded to a plan or outright said she would hurt herself. I spoke with my therapist and someone who handled the legality of sending someone to the psych ward against their will. In the end, they couldn’t take her anywhere, but they did put her back on medication and sent her home with a plan for psychiatric treatment. 

I told my bosses what had happened and we were all at a loss. I felt helpless and defeated. I knew I would never have forgiven myself if my fiancée had done something to hurt herself and I did nothing to stop it, but now I can never forgive myself for the way I intervened. I never would have considered calling 911 if I had known that they could only do something if she was actively attempting to take her life. It felt like I had put her through all that for nothing. 

After the dust had settled, she told me that she was mad at me at first because she thought it was me who told our bosses what was going on with her, and if they hadn’t told her it was someone else’s idea, she never would have spoken to me again. 

It’s been months and I can’t stop thinking about how I traumatized my fiancée in a completely different way than I could have imagined. I regret not handling things better and not listening to her best friend who thought the intervention should have been more of a personal conversation than a group discussion. I feel guilty that others took the fall for my mistake. 

She’s doing well staying consistent with her meds now and doing better overall, but she brings it up every so often and says no one understands how traumatic it was. I’ll never know what it was like to be in her shoes or in her head during the ordeal, but I just want to tell her how much it tears me apart to see her in such a bad place and that I did what I thought was right in the moment. I want to tell her how sorry I am for causing more pain, but I’m so grateful to still have her in my life. 

I don’t really have friends of my own these days, most of the people I know already knew my fiancée before we met, so I don’t feel comfortable sharing these thoughts with anyone but my therapist. We’re not working anymore so I don’t have access to my therapist and now it feels like I’m drowning in guilt. I wish I could talk to my fiancée about it but I’m afraid she would never forgive me if she knew everything.

Nauseous all the time driving me mad

Long story short I have crippling anxiety and have done my entire life, any social situations (work, walking down the high street, visiting friends, shopping anything involving any people what so ever) makes me unbelievably anxious. I have felt sick and queasy every single day since I was 10 I am now 27. I’ve had 17 years of constant nausea and it’s driving me mad I hate it. 
I am on citalopram and propranolol to help the anxiety but I feel like it just makes the nausea worse. When the chronic nausea started I had every blood test possible to rule out anything physically wrong so after years of doctors appointments it was ruled as just and anxiety symptom. 

Here’s the thing. I have extreme emetophobia. So I live in a spiral. I’m anxious so I feel sick then I get more anxious because I feel sick which creates more nausea constantly over and over again. 

What a lot of non anxious people don’t realise is that yes anxiety is a mental health condition but it creates physical symptoms which are so gruelling to live with. 

The constant nausea makes every day a battle. I work 4 days a week I had to drop a day due to the constant fatigue I feel because of battling with my own brain and body every day. I’ve given up on going out for meals and drinks with friends and family. I’ve given up on holidays, I’ve given up on days out. I’ve basically given up on leaving the house and only leaving for work. I lie in bed al night feeling sick with the thought of leaving the house the next morning. 

I’m knackered. I’m frustrated. I’m fed up. And I’m jealous of people who can live life with no anxiety, no fatigue, no depression and those that don’t feel sick to their stomachs every day. 

Sorry for the rant. I’m just so fed up with feeling this way.

I might have lymphoma and im stressing, trying to cope

Im F25, and I noticed about 4, almost 4 and a half months ago that I had an enlarged lymph node around where my clavicle is. I initially messaged my primary doctor, and he wasnt concerned. 

I waited a month, and it was still there. I wasnt sick or anything, id just been feeling very tired and itchy. I had to turn the temp down in my house because I constantly felt like I was boiling. For spongebob jokes and all, its literally be at 62 degrees for the past few months for me to be able to sleep at night.

Well anyway, I bugged my doctor a little but more. He still wasnt concerned, but sent me for an ultrasound. The tech was also supposed to be measuring the size of a smaller mass in my breast that had been found 6 months prior. She went way too fast, barely got any images in the places where she needed to. Of course it came out normal, she spent a mere 5 minutes looking from my ears to my armpits to my breast. 

I wasnt having it. Sure the notes said everything was normal, so my spouse thought I was imagining it. That is, until more began to protrude along my neck and chest. I messaged my primary doctor, and he once again wasnt concerned. After all, he had only ordered an ultrasound and nothing else. 

I asked a local Facebook group for help finding a new primary care doctor, and im SO grateful I did. She ordered a CT scan for me right off the bat, and multiple blood tests. My labs showed that there had been a massive flip in my neutrophils and lymphocytes since the last set I had done, 3 months prior. The CT scan found over a dozen enlarged and abnormal appearing lymph nodes. Some were deep in my chest and couldnt be felt. One was pushing my esophagus to the side and compressing the top of my right lung. 

So, after these results appeared on MyChart, my technical primary doctor removed me as a patient. I hadn't even fired him, he just saw himself out. My new primary, she's really nice and shows that she cares in our appointments. But, now im going to be meeting with an oncologist in early December. On my sons 4th birthday. I feel awful, because i didn't want it to land on that day of all days, and now I feel like im taking away from his fun day.

Hes so little, he doesnt understand what's going on and why ive been in bed so much these past few months. He doesnt understand why I havent had the energy to do all the fun things, to play outside when we had some light snowing a week ago. 

Im so anxious over this, its eating me alive. My spouse has been indifferent since the testing came back abnormal, and i think its because they wanted it to be normal and arent coping with it well. They won't tell me though. We love far away from friends and family, and I feel so utterly alone in all of this as my spouse works and has been picking up double shifts from their coworker who has been taking a ton of time off. 

To make matters worse, im in my first semester of college as I waited a while to start. So im handling the stress of a toddler, college deadlines, ... possible cancer, being medically gaslit and having to advocate against some of my doctors, ugh... What i would give to just have the answers right now so I wouldn't have to have it sitting in the back of my mind all the time. 

My spouse has been angry at me a lot lately.. its always something that is 100% related to me being extremely fatigued and having little energy to keep up things like the chores around the house. Its all making me feel more like a servant than a person, like im locked away in this house and the only sign i exist is if the house gets cleaned. That statistic of partners leaving their wives when they get cancer keeps coming to the forefront of my thoughts, I dont know what's going to happen with all of this and I dont know how to handle it properly.

I'm almost 30 , and I hate myself and my life because it's essentially empty. There's nothing in it: no love, no joy, nothing. I don't drink, I don't smoke, I lead a relatively healthy lifestyle, I have a seemingly good job, and that's it. I have friends, or even colleagues I can chat with during breaks. I had relatives, but even when they were alive, I didn't feel alive because we had nothing in common except the same last name. I hate my life, it's simply empty. I can drink tea in the morning and not eat anything else the rest of the day. I have nothing. I tried looking for a hobby, looking for connections, but I couldn't find one no matter how hard I looked, and connections always ended after a couple of weeks or days. I've only fallen in love twice in my life, no more. But that's stupid. I've lived almost 30 years, fallen in love twice, never had a relationship, and I wouldn't call myself ugly. I'm confidently average, not handsome, but not ugly either. I've thought about suicide more than once, but is that really the answer? I don't want to die without feeling happy at least once in my life, just happy, not winning the lottery or anything else, just happiness, even if fleeting.

Fear of work mistakes is driving me crazy!

I have suffered with GAD for years, probably as far back as I can remember to be honest. 

My parents put a huge amount of pressure on me to achieve (for example I was a straight A student and got a B on one physics tests and they got me a tutor). Perfection was always expected and anything less was a huge disappointment.

Being academically intelligent has had great advantages and anxiety has helped in some ways with that as it’s been a huge motivator to succeed, study etc. But I feel like it also means I am CONSTANTLY over thinking. I am too aware of what can go wrong. Playing every scenario in my head and catastrophising constantly. That coupled with my massive fear of failure means the last 2-3 years I’ve been in an almost constant state of being 1 small mistake away from having a huge anxiety attack.  

I have a very responsible job high up in finance and I made a mistake a few years ago (that honestly wasn’t that big)  that pushed me over the edge and I took a huge overdose and was sectioned in the mental heath inpatient unit and then off work for a few months. But ultimately I went back into the same job, as my family (spouse and children) are reliant on my income and I can’t get a less responsible lower paying job. 

I feel tense, on edge all the time, I can’t sleep, I pace up and down, I cry in my office, I imagine scenarios where I am going to get fired and we are going to lose our house, made worse by the fact the job market is so bad. And the bigger issue is I am in the type of job where mistakes can happen and I freak out at the possibility. The main feeling is this overwhelming desire to run away. From work, from home, from adult life, which I think is what the overdose was actually about, a desire to run away from being alive rather than a desire to die. 

On top of that my therapist of 3 years just moved to a different city over an hour away with no warning at all.

Has anyone had experience with this? How do you cope?

>>33905241
Are you afraid of the world anon? It seems you have committed yourself to suicide. Does this determination feel freeing? You seem to have successfully overcome your natural impulses of self preservation, and by bypassing this evolutionary mechanism you are no longer (in theory) bound by the illusions of society. By illusions I mean those of responsibility and reputation; the idea that you ought to be "successful" or else you'll "miss out". But everyone will die. Everyone will have the same end, and no one will exist after their last breath to reflect on that "success". There will just be nothing, and everyone who you feel you need to impress or feel loved by, and everyone they feel they need to impress or loved by will all die, and their names will be forgotten by their progeny within 1-2 generations. Overtime, even the names on their gravestones will be unrecognizable, and they will truly disappear forever. We all die in unmarked graves; whether you are rich, poor, famous, a criminal, a king, etc. All are equal in death.

Are you anxious about tomorrow? You'll be gone in a few days.
Would you feel ashamed if you did something embarrassing? It won't matter, there won't be a you in a few days.
Are you afraid to try new things? Not like it'd matter anyways, but you always have that way out.

The world is now your playground. You can do whatever you want, and pull the plug before things get ugly.

For the devout theist, an afterlife awaits them, so they feel as though nothing matters in this world, and that frees them of its burdens.

For the atheist, nothing awaits them after death, and there is no hell to be afraid of, and there is solace in that fact.

In every possible worldview, everything here is meaningless. Do you feel free yet, anon? Will you unflinchingly take your own life? Or will you do so with a quivering hand and an aching in your heart? If the latter, you are not free, but it's not like that really matters anyway. Do. As. You. Will.

Are being attractive really a big factor in relationships?

I’ve always wondered this, especially as a woman who’s never really fit the “ideal” standard of beauty. I’m not ugly, but I’ve never been the girl who turns heads when she walks into a room. I’m the one people call “sweet,” “nice,” or “you have a great personality.” And honestly, after a while, that starts to hurt more than it helps. I’ve dated before, but it always feels like I’m the one trying harder, putting in the effort, giving love, understanding, patience, while he still seems half in, half out. And deep down, I can’t help but wonder if it’s because I’m just not that girl. Not the one they brag about, not the one who makes their friends jealous.

People love to say looks fade, that what really matters is personality and kindness. But I’ve seen how people treat beautiful women, how easily they’re loved, forgiven, desired. It’s not jealousy, it’s just the painful awareness that beauty opens doors that most of us have to knock on for years before anyone even answers. Sometimes I wish love wasn’t so tied to appearance. I wish being genuine, loyal, and emotionally mature mattered as much as having a perfect body or flawless skin. I know real connections exist, but I’d be lying if I said it doesn’t sting to feel invisible in a world that worships looks. Maybe one day someone will see me the way I’ve always wanted to be seen, not as “good enough,” but as someone worth choosing first.

I didn’t know I’d see the end of this year

This year has easily been one of the hardest years of my life. I’ve been battling an autoimmune disease since I was 16 (UCTD) I’m 21 now. My arthritis is worse then ever, my kidney levels are low, my mental health is so bad that I got a brain scan that showed that I have PTSD from childhood and a slew of other this. I was caught purging when I lost 30 pounds in 3 months and my doctor found out. I havent been able to sleep a full night for months because my nightmares are so vivid and gory. 
My mom is getting tired of the phone calls, my brother doesn’t care, my coworkers are none the wiser. I found peace and happiness in horse riding and weightlifting. I found myself in it. Well, last appointment my doctor said it was doing more harm than good to my joints and arthritis. I world just collapsed around me. I could no longer ride my horse, and no longer weightlift. 
Earlier this year I had a plan to end it all. I would pace and pace in my kitchen eyeing my car keys but every time I chickened out. I’d fall to my knees and remember my dog, I’d see my house fall into disrepair, shelves covered in dust because my mother couldn’t bare to move the things I’d placed in perfect order. But I thought I’d do it someday, I truly did. One day on my way home from work, I’d do it. But it never came. 
And now I’m here, in the holiday season, feeling empty and exhausted. I’m beginning invited to work events and family gatherings that I can’t be bothered to attend. 
They wouldn’t even notice if I was gone. And as for the work ones, I’d only get in trouble if I was there or not. I’m not meeting their standards anyway. They don’t like me anyway. 
At this point I’m only holding on for my mother and my dog. There is nothing here for me. I am a shell of a child that had the world ahead of her. With every step feeling like knives being lodged into my knees, every thought being about the battle I’m fighting. I’m trying to hard to keep myself alive for my mom and for my dog. Every train that passes is an opportunity, every new medication for my kidneys or disease management or pain or SSRIs or whatever is a way out. I don’t want to die. But sometimes I feel like it is the only way out.
