A unexpected trip to Paris and unexpected emotions

This is quite a story and I didn't know where else to post it. So here I go:

I'm 23M currently living in Germany. My life is quite nice, in fact in the past weeks has take quite a positive turn too. Good space. For months I had a plan with my buddy to visit Berlin but he had to cancel on a relatively short notice. I had been budgeting, and looking forward to a trip, so I decided to go Paris to meet a friend. The centre of this story is this friend, lets call her Lily. Lily is 22 right now. 

Lily and I met online when I was around 17. We met talked and quickly found out that we shared a lot of common interests. Science, philosophy, and all other such topics. We used to talk a lot, everyday, had fun conversations too. Naturally, with time we also started talking about our lives, more personal things, sharing stuff like drawings etc. We also talked about our education and future plans, and I told her that education is shit in my home country and I want to leave asap. She invited me to France, saying she will even fill out the college application for me in French, but I couldn't afford emigrating at the time, plus it made no sense, I couldn't learn French. So I just told her so. We kept talking for a while but she started exhibiting erratic behavior, deleting old messages (especially the personal ones), talking weirldly, calling me her "best friend" and then disappearing. Now I was 18ish, and my EQ is nothing to write about, it's bad, and at the time it was downright garbage. I was super oblivious and obnoxious, so I figured at the time  that she got scared of sharing too much, and backed off, and I went on with my life, not caring much, but I am one of those people for whom emotional realization comes with nostalgia, and I am a nostalgic person. When I was around 20-21 I realized 
"Wait.. did she like me?" And I was like, "damn I could have handled it better"
Meanwhile Lily is on and off, dissappears for months and then comes back for a while, repeat. The last time she dissappeared though, she left me her email, so i left her my email. Months later she mails me, so now we talk somewhat through email. Now I'm around 21-22, so I sort of now guess that she used to like me, but it had been so long and all we did was talk sporadically through email, again, over months, birthday wish, etc. Basically a penpal at this point. 

Fast forward to last year and I deciced to emigrate to Germany. I informed her about it, and she suggested, "oh great, we can meet". I was honestly a bit surprised given how much effort she had taken to keep me out of her life but sure, I didn't mind either ways. Now once I arrived in germany during the last winter, I proposed to meet, then she proposed to meet but it couldn't materialize, life I guess. Except this time it did materialize. In the past months, she too moved back to discord so we could talk more normally but not much. 

Now, upon meeting her, she was in many ways exactly how I imagined her, socially anxious, clumsy, and air headed. Taking wrong turns,  (even though she lives here), almost stepping in puddles. Now, I knew this, because I'm in many ways like her, clumsy, oblivious, and air headed. Many a times today, we walked past things, missed stations, sights, because we kept talking about this or that, or were too blind. It was nice, catching up, although I had to put in a lot of labour because her social skills are 0, while life has conditioned me more I guess. Eventually though, she did start to interact more naturally, taking initiative in conversations. I felt nice. 

Now, as we are walking away from the Champ Elysees (we took a wrong turn), she starts to talk about AI and how it affects people (we like talking about ai). Eventually it comes to how people have a parallel personality on the internet. From there, somehow the topic goes to nostalgia and how she had a friend group online, and upon meeting it wasn't the same. I have had my fair share of friendships fading away, so I could empathize and relate.
That we all need closure, and she agreed. That explanations make things easier to accept. 

 While discussing, I brought up, "well you and I used to talk a lot too, you know, but now we don't and that's fine...", I was gonna end with "it's just nice we still stayed in touch" but before I could, she started telling me how it was a long time ago and she had some feeling for me, but she can't remember the english word, only French and she is "too lazy to look it up"
Which is obviously a stupid excuse. She didn't want to admit it openly, that she liked me. In that moment, something irked me though. Before that the trip was perfectly nice but in that moment something irked me. She admitted that, "she had distanced herself from me" which was fine.. but I don't know, I cant even describe exactly what irked me, and still is that I'm writing it here. It's not like I have any feelings for her. Perhaps, it's the lack of closure, or lack of honesty. Perhaps its the shitty excuse. Anyway, I had to put it somewhere so here it is.

my childhood bully just died and I feel… weirdly victorious

For most of my school years, there was this one person who made my life a living hell. He wasn’t just a casual bully — he was relentless. He turned my entire school experience into daily psychological warfare. He spread rumors that stuck to me for years, publicly humiliated me, cornered me in hallways just to whisper new ways he planned to “ruin my life.” I wasn’t physically harmed — but the psychological side of it was brutal. I internalized every word and let it rot inside me.

My parents and teachers knew I was bullied — but they didn’t know the depth of it. They didn't know he would follow me home, messaging from fake accounts, mocking my voice, my face, my clothes, my existence. They didn’t know he once sat behind me in class and spent the entire hour muttering insults just loud enough for me to hear — watching me squirm.

Everyone else saw him as “charismatic,” “popular,” “a natural leader,” “just joking.” I was told to “ignore him” — as if ignoring fire makes it stop burning. I told almost no one about the nights I lay awake imagining ways I could escape, or just disappear entirely.

He went on to college, then got a good job in marketing. Eventually became some kind of minor social media personality. People praised his humor and voice. I couldn’t even scroll without seeing his face in an ad or a sponsored post. It felt like he had conquered the world — and I was still the shadow he once stepped on.

Then last week, I heard he suddenly died in a car crash.

My reaction? I smiled. I actually smiled. My whole body felt lighter. For the first time in over a decade, I felt like I wasn’t trapped under his shadow. Like the spell broke. I had this strange electric feeling of freedom — and then the guilt hit. Because everyone around me is devastated. My old classmates are posting tributes. People are writing paragraphs about how inspiring and kind he was.

Meanwhile I’m sitting here thinking: nobody knew how much damage he caused. Nobody knows how I flinch whenever someone laughs loudly behind me. Nobody knows how long his voice echoed in my head, how many years he took from me.

I’m relieved. And angry. Angry that he never had to face consequences. Angry that I had to carry all the weight while he got to live with a spotless reputation. Angry that he died before I could ever tell him, “you fucked me up.” And yet… relieved that he’s gone.

I don’t know how to act when people talk about him like a legend. I don’t know whether I should go to the memorial service and stand quietly, or stay home and celebrate silently. I don’t think there’s a guidebook for this sort of thing.

Maybe this post is my first honest acknowledgement of what he took from me. Maybe this is the first crack in the wall I built around those memories.

Whatever.
He’s gone.
And I finally feel like I can breathe again.

Feel like a burden

I live very comfortably, at 22 with no education to speak of and parents that provide for me.

My parents have never asked for much from me, only that I be happy, safe and a moral person.

Spent 5 years in tertiary education studying for a degree that I neither liked nor hated, when the average person graduated in 3. I never even got my degree as I deferred a semester too many times(5) and then got advised by the course chairman to drop out and figure myself out first.

Most days I do nothing but rot away playing games, reading shitty books and scrolling on social media. It’s enviable how successful the people around me are. I used to always think the saying, ‘birds of a feather flock together’ is pretty accurate but being surrounded by family and friends that are all doing well in life makes me wonder what is actually wrong with me. 

I feel like I use my depression and anxiety as an excuse. Not only am I wasting money on medication and sessions with an overpriced psychiatrist, but I enjoy the benefits of being someone that is “sick and should therefore not be held to a higher standard. 

Being from Asia, children are looked upon to look after their parents when they’re older and can no longer look after themselves. Yet they have never held me to that, they even explicitly said that they do not want me to look after them and that they don’t want to be a burden to both my brother and I.
They have never put pressure on me when I was younger to perform academically or pushed me to do anything I didn’t want. They advise me on things in life and let me make the decision on whether I want to take that advice. 

For years I felt guilt and shame for not being good enough for them as I think that they are good parents. They provided the best they could for me even when we were poor and never neglected me. Took me out for activities together like sports and just eating out. I do think that they should have had a kid that turned out better than me. But I am what they are stuck with. I say I feel guilt and shame but I never act on them, never try to better myself, never tried to get better, never tried to pursue anything.

I’m a fucking coward and loser that has zero passion in life. If asked about what I like doing I would always say gaming and reading, but I don’t derive any joy from it, I get immersed but they are just activities to pass the time. If I can’t engage in them nothing will change in my life, still rotting away the same just with a different activity that is equally as time consuming. 

I used to keep a diary til I found out that it’s always about how fucking bad I feel and how I want to die. I know that I just want to escape, I don’t know from what either. So I stopped writing in it. My days were monotonous anyways, it wasn’t more just lying to myself about how shitty I have it when I know that’s not true. 

My parents argue somedays, I think that the root of the problem is always me. When I was young they argued about money, now they still have to argue about money. Though we are middle-class, they always have to worry about the fact that nobody will take care of me once they’re gone. They do tell me that as well, the fact that they will one day not be here, and they ask what my plans are for when that happens. I never say this out loud because I know it will hurt them but I always think that I will kill myself after taking care of their funerals. 

I keep saying I will kill myself but I’m a coward that doesn’t have the courage to do that. Because I’m a leach that is too comfortable now, there is no harm to me so I don’t change anything. 

They think that a cause for me being mentally ill is the quarrels they have when I was younger, that it impacted me hard. But I know that’s not true and I tell them so. I’m just one of those people that you might see people talk about in your community, the dregs of society, leaching off their parents even though they are able bodied and can support themselves. The ones that even I used to criticise when I was younger. Now I know it’s just hypocrisy.

I wish that my mother had a life outside of family, that she has friends and have an outlet for stress relief or fun when she needs. But she tells me that my brother and I are her pride and joy, that she is very happy caring for us and seeing us grow up. I remember telling her once that she shouldn’t have had me, the heartbreak and sadness on her face was unforgettable. She spends her days trying to think of recipes that we will enjoy, worrying about our future and keeping to herself. I overheard her telling my father that she doesn’t want to burden me with any negative things in life or accidentally nag me for fear of my emotions tanking. I hate that she has to be so careful around me. Somedays I try and sit on the couch so that she will chat with me but I’m not a good conversationalist and cannot provide the emotional connection I should. With my father at work and my brother going through puberty, I’m the only one around that she has to talk to and I hate that I can’t even do something that easy well.

I wish that my father had a life outside of work, he takes on overtime for the pay at least once a week and I know that he’s doing it just to save up for us. He has hobbies like gaming and chess as well, but the moment my brother or I wake up, he asks us what we want for food and drops what he’s doing to get it. When I was young, he would side with me against his own mother, who looked down on my mother and I, always trying to protect us. When my paternal grandmother passed, I had refused to be there til the last day of the 5 day procession, making excuses like I had academic deadlines. Both he and I knew it was excuses, that I just didn’t want to be at the funeral of someone that hated my mother and I. My mother told me after that he had a falling out with his sister then, his only living blood relative, he fought with because she criticised my absence and education. 

I cannot repay the love they give me. At 22 years of age, I have nothing going for me in life. They have to take care of my everything, my wellbeing, my emotions and my future. I keep engaging in this fantasy where I get into an accident, die and they get my insurance, enough for them to retire. 





I don’t know if I will ever come back to this post, the guilt and shame in me is always more than I can take but never enough. I am sorry for the people that have read my self indulgent sob story of a life. I write this with their argument as background music, even when they are quarrelling, they have to take care of my fucking emotions, telling each other to lower their volume just in case I hear.

Confronting myself and the past and familial trauma

Hi Everyone, this might be a long post.  Think of it as my introduction I guess.

Over the last few weeks, more and more, I have been feeling unlike myself, but in a weird way the most authentic version of myself.  What I was "meant for" I guess.  I am about 4k in credit card debt and going to get C's in my classes this semester (I'm a college student).  On a positive note I have quit cigarettes for 36 days after daily smoking from age 15). In the past I was diagnosed with depression through a telehealth app because I could not get out of  bed and everything felt hopeless, something to buy me time because I didn't know how to access care.  Now I am not sure that it was in fact the correct diagnosis.  I am going to meet with an actual professional in person on November 13 for an evaluation. Throughout my childhood, seeing an actual professional for anything related to mental health was considered taboo because it involved outsiders and other people would "know" about our family, and consequences for seeing guidance counselors was getting threatened with foster care or getting hit.

I never felt "normal" as a kid, and I felt different from all of those around me.  Different interest, less socialization, and a prevention from hanging out with other kids and having kids over was also in the picture.  My dad smokes weed and drinks all day and has never supported myself or my mom throughout my life, and lives off her salary and gives back nothing not working since 2000, and claiming to have taken the time off to take care of myself and my grandfather.  He claimed taking care of us to be driving around bringing us places, which I guess could be considered a form of care, however, throughout my childhood it was always myself or my mom helping my grandfather who suffered a stroke before I was born (2003).  All of these created unique circumstances, and left my Mom providing for us, while my volatile Dad would stay at home to look after me, yelling at me for 5 hours on end about something related to his fear of the internet, something I had done that he didn't like, including buy a radio for about 30 dollars, which my mom got "in trouble" for "enabling" my behavior.  I lost a lot of respect for my parents (less so my Mom) around 5 or 6 years old.  In addition to his fears about the internet, he was insistent that there was "contamination" from lead paint, etc. around the house so I was not permitted to walk, instead he would carry me from room to room and set me down on beds and chairs.  This wase early on in my childhood.  As time progressed, I would be able to walk around, but he was afraid of bringing in repairmen into the house for what they might "see" so things like losing heat, water, electricity occurred when I was about 10 years old because we had a leaking roof (think 1 1/2 foot in diameter wide) through the roof in multiple places, and in my room.  So for years, I would have to stay up and change buckets when they would overflow with water, and I would have to move my bed every few hours so I did not get rained on.  Eventually with the water damage, there were mushrooms growing out of the walls and rats scurrying around.  At the same time, he would be very overbearing on me and doing things that a good father should do, like helping me with my homework.  If I ever got the wrong answer, he would do the homework for me or would yell at till I got it right.  He would actually help me through my homework.  Other things included Ski Vacations, Hiking, outdoors activities, reading to me etc.  For context, my family was making around $160k at this time.  I am an only child.  These contrasts (like not having a place to shower, and having to use a flashlight to go the bathroom at night, no heat in the winter) combined with luxuries like slope slide ski cabins and vacations to different places really fucks with me.  Just like sometimes I'll have a great conversation with my Dad, but other times it just devolves into screaming.

Lately I kind of checked out of life, I was smoking like 5 Joints a day, while maintaining my job as a breakfast server and staying in school studying physical therapy, I plan to take an accelerated nursing program after I graduate in May (I hope).  Anyways, I have a good roommate and an ok life.  I'm trying to build myself up and go to the gym, which has been going well and I have gained a lot of muscle and fat (14 percent body fat), which were my goals, so all has been going well there.  I have my good days and my bad days, although one persistency is that cannot "lock in" for shit on my school assignments lately, or just in general.  Ever since I quit smoking (or maybe ever since I started weed), something has felt really off.  Like life just seems boring and I have limited interest in seeing other people and going out and making friends like I used to.  It all feels so hopeless.  For the longest time I just wanted to get fried as fuck all day everyday in my bed and have sex with people.  But now I can tell that shit is serious.  I probably fucked up for the semester and my career is contingent on grad school.  Lets hope I can pull ts off

I pretended to be asleep when my dad said goodbye for the last time.


When I was 15, my dad came into my room late at night. I could hear him breathing, standing in the doorway. He whispered, “Goodnight, kiddo. I love you. Be good to your mom.”

I didn’t answer. I don’t even know why, I was half-asleep and annoyed that he woke me up. I thought I’d talk to him in the morning.

But there was no morning with him. He took his own life that night.

I’ve replayed that moment a thousand times. What if I’d just said I love you too? What if I’d gotten up, asked if he was okay?

Everyone says it’s not my fault. I know that. But every time I close my eyes, I still hear him whispering from the door, and I still don’t answer.

That's because you are genuine. Only genuine people can be awkward and have these kinds of "problems".

I need help cuz i feel like i am trapped (20 fm)

I often feel uncomfortable, unsafe, and disconnected from myself—like I’m living life in third-person, watching everything happen from a distance. My mind feels detached, and nothing feels real. Sometimes I think I don’t deserve anything, and I just want time to pass so I can forget what I’m thinking about.

People make me anxious. I don’t like being asked questions, and when I’m upset, everyone keeps telling me to talk—but I can’t. I know exactly what I want to say, but I can’t express it. I also hate noise and crowded places. I never let people truly understand me because I act like someone else just to please them. Later, I blame myself for not being authentic when they treat me differently.

When I wake up, I often shake uncontrollably. I don’t remember where I am or how I fell asleep. Then I start overthinking—I fear dying that day. My brain never stops; it’s always thinking about everything. When I’m sad or angry, I just want someone to sit next to me silently and listen if I decide to speak.

I struggle to describe my feelings. I don’t really understand what sadness or happiness feels like anymore. Sadness seems to stay forever, while happiness fades quickly—so I’ve grown afraid of being happy. When I feel down, my first instinct used to be hurting myself to replace emotional pain with physical pain. Now, instead of that, I talk to the person I love, and that helps me calm down.

Even though I understand myself logically—why I do what I do—I still don’t understand what I feel. I’m kind to people even when I’m upset because I don’t want them to carry my sadness too. So I fake being okay, even when I’m completely drained inside. All I really want is to be stable.

I’ve had anger issues since childhood. I wish I could have talked about the problems I faced back then. My father once hit me, and I never confronted him about it. I also experienced sexual harassment from a relative when I was a child—something I’ve only ever told my partner. It still haunts me deeply.

There was another time, at a store, when my friend’s father cornered me and kissed me without my consent. I was just a kid, terrified, and I never told anyone. These memories still hurt me today.

As a child, I was jealous of my siblings because everyone used to say my sister was prettier and gave her more attention. Between ages 4–6, I acted out, but when I grew older, they became the ones teasing or hurting me. When I told my parents, they didn’t believe me. That’s when I learned to hide my emotions because no one ever took me seriously—and it still affects me now.

Whenever someone asks me “What’s wrong?”, my throat closes, and I can’t speak even though I know what I want to say. It feels like spikes in my throat. I used to fake being sick just to get attention from my parents because we were many siblings, and I wanted to feel noticed.

Sometimes I suddenly feel like I can’t breathe, especially in uncomfortable or unsafe places. I’ve had panic attacks since childhood—they’ve become less frequent, but they still scare me. When that happens, I remind myself, “It’s okay, nothing’s wrong.” These attacks often come when I feel unsafe, when someone talks about something sexual, or even when I hear words like “choking” or “tightness.”

I also have deep trust issues because of my parents and my past. They used to compliment me only to make up for the way they praised my sister more. My friends at school also broke my trust by sharing my secrets. And of course, the harassment I experienced as a child destroyed a big part of my ability to trust people.

Sometimes I wonder if anyone else feels the same way I do—because I just want to know that I’m not broken, that I’m still normal somehow.
And if anyone has ever found a way to stop feeling like this… I wish I could learn how.

He dumped me after discovering my past

Just want to vent out here.

I was from a long term relationship of more than 8 years when he cheated on me. I had no choice but to leave him kahit masakit. Since then, I was in a very dark place. I wanted to move on, to distract myself from the pain. Kaya nag h03 phase ako. Partied and drank almost every weekend. Nagka one night stand at fubu. I thought it was empowering as a woman, gusto ko casual lang, I was too scared to let my guard down and get hurt. It was all fun at first. Until at some point, it slowly got to me na, nakakamiss din, to feel loved and be in love. I know it sounds cliche. Syempre, I also tried to go on dates. But almost all of them, I sensed that they only wanted one thing. Ewan ko if it was for a boost of confidence nila. I don't fall short physical wise. I think age also plays a factor? I was in my early 20s that time. So guys around that age are not looking for something serious or settling down pa siguro.

It got tiring being in the dating scene. I was longing for love this time. I was tired of playing their games. I did meet a few decent guys, but due to circumstances di nag work out or tuloy. Some of the guys I talked to, were either cheaters, manyak, babaero. It got to a point that my mindset was, "All guys are the same". I became hopeless na kokonti nalang mga matino na lalaki.

I stopped looking for potential love cause I was losing hope and faith in men. Until I met this one guy, at the most unexpected time. He had morals and principles. Knows how to respect women, may manners, and was raised right. Straight yung priorities niya sa buhay. Not to mention, his dating/sexual history. Long term lahat. Never done any of the things I did. Ayaw ng casual. Dating to marry siya. It was because of him that suddenly, I realized, there are still guys like him out there. Then that day came, we developed feelings sa isat isa. But deep inside, I was worried. I was scared and unsure of how this would turn out. He was transparent about the type of girl he was looking for. He said I was exactly his type. Personality and physical wise. But it's not only that. What mattered to him as well, is yung past ng babae. Specifically, sexual history. He even asked me about my body count. I lied. He asked if I had slept around and had fubus, I lied. I kept lying and lying, I don't know, in my mind, he was gonna leave me if I tell him the truth. And I may never find someone like him again. I was selfish, I know. If only I had realized it did more harm than good. I was gonna pay for it in the long run. I do regret ever going into a h03 phase. It will manage to haunt me for the rest of my life. And my chance of ever finding true love one day and meeting a decent man. (It's worth noting that I already checked myself for STDs) Umabot kami ng 3 years before niya unti unti nalaman sexual history ko. He couldn't take it, and had to break things between us. Understandable naman. This was a learning experience for me. Masakit. Alam ko naman na kasalanan ko. I cannot change my past. Whats more important nalang talaga is focusing on what I can do sa present. After that relationship, I vow to work on myself and build my self worth. On what I can bring to the table to compensate. Thankful ako sa kanya kasi, if it weren't for him, di ko ma realize yung mga maling decisions na nagawa ko, yung pagiging promiscuous ko. I was able to focus on the things that mattered more, and becoming a better person. I may not the be everyone's cup of tea dahil sa past ko, and thats okay. I guess, if they truly love you, they will accept you no matter what. But, after that eye opening relationship we had, it seems my chances are slim.

- 6. Object Storage Control - The Gate to MinIO
Django doesn-t serve files directly; that-s a rookie move.
Instead, it uses django-storages with the boto3 driver to talk to MinIO, generating presigned URLs that expire fast - like keys that melt after one use.

Python
url = storage.connection.generate_presigned_url(
"get_object", Params={"Bucket": bucket, "Key": file_key}, ExpiresIn=300
)
That way, only users who passed Django-s ownership checks even get the URL - and it-s dead in 5 minutes.
Sysadmin needs satisfied: Controlled data access, secure file delivery, least-privilege storage.
-You want your download? I-ll open the vault for five minutes - then it-s gone, babe.-
- 7. Upload Security - Scanning the Offerings
User uploads are always suspect.
Your Django backend queues every upload to a background worker (Celery, RQ, whatever), runs ClamAV, and only marks the file available once it-s clean.
That-s how you avoid someone sneaking malware into your media editor app updates.
Sysadmin needs satisfied: Malware prevention, data hygiene, and file integrity.
-You upload junk to my store? I-ll disinfect it, burn it, and block your account just for the aesthetic.-
- 8. Production Hardening - The Sanctum Locks
The final commandments:
DEBUG = False (because showing stack traces in prod is asking for humiliation)
SECURE_SSL_REDIRECT = True
SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE = True
CSRF_COOKIE_SECURE = True
SECURE_HSTS_SECONDS = 31536000
This locks your Django app to HTTPS-only mode and guards cookies like treasure.
Sysadmin needs satisfied: Environment security, production safety, compliance.
-No debug prints, no leaky cookies, no HTTP nonsense. I-m not running a daycare - I-m running a fortress.

My mom has 42 million debt

Please help. Hindi ko na talaga alam ang gagawin ko.

Yung parents ko provincial distributor ng isang telecommunications company sa probinsya namin. Naghiwalay na parents ko 13 years ago pero sa dad ko pa din nakapangalan ang business. Yung mom ko naman ang nagmamanage. Okay ang business as in yun ang bumuhay ang nagpalaki sa family namin. Kahit na hiwalay ang parents ko, tiwala kami sa mom ko na kaya nyang ipagpatuloy ang business kasi it's been there for years. May sarili na din business ang dad ko.

Kaso just last month, tinanggal na sa amin yung pagiging provincial distributor so basically, nawala na yung main source of income and pinagkaka-abalahan ng mom ko. Sa akin okay lang kasi I have my own business na kaya isustain ang sariling family ko. Sa dad ko okay lang kasi may school and real estate business na sya. Yung mom ko yung pinakanagdudusa noon dahil wala na daw sya pinagkakaabalahan. 

But wait, there's more! Nalaman namin just last month na baon na pala sya sa utang from different people. 7 million sa isang tao, 10 million doon sa isa and 5 million doon sa isa. And just recently, nalaman ko na may 20 million pa doon sa isa. Naglabasan sila kasi worried din sila na hindi mabayaran kasi nga nawala na yung business ng mom ko. As in hindi ko alam gagawin ko nung nalaman ko yun. 

Syempre nagdaan na kami sa iyakan, sisihan at diskusyunan. Sinabi ko na dapat noong nasa 5 million palang ang utang nya at hindi na mabayaran, sinuko nalang nya ang business. Kahit nga 1 million palang, ibig sabihin may mali na sa negosyo.

Nalaman ko rin na mismanaged ang business kasi tinatanong ko sya magkano kita mo ng ganitong buwan or ng ganitong buwan, wala syang maipakita na record. Wala palang auditing na nangyayari at all. Sya yung nagnenegosyo na basta may pumasok na pera, okay na to. Tinatanong ko din kung saan napunta ang inutang nya, sinasabi nya lagi na doon sa negosyo daw. Pero tinanong ko din kung san nanggaling pinanggagastos nya personally, ang sagot nya, naghalo halo na daw kasi ang pera. So she is left with nothing na din.

Ito yung mga naging solution. Dati kasi noong na-annul parents ko, napagkasunduin na may matatanggap yung mom ko na 10 million from my dad. Wala pang nakukuha mom ko sa 10 million. So my sad decided na ibayad na lang yung 10 million doon sa isang pinagkaka-utangan. So we are left with 32 million.

Pero hanggang doon lang ang maitutulong ng dad ko kasi kung cocomputin base sa target sell-in at percentage ng profit, dapat kumikita pa din ang business. Hindi sya naniniwalang dapat malugi ang negosyo. At kung may net loss man, hindi aabot ng million.

Second solution: Pinaki-usapan namin yung mga inutangan na tanggalin na ang interest. And pumayag naman yung sa 20 million at 5 million kasi nabawi na pala nila yung principal sa interest palang! Ang problem, ayaw pumayag noong 7 million kasi last year lang pala yun nakuha. Dagdag problema pa sa amin yung 1% monthly interest, which is 70k per month.

Third solution: Pinabenta ko lahat ng pwede nyang ibenta kaso napunta lang sa overhead cost.

Fourth solution: may bahay sya na worth 2 million, sabi ko ibenta na din nya tutal sa bahay ko naman sya nakatira ngayon. I don't know kung ibabayad ko sa utang nya na may interest or bibili ako ng lupa sa real estate ng dad ko para mapalago muna. Kaso ang tagal pa nun. Baka kainin na kami ng interest.

Personally, hindi ako makakatulong financially kasi magkakapamilya na ako on my own. Buntis ako and next year ay magkakasariling anak. Sapat lang kinikita namin mag-asawa for us at kung magbabawas pa ako doon, baka possible reason pa na pag-awayan namin mag-asawa yun. Ang maitutulong ko lang ay ayusin yung isa pa nyang business na cellphone shop. Kaso noong in-audit ko yung ngayong buwan, hindi din pala profitable. Inadvisan ko na magbawas ng branch. Kaso sagot nya sakin, anong gagawin ko kung tatanggalin mo pa sakin yan?

Seems like meron syang Sunk Cost Fallacy kaya nabaon sa utang. Gusto ko syang awayin pa, sisihin and all kaso di ko na pwedeng gawin kasi lalala ang depression nya. As of now, kelangan ko din talaga alagaan yung mental health nya kasi unang mga araw no sleep and no eat sya. Napa-check up ko naman sa sleep specialist so naging okay okay na. And sabi ko nalang focus tayo sa solution. Pero sa totoo lang I'm almost giving up as well. Wala talaga akong maisip na solution.

Please do not post this anywhere else.

'Thursday Entry'

“Thursday, Too Loud”

Thursday saunters in, sun heavy on its back
a golden brute, pressing its palm to my brow.
The air hums, thick with leftover dreams.
Lunch has passed
biscuits crumbled, coffee reheated into courage.

Full belly, restless mind.
I drift through the cluttered attic of my head,
where old thoughts chatter like gossiping sparrows
memories knocking their mugs on the table,
demanding to be noticed again.

Outside, the heat argues with the pavement.
Inside, my thoughts argue with each other.
And all I can do is sit here,
sipping the last lukewarm drop of resolve,
hoping the afternoon forgets my name.

I was molested and neglected and bullied and using food as a coping mechanism!! The bullying just made everything worse. People justify torturing fat people by saying it’ll motivate them to lose weight and that’s just… not true for 99% of cases. Hello fellow robots, I'm currently in the 4th year of an honors bachelor of science in forestry. lo and behold, he returns but then he tells me about how he’d like to start another side gig of social media influencing based off of traveling through country B. and as soon as he’s back, he’s booked a trip to another part of the country to explore and vlog it. this got us into an argument because i was really hoping to see him but he’s off…

For context, before Mike she had several boyfriends who were NOT good to her, ranging between financial abuse, cheating, SA, etc etc. when they first started dating; things were really good. But then things started to take a turn.

Last year he ended up getting kicked out of his moms house because they had recently adopted a child into the house and needed his room for the baby, and as he was the oldest and was staying over at our place a lot at the time, it ended up with him moving in with us fully. This was May 2024. In June 2024, Mike and Emily both quit their job and Emily immediately started another, while Mike didn’t have another job lined up. Mike was unemployed from June until December of last year, and during that time he became financially dependant on Emily while also contributing nothing to the house, not updating his resume, not applying anywhere. He just woke up, went on his pc, went to bed. For six months. 

Then, he got a job in December and it lasted until March, where he then quit that and he came to work at the same job as Emily. So then, they both were living together, working together, same days off, so basically together 24/7. Even before this point they were incredibly co-dependant, and this only made it worse.

It would probably make this post hit a character limit if I went into every detail of what he had done to her over the course of that year and a half, but I’ll highlight some things

- Constantly accused her of cheating and wanting to have woohoo with their coworkers, despite the fact that she again literally was never apart from him for more than going to take a piss.
- went through her phone every time she left she room and read her messages, deleted people he didn’t like from her contacts, etc

- constantly made disparaging remarks about her friends, family, and myself and my family despite living in our house

- Didn’t respect her opinion or consent, and would constantly answer for her or speak over her during conversations
- He would constantly give her grief over her music taste and clothing, and whenever she wanted to try something new or go back to something she used to love, he would remark about how she’s “changed.”
- Whenever he would do something he would get angry at her for if she had done it, and she called out his hypocrisy, he would always say that it’s “different” and “it’s different because you’re a woman.”
- He socially isolated her from her friends by controlling her social media presence, gave her grief until she unadded/blocked people he didn’t approve of (that he didn’t go and do that himself for), and stop spending time with people he didn’t approve of. 
- Indirectly s-shamed her multiple times. For things that could not even be imaginable or even understandable. Also to note, the comment “well if you’re not touching me, who are you touching?” 
- in connection to previous point, for other personal reasons too private to share even like this, as well as some mental health stuff, she was not comfortable having woohoo with him for a few months, and he constantly would whine about it and say it’s different because he’s a man and she wouldn’t understand what his needs feel like. 
- He would scream at her
- he slammed objects, doors, her car door, etc whenever he got too angry
- he also would get up and go out on a walk without a word of where he’s going or when he’s going to be back.
- he would blame all of his actions on his anxiety but also refuse to take any accountability or genuinely apologize, while also simultaneously doing nothing about his anxiety. (Won’t get meds or therapy.)
- For months he would make comments about it feeling like they should break up, the relationship is doomed to fail, it’s hopeless, she’d be better off without him, etc

I was raped by hedge fund Two sigma quant (chinese) last year

I’ve been debating for a long time whether to share this, but I think my experience might help someone else—or at least give some clarity to what I’ve been carrying.

The guy who raped me was Chinese and a Yale PhD graduate. I genuinely never imagined something like this could happen with him because he seemed completely normal. Educated, polite, soft-spoken. Nothing about him set off alarm bells.

But the night he took me to his apartment, everything changed. He suddenly dragged me into his bedroom and forced himself on me. I had bruises on my upper arms for days because of how hard he grabbed me. I remember staring at those bruises in the mirror, still in shock, trying to make sense of how someone who appeared so “put together” could do something so violent.

He eventually got fired after I reported what happened, but I’m still dealing with the trauma. I’m in therapy because that night didn’t just end when I walked out of his apartment—it stuck with me.

Part of what still haunts me is the feeling that he targeted me because I wasn’t Chinese and we didn’t have mutual friends or overlapping communities. I genuinely believe he thought no one would ever find out, and that he could get away with it.

I didn’t report him immediately because we lived close to each other, and I was terrified he’d come after me. I was in shock, frozen, and honestly just trying to process what had happened. It’s so easy for people to say “why didn’t you report?” but unless you’ve been in that moment—paralyzed, confused, scared—it’s impossible to explain.

Later on, when I finally shared what happened, I received multiple messages from different people telling me they had similar experiences with him. That broke me even more, realizing this wasn’t some isolated horrible incident. He had a pattern. A hidden one.

I’m sharing this because so many of us suffer in silence thinking it was “just us,” or that nobody would believe us because the person looked respectable on paper. But predators don’t have a “look.” They don’t walk around with labels. Sometimes they’re the ones with degrees, prestigious jobs, and a mask of politeness.

He used to live in Jersey city and recently moved to Connecticut

I hate being a loner but people make me feel lonely

I'm a 37 yo m and I have been lonely my whole life. I'm the youngest of 3 and my siblings are 4 and 6 years older than me. We get along now but growing up, I was left out  a lot. My siblings protected me but  made it clear they didn't want to do much with me. I'd like to say it was age but my brother would  take my cousin that was my age with him on hikes and leave me out.  I grew up up in a very rural and racist town and was the only black kid in my neighborhood. There was another boy (white) around the same age as me and I tried being cordial and making friends but he never seemed interested. My  mother worked her butt off at times having 4 jobs at times leaving me and my sister alone.  We didn't get along much so I spent most of my time online in forums and chat rooms. All my friends were online but I  was still kind of the outsider.

 I had cousins I could hang with once or twice a month but when I was home I just felt so alone. My mom worked her way into a decent paying corporate job and whenever I'd go with her to parties or events with coworkers  I was the only black boy. None of the boys would play with me and I played it off when their parents would ask. I was the darkest of my cousin's and usually ended up the butt of their jokes so I started finding more comfort in solitude. Gaming, making music, and social media were my life and it was comfortable. 

I came into my own in high-school and was a bit of a social butterfly and made two friends that I hung with all the time. I went off to college and they weren't so fortunate so we kind of drifted apart. I made two more new friends in college but we live in different states now and communication is minimal. In my younger friendships, I was the guy with things.  I was the one with a car. I was the one with his own place. I was the one who could pay when they didnt have. I don't  necessarily feel used because they reciprocated things in their own way. However, now that we are all semi successful or at least self sufficient, I hear less from everyone. I always noticed that once my "benefits" were no longer needed, people didn't come around as much.
 

I made friends at my job but was the odd man out. We all used to hang out on our lunches and go to bars together but I found out I wasn't invited to things. Someone in our group got married and I was the only one not invited. There were many other events that I wasn't invited to either. I heard a few of them talking about me one day when they didnt know I was close by. It hurt my feelings but it wasn't a new thing for me.  I gathered up the courage  to come out as bi to the guy i thought was my best friend in the group.   He said he was proud of me but stopped communicating with me as much after that. He was my bestfriend but I guess I wasn't his. I just stopped reaching out to everyone and once again withdrew to myself. 


At one point I just thought it was me but I have been a solid  guy. I'm far from perfect and know i have flaws but I don't talk about people when they are not around and always try to be kind. I have really bad adhd and a bit of dyslexia so sometimes I say dumb things and am sure thats a part of it. However, I am a fairly cerebral guy amd most of the time people came to me for advice or help. I'm always giving, checking in on people to make sure they are OK. I'm there whenever someone is moving, doing large projects for their home,  or is going through something. I went through the hardest time of my life when my ex cheated on me, made me out to be the bad guy for everything but admitted it was all her behind closed doors, and i nearly had a psychotic break. No one called, visited, or checked in on me. 


Everything I've experienced made me think solitude was the right choice. I just expect people to be people. I don't harbor resentment or anger towards anybody and would still be there to help them in a heartbeat. I always try to stay happy. I smile and joke a lot because I want everyone around me to be happy and will continue to be that way. I only occasionally feel sad or depressed when my kids from my previous relationship aren't around.

 I know and accept that life is what it is  but my experiences have slowly calloused me over time making me feel safety in solitude. I've been abandoned and  betrayed too many times for my liking. Getting close to people makes me anxious but I'm still down to try. Sometimes  I feel like I'm just a glutton for pain but I can't help but try to find the good in everyone.

My boyfriend said it was ok to go to my work’s Christmas party and now he’s starting a fight over it

I (26f) go nowhere. I’m LDR with S (33m) and I spend all of my free time either with him (usually gaming or watching YouTube) or reading books or sleeping. That’s it. 

I’ve worked at my company for 3 years and I’ve skipped on the last two Christmas parties due to anxiety and also wanting to spend the Christmas period with my loved ones instead but this year, due to getting closer to some coworkers and just also wanting to try and put myself out there, I decided I wanted to go. 

I back and forth-ed on it for a while and ended up asking S if he would be comfortable with me going. He assured me that as long as I didn’t drink too much and came home instead of staying at a hotel, he’d be ok with it. I don’t drink and I also don’t like sleeping in a bed that isn’t mine if it’s not absolutely necessary so I can very easily keep that promise. 

For the last two weeks, I’ve been trying to figure out what to wear. The dress code is formal/black tie with a mix of Christmas glamour so think just pretty sparkly evening gowns and suits. I have three dresses in my wardrobe that I’ve never worn - two of which are very form fitting and sparkly but aren’t inappropriate. They’re classy and you’d expect them to be worn at the venue under the circumstances. I tried both on for S and he said he didn’t feel comfortable with me wearing either. 

The third dress is a 50s style circular dress that just doesn’t fully fit the vibe and also doesn’t fit me properly anymore due to weight loss and we both agreed no. 

So, I spent HOURS finding a new dress that S liked and we settled on a red satin dress with a low back and cowl neckline. I sent him TONS of options and that was the one he picked. Just to make it clear. 

It came today and I tried it on and showed S. I wasn’t fully happy but I made some temporary adjustments and ended up really liking it. S didn’t really say much which struck me as weird because he usually compliments me a lot when I’m trying things on for him. 

S is now at work and hasn’t been texting me as much as usual. Fine, he’s probably busy. So I’ve been just bugging his DMs like I usually do. 

About ten minutes ago, he texted me to say:

S: I can’t believe you’re going to wear any of those dresses to a work dinner 
Me: wait what?
S: would you like it if I was dressing up to go to a work party? 
Me: i wouldn’t mind if the event was black tie what are you going on about 
S: what about if I was surrounded by girls in those dresses of yours how would you like me going then? 

At this point the conversation got heated and he pretty much told me he doesn’t think I should be trying to dress nicely and thinks I’m trying to impress people? Which is so dumb when the invite says it’s formal wear and glitzy and glamorous. I got mad at him because I spent money I don’t have on this new dress that he said he’d be ok with me wearing. He just started to say how I wouldn’t be comfortable if he went somewhere all dressed up so why should he be and why do I want to show off my body to people in the first place. Just absolute bullshit. 

I have consistently told him if he doesn’t want me to go, I’m happy to respect that and not go. I miss everything to spend time with him so it wouldn’t bother me. He has kept saying he’s fine but now after I’ve spent money on a dress HE picked out for me, he has a problem? 

I told him if he isn’t comfortable with me going he has to tell me tonight so I can back out before it’s too late or I’m going to have to go whether either of us like it or not. 

He won’t text me back now and I’m laying here not knowing wtf to do. 

Why couldn’t he have been honest from the start so I could have said no? If he makes me bail now I’ll have wasted peoples time and money and I’m so upset he basically insinuated my dresses are inappropriate. 

I really fucking hate him right now. We’ve been on such a great run for weeks and it felt like our relationship was finally at a turning point and now he’s back to starting arguments with me and stonewalling me again.

I don’t enjoy being married anymore.

I (28f) have been married to my husband (39m) since 2023 and we’ve been together since 2020. He was married previously and has a child from his first marriage. I hesitated during every “milestone” of our relationship before marriage- making it official, moving in together, getting engaged, and even having a wedding in the first place. My gut told me I wasn’t ready, but, I thought that it would be okay because I knew he was a good person and a good parent. We struggled sometimes with communication and with being accountable with chores or budgeting, but otherwise felt really solid. 

It’s now 2025 and I realized today that I am absolutely exhausted in this marriage. I carry the mental and physical load of chores, budgeting, groceries/meals, and everyone’s emotional well being. Basically, if I don’t do it or ask for it, it doesn’t get done. Sometimes if I do ask for it, it’s done carelessly or isn’t completed or just not with consideration. For example, I was out of town this weekend when a package came in and he texted that it had arrived in a damaged box. I asked him to check and make sure there was nothing wrong with the contents, which he did. But he also threw away the box, the instructions, and in turn, a vital piece of the product that it can’t function without. Honestly, the piece is replaceable- but the carelessness is what has me frustrated. 

On top of all of this, when I bring up wanting things to change in any capacity, even just a suggestion on how something could be put away in a more optimal spot, he shuts down completely and takes it as a blow to his character. In any moment of feedback or conversation, even if it’s solely about my emotions, I find myself comforting him by the end of the conversation with no resolution to my end of the situation. 

I am in no way “perfect”- but I work on myself through therapy and reading materials on relationships (as someone in the therapy field, I learn best this way). I don’t feel that any progress has been made since the first time my unhappiness about the load I feel I am carrying was expressed- and it’s come up time and time again. 

Honestly, I’m not looking for advice. I know there are basically two ways to go: I end it completely and give up, or I offer opportunities to grow and see if it helps…which has proven unsuccessful thus far. I guess I just want to get it out, maybe see if I’m not alone in this.

Once in awhile this feeling overwhelms me and I crash, I start silently tearing up and I start getting mad of my inability to control my emotions.

 I was doing mandatory service for my country of nationality (mandatory military for 2 years like South Korea), I got ripped away from my parents and long time friends in the states. Once I learned to get over the fact that I have to restart my social circle in the country I'm serving, I started getting really good friends and It was one of the best periods of my life until I finished my 2 years of service, I had to let go of them knowing that I probably will never see them anytime soon. I came back home and everyone's changed, my close friends have jobs now, my circle of people had gotten relationships, some of them left the circle and never came back.

I truly realized how lonely I am when I scroll on socials and all of them are having fun doing Halloween things and there's me, going to the gym alone on Halloween. I have never felt so isolated from people. Those 2 years helped me be the independent person I am today but it also made me feel so much more alone than I was before.

The new group of friends I have now I can never truly connect with them the way I connect to all my past friends and people. I tell one of my current friends about how I feel and he gave me all these advices that sounds good and perfect but it didn't help at all.

I have never been diagnosed with anything mental so I don't wanna say I'm depressed without actually being depressed, I understand that there's probably a lot of people having harder lives than me. Idk.. I just felt an overwhelming feeling of loneliness, questioning myself everyday "what should I do right now to kill time", I go on hikes, I go fishing, I hit the gym, those activities felt good at the time then I right back to feeling lonely afterwards. I also no longer find joy in things I used to like: games, playing music, watching anime and random stuff, I also no longer feel any emotions to activities I dread like doing college work, studying. Everything is just numb like I'm just spending time just for the sake of passing time. I'm still physically healthy, workout and eat healthy every single day. I still function perfectly talking and joking to others and having fun.

Anyone that has dealt with extreme loneliness, I would appreciate advices and ways to cope, thanks.

ecommerce store
1-- Overall Architecture
Your website will be built as a three-tier system: the frontend (what users see), the backend (your Django server and APIs), and the data layer (MySQL and external services). Visitors interact with your store through a web browser or mobile device. The browser talks to your NGINX web server, which routes requests to Django. Django runs your Python logic, handles authentication, and communicates with MySQL to read and write account or app data. Payments flow through PayPal-s API, which lives outside your server and handles all card security.
2-- The Web Frontend
Your frontend is the public-facing part of your store - HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It lists your apps (Nutrition, Emojis, Paid Filters, Media Editor, Horoscopes, Charts, and your Video Game) and lets users register, log in, view profiles, and make purchases. When a user clicks -Buy,- your JavaScript code makes an API call (using fetch() or Axios) to your Django REST API endpoint such as /api/create-order/. This frontend never touches the database directly; it always goes through Django-s secure APIs.
3-- Django Application Layer
Your Django server is the heart of the system. It defines URL routes, business logic, and API endpoints using Django REST Framework. Django authenticates users, manages sessions, and connects to your MySQL database through Django-s ORM. When an API request arrives, Django checks credentials, reads or writes data, and formats a JSON response for the frontend. Django also contains app-specific logic - for example, retrieving a user-s Horoscope data, storing Media Editor filters, or managing saved game scores.

15+ Years of “Dysautonomia"? Exercise or Cold Exposure Triggered

37 M. First heart palpitation at 17 — scared the life out of me.
At 23–24, during heavy training, I started waking up at night feeling like I was dying or suffocating. Since then, same pattern: during intense exercise or sudden cold exposure (cold shower, sauna→lake), I get this overwhelming sense my heart can’t handle it. Strong lump in throat, urge to take deep breaths (feels relieving), racing heartbeat, and pure panic like my body’s shutting down.

All tests are spotless: 4x Holters, at least 6 echocardiograms and 7x stress tests, blood pressure monitor, bloodwork — all normal.
Palpitations decreased after quitting nicotine but still show up on bad training days.
If I warm up slowly, I can prevent it sometimes.
Had one POTS-like episode recently (tachycardia/dizziness for about an hour). Called ambulance.

Seen 10+ doctors — cardiologists, neurologists, GPs — said something among the lines "you are fine it's just stress"...
Given the triggers and clean heart results, this sounds like dysautonomia or maybe anxiety. 

Anyone here had the same reaction to exercise or cold?

Did anything actually help calm your system down long-term?

>>33974500

Don't start with the board. Start by sitting and analysing your life in a notepad, identifying areas you want to work on and how you can do that. Create a short, mid and long term goal.

From there decide the purpose of the whiteboard. I have 4 whiteboards.

One is more of a doctrine. A daily reminder of my goals, values and really is more of just a quick glance internal scaffold rather than anything direct. Think of it more like a vibes board to induce daily propagandizing of my brain by reminding me of my game and what I'm trying to achieve.

The second is a more structured and direct attack on the start of my day but if you have a more pressing matter - tailor it to that. I really struggled with daily hygiene for a long time and most mornings would just feel lost in a haze of depression. I have a series of basic steps it's literally "shower, teeth, shave, clean clothes, basic tidy of flat, coffee" and everyday I just look at it and follow in that order. It helps me out massively and is something I identified as a major structural weakpoint in my game. It's more like non-negotiable essentials to get me going every morning.

The third is a to-do list. It's more objective based, I just run it as a list of things I need to get done or to remember. Tasks I'm likely to forget if I don't etc. Useful reference / launch pad for "what do I need to do" shit

Finally number 4 is my daily planner. Every morning I wake up and I list off how I want to structure my day. Sometimes I extend it out a few days so I plan ahead.

I think the videogame stuff would be pretty easy to gamify. You could introduce skill trees and perk progression bars.

I think it's very relative to what games you like playing. I'd say if you gave it some thought and made it personal to you, it's much more likely to stick. I've kinda propagandized myself heavily with near-religious warhammer inspired rhetoric.

Watched the thing and it was very good and made me want to play the game that everyone says is the worse version of werewolf but it's also another multiplayer slop. Yes I would love to play with 15 strangers and have my task completion depend on others. That sounds terrific.

Is My Former Roommate a Psychopath? (Serious question, please no rude comments)

Hi everyone. I’m not a native English speaker — I studied at an Asian university — but everything I’m saying here is true. I just want to describe what happened and ask for opinions about what kind of person this might be.

**1. Borrowing the Phone**  
One time he borrowed my phone. I lent it and stood nearby, not really thinking about it—maybe I did want it back a little because I was going to bed. He looked straight into my eyes and said, “You’re hoping I’ll give it back to you, right?” The tone and stare felt off. I froze, and he repeated it, then gave a slight, curling smirk—as if he had “caught” me.

The message under the words was: *“You’re not as generous as you pretend. I can read your mind, and I’ve just exposed you.”* It felt like gaslighting and a test: when I hesitated, he seemed to take that as proof I was easy to manipulate. This wasn’t an isolated line; it fit a broader pattern. In daily life he was very stingy—he often said, “People are all selfish”—while I’m generally open and willing to help. That contrast is why the same sentence, with that eye contact, tone, and repetition, didn’t land as teasing. It felt targeted.

**2. The Exercise Incident**  
I’ve been weak since I was young, not very strong physically. Once, I tried to lift a water bucket but couldn’t. He didn’t say anything then, but that night he suddenly said, “Woman’s arms.”  
Later, I started exercising, just to improve my health. He probably knew I was working out. One day, I casually showed him my arm — just in a normal, friendly way — and he suddenly said, with a sly tone, “You’ve been secretly training, huh?”  
I froze, not knowing how to react, because I’d never met anyone who said things like that. When he saw my reaction, he looked even more pleased with himself and repeated, “Secretly training, huh,” as if he had once again exposed my inner thoughts.

**3. The Exam Incident**  
Before one exam, I said, “What if I fail this time?” — just talking to myself. The microphone wasn’t even pointed at him. But he suddenly said sharply, “\[My name\], I’m telling you, I don’t care whether you fail or not!”  
He said it in a heavy, almost biting tone, like he was gritting his teeth. I froze. Then he repeated it again, dragging the words out maliciously. I felt very uncomfortable, almost confused. Then he acted like nothing had happened, as if we were still fine, even watching a football game together later.

**4. The Joke Incident**  
Once, I made a simple joke — just an ordinary one. Suddenly, he became extremely angry, like an injured animal. His voice is usually thin, but at that moment he almost roared, “How dare you!”  
I froze again, and he repeated it once more.

**5. The “Murderer” Accusation**  
Later, when we weren’t very close anymore, he suddenly said thoughtfully, “\[My name\], do you think you’ll become like AAA?”  
AAA was a famous murderer who killed his roommate after a small argument — everyone in that country knows about the case. When I didn’t respond, he repeated it again.

**Other Incidents (Not About Me)**

**(a) The Girl’s Teeth**  
Once, we went out to take photos with a girl who doesn’t smile showing her teeth. Later, after we got back, he asked, “Why doesn’t she show her teeth when she smiles?” Someone answered, “Maybe her teeth aren’t good.” Then he said, “So what? My teeth aren’t good either, but I still smile happily!” That was it.

**(b) The Suicide Talk**  
Once, for some reason, the topic of suicide came up. He said, as if talking to himself, “I just can’t understand. Our teacher said, if you have the courage to die, why don’t you have the courage to live?”  
He kept repeating it, not really to discuss it. Later, as if suddenly realizing something, he said, “Ah, I know now — it’s pressure!”

That’s just a small portion of all the things that happened . I had never met someone like this before, and it made me very uncomfortable. These things are already in the past — I’ve left the school — but I still want to ask everyone what you think.  
Please, no unfriendly comments. Thank you.

>>83151126
Tell me one reason you deserve to live

The rich violet of grapes, amethysts, or a "purple" LED is almost never a single wavelength from the spectrum. Instead, it's a mixture of red light (long wavelengths) + blue light (short wavelengths), with little or no green in between.
Our brain interprets that stimulus as "violet" or "purple," even though no single wavelength in the rainbow looks exactly like it.

Almost every color you can be produced by a single wavelength (spectral colors):
650 nm pure red
510 nm pure green
450 nm pure blue
But there is no single wavelength that looks like the vivid magenta-violet you get from mixing red + blue. The closest spectral color in the spectrum is a slightly bluish violet around 400-420 nm, but it's much less saturated and doesn't have that strong reddish component.
That's why some physicists and vision scientists say "purple/violet (as most people know it) has no place on the spectrum" or "purple is not a real color."

Spectral violet (~400 nm) definitely exists - it's the color at the very end of the rainbow.
The brighter, reddish "violet" or purple" most people think of does not correspond to any single wavelength - it's a non-spectral color created by your brain when it gets both long-wave (red) and short-wave (blue/violet) light at the same time.

I’ve been holding this in for years. I need to let it out.

Hi, this is my first time posting anything on any social media, but I really need to get this off my chest. My life feels like it’s been one long battle, and I just want to put it into words.

I was born and raised in a strict, well-to-do Southeast Asian family. I’m 19, 5'7", and a bit obese. I’ve been taunted about my short stature and weight since I was young. I didn’t play any sports, learn any art forms, or pick up any instruments, my parents said all that was a waste of time. They made me study, and only study. I had to be the topper at school.

My classmates made fun of me, and even my parents and siblings sometimes said things that hurt. But it was all okay because I had one best friend. He was the only other A+ student in my grade, and my parents approved of him because of that. He was kind and smart. We studied and laughed together, and though I never told him my problems (I didn’t want to burden him), I felt like he understood me.

My main fear is my dad. First it started with his employees. He hurled verbal abuse at them day and night. He never works out, he is shorter than me, he gets uncontrollably angry at the drop of a hat, he doesn't pray properly, doesnt wake up on time. Yet he taunts and scolds me if I slack, even if it isnt slacking. He insists on the stupidest things, like asking ridiculous puzzles that make no sense and then get angry if you disagree with his "logic". He once beat me because I was seeing some youtube shorts while on a break when I was studying for my mid-terms. He smashed my laptop and started shouting at me, saying how wished such a terrible child shouldn't be born to anyone. How he wished I was dead, rather than decieving my parents, because they thought i was studying. He has a lie detector, but he just assumes youre guilty and you have to accept you were doing what he accuses you of or it gets worse. Like all times when he catches us doing bad things or "lying", he becomes unpredictable and after he has vented out his initial anger, I have to go to him to apologise. I scored 91% in my midterms that year, but he never apologised. 

I have to report everything I do, whom I met, who're my "friends", when I'm going to uni, when i'll be back. They go through my phone and stuff, so I burn my diaries everytime i complete one. I have no privacy. I have to be orthodox, follow stupid beliefs and customs I don't care to follow, keep my beard and body hair and laugh at the misogynistic and unempathetic jokes they make. My parents lack empathy, just enough to get by. I'm trapped, because if I fight, I'll be in a much worse position.

One day when i was in year 11, he was force feeding extra breakfast my sister to the point she was crying. I said with a stern but suggestive tone to let her be if she doesnt wanna eat more. I was slapped so many times that day for "raising my voice" that i still have a loose pre molar on that side. 

When I was in year 6, I got 72/80 on my English exam. But i was scared of my parents. So i hid it. My best friend's mom called that evening for the first time ever. She was bragging about him getting 79 and asked if my mum was happy with mine. That evening I was slapped till I could only hear the ringing. Through my tears I nodded when my father told me I must not hide anything from my parents, even if I get beaten up for it. 

In year 11, as I was going through puberty I started lifting. I had this newfound confidence, in doing something that i loved. My mom forbade me from weight training, saying people die from it and she didn't wanna hear other wise. My dad took my deepening voice and mood swings as a challenge. He beat me up every now and then, whenever he found my "tone" disrespectful. Now I speak in a higher pitch. I stopped using my real deep voice. He mustve thought I was just I was getting "bold", but being old-minded, he doesn't understand puberty hormones, much less relationships and mental health. I can't even think about getting a girfriend. They won't allow me to date because marriages need to be arranged and if they sniff you dating, they might actually unalive me.

I used to love painting. I could draw animal anatomies very well. My parents saw it as a time waste. They said they did not want to see me painting except 30 mins on saturday.

 My mother once made us stand outside at night in the dark, because I kept losing my eraser. I wet my pants that night, but I don't remember any warmth from her.

Lately, my dad has started dumping his business work on me, keeping logbooks, organizing hundreds of files, tracking payments, because he hires unqualified people yet boasts about having 25 employees “he picked from the side of the road" and turned into "excellent workers". I’m struggling to balance his workload with my own university course. I have no time to go out or make friends. I can't go out even if I make friends because thats what "bad children" do.

I dont like being at home, going out with them or call them, because these are the only memories that i have. We had good times too but I dont remember much.

But these days, I have been going through a very difficult patch in life. Naturally the only person I ever share the few thoughts and emotions that I do with is my friend. So i called him a week and a half ago. But he got angry, saying that I'm always self doubting. I wanted him to guess my MBTI (I just got to know what it was), but he said he's the only one who would be friends with me, yet I am always testing him. I didnot want to say anything that might hurt him, so I just said goodnight and hung up. A couple days later, we were on another call, and I thought he might be willing to listen to me this time, maybe he was going through something too. But the first thing he demanded I apologize for making him angry and to persuade him to even talk to me again. It's the first time I heard him say something like that in the 10 years we've been friends. I was so hurt, that I said I needed space. I haven't texted him or called him in a week. He was the only person I trusted, my only safe space. But its so bleak now. I don't know how I'm going to get through college. I’m surrounded by familiar faces, but nobody I truly know. 

I don’t know how to keep going sometimes, but I’m trying. Writing this is the only thing that makes sense right now.

If you’ve read this far, thank you. I don’t really expect advice, just needed to say it somewhere.

I Don't Know What To Do

At the beginning of June, my husband discarded me like a bag of garbage. It was sudden, it was cruel, and none of it made sense to anyone who knew both of us. Not his family, not mine, not our mutual friends. No one. I had noticed his withdrawal earlier in the spring, but he said it was nothing and we went about our business as usual. Our wedding anniversary (1 year, mind you) was pretty meh at best and the vacation we had planned at the end of that month as a belated honeymoon was disaster. He was in a horrid mood the entire time, he looked at me with disgust the only time we had sex (coincidentally, that was the last time we had sex) and overall just was withdrawing from me. 

  
He has a lot of outside shit going on between a high-conflict ex-wife he has to coparent with (he has four kids that I have loved as my own for the last five years) and a violent autistic son. That's just the top two issues, so I thought he was maybe just overwhelmed with it all and we needed some time apart. 

  
I moved the majority of my things out of the house 4th of July weekend. Our house. And the only reason I left was because he threatened to live on the streets if I didn't go and I know a mental health breakdown when I see one, and I didn't want that for the kids. I still have at least one full room of things at our house, I am still on our joint cell phone plan, I still have keys to the house... and I have been maintaining idle hope that we would reconcile. 

  
I want to clarify, he is not a narcissist, though the internet loves that term. He's been acting shameful and hiding not just from me but from most of his family. I have suspected since August that he had another woman on the side and it turns out that my intuition was correct. He moved this woman into our house not long after I left, introduced the kids to her (and my step-daughter texts me regularly about how she misses me and why did I leave), and has been trying to bring her around to the family. 

  
I know his family does not support this. They talk to me regularly. They are how I have confirmation of this. Apparently this woman works with him and speaks very little English. They have to use translation software to speak to each other. We all suspect that he was trying to justify his affair by coming up with petty reasons to separate from me. 

  
I don't know how to come back from this. I want to confront him, but don't because of the kids. They do not deserve this. I don't have the money for an attorney on top of working to get a new apartment (I've been couch surfing with a friend since June, but this is not a long term solution) that allows my animals. I feel sick, stupid, and confused. He is not acting like the man I married. HIs family doesn't understand what he is doing. 

  
I haven't talked to my friends about this because I don't want to make an already shitty situation worse, but I feel so gross. I am successful, I have a great job and I make way more money than he does now. I don't know how to reconcile the man I married, the man I lived with for 5 years and was very much in love with, against whatever he is doing now.

Even if I were to fail (which I know is the most likely outcome), I would be ecstatic and happy, knowing that I at least tried to win your love. I can be at peace then, smiling.

My title would be Master.

What’s the point of this post? I have to share the content of my heart. I have to express my feelings somehow. Hopefully I can have some relief from the hurt.

To everyone who will read, please, before you judge me, realize that I sincerely did try my very bestest and hardest to stop these evil thoughts. But they keep coming back. Put yourself in my shoes, even with all the words I used you can’t know this pain of wanting someone or something and not have it. I feel passively suicidal most of the time

I’m just overwhelmed. I feel stuck. I work in a job I don’t like, with people who don’t like me. It pays more than most places and the benefits are good, and I literally cannot afford to leave. I’m not really qualified for much else. I struggle with making real friendships, I just have no idea how to do it. I’m trying and maybe kind of succeeding but I feel like I’ll just drive them away anyways either by being too annoying or too distant in an effort to not be annoying. The world is overwhelming right now, but selfishly I’m overwhelmed by my own small world and small world problems. 

At the same time, I know I have things to live for. I have a wife who loves me, some people who care about me, I do nice things for myself and others. I feel like a whiney little crybaby because I’m even complaining when SO many people have it worse. Like grow up, honestly. 

Still I can’t help feeling like just not existing would be so much easier. I feel so ill-equipped for life. I’m such a crybaby and I’m so bad at everything I do, but I try really hard and it’s still not enough. Here I am whining again. I really wonder what I’m even worth in the big picture of things. 

And here I am selfish again, even contemplating suicide knowing what that would do to my family and those unfortunate enough to care about me. I feel so guilty feeling this way. But I feel so guilty being alive and being in everyone’s way. I always have a plan, in the back of my head, on how I would do it and it makes me feel guilty and comforted at the same time. 

Life is so hard. And I’m so stupid for saying that, coming from me. Maybe I’m just too soft and stupid. I have to change and I don’t know how. I have to stay alive and I don’t want to. I wish I wasn’t me, I wish I was someone even just a little bit better.

Her parents decided to move to the US. Idk why, I don't think she knew either. As you probably know for immigrants the situation in the US is not the best. Living in absolute CHAOS over SIL’s issues

So my partner (24M) and I (25F) have been together for about 2 years now. In that time, I indirectly moved into his mom’s house since she doesn’t actually reside in the home. It was never really an issue with anyone because I kept to myself, cleaned the house without being told, and would even cook for us and my partner’s sister (26F). I never asked her for a dime for groceries nor did I ever expect her to expect me to pick up after her.

I lost a job earlier in the year and after talking to her, she apologized for letting me do her dishes and chores for so long. I took this as accountability and stopped doing her chores thinking she wanted the responsibility back. Wrong! As soon as I stopped, my partner got asked to no longer keep me in the home if he was not present; a new rule set by his mom. I knew instantly, it was my SIL who called and complained because MIL never had an issue with me. On top of this, MIL imposed a “limit the PDA in front of your sister” rule because SIL is insecure about her lack of a partner.
